name: westminster confession
subject: adocument
definition: Adocument containing a statement of religious doctrine, concocted at a conference ofBritish and continental Protestant divines at Westminster, in the year 1043, whichsubsequently became the basis of the Scotch Presbyterian Church. Wharton.

name: wend
subject: large extent
definition: In old records. A large extent of ground, comprising several juga; a perambulation;a circuit Spelman; Cowell.

name: accounting controls
subject: procedure
definition: Procedures in an organization that protect assets, manage transactions, ensure accuracy, and monitor payments. This all ensures the validity of a companies accounting records. Refer to segregation of duties.

name: accounting controls
subject: procedure
definition: Procedures in an organization that protect assets, manage transactions, ensure accuracy, and monitor payments. This all ensures the validity of a companies accounting records. Refer to segregation of duties.

name: accounting control system
subject: goal
definition: The ways a company control their accounting practices. The goal is to follow rules and procedures, protect the company, and provide timely reports.

name: accounting conservatism
subject: conservative method
definition: A highly scrutinized analysis of loss and revenue. This conservative method prevents loss and increases profit. The reports that result are used to make important decisions.

name: accounts payable turnover
subject: amount
definition: How payments are made to vendors. The amount of purchase and the total in payable ledger is used to calculate this.

name: accounts payable turnover
subject: total
definition: How payments are made to vendors. The amount of purchase and the total in payable ledger is used to calculate this.

name: accounts payable (a/p) to total debt ratio
subject: connection
definition: The connection beween unpaid bills and the companies total debt. If its high more funds should be borrowed. This is reported per accounting period.

name: accounts payable (a/p) to total debt ratio
subject: connection
definition: The connection beween unpaid bills and the companies total debt. If its high more funds should be borrowed. This is reported per accounting period.

name: accounts payable
subject: trade credit
definition: Trade credit created by a supplier when it permits a client to pay in the future for goods or services that have already been delivered by the supplier. Payables are a common source of shortterm financing for many industrial and service companies. A client company is generally required to arrange payment within 7 to 180 days, though in some cases terms may extend even further. In exchange for granting the payment extension, the supplier explicitly or implicitly charges a financing cost. See also ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE.

name: accounting technician
subject: person
definition: This person is not a CPA but can handle certain tasks because they are a member of a professional body.

name: accrual bond
subject: tranche
definition: (1) A TRANCHE of a COLLATERALIZED MORTGAGE OBLIGATION that pays no COUPON interest or PRINCIPAL until all other tranches have been redeemed; this protects investors holding other tranches from PREPAYMENTS. The accrual bond is similar to a zero coupon bond but carries an explicit coupon rate and may ultimately pay both principal and coupons prior to final maturity. (2) A ZERO COUPON BOND. (1) Also known as ZBOND.ACCRUAL NOTE See RANGE FLOATER NOTE.

name: accretive acquisition
subject: company
definition: An acquisition that will increase the companies EPS in the report period. It is because a company with a higher P/E buys a lower P/E company.

name: accredited advisor in insurance
subject: agent
definition: An agent who has passed three tests in insurance. The tests are administered by the insurance institute of america.

name: accredited
subject: agent
definition: An agent who has the necessary qualities to become certified.

name: accrued interest
subject: accumulate
definition: The interest on a BOND or LOAN that has been earned but not yet paid. Interest payable/receivable accumulates between COUPON payment periods; once a periodic interest payment is made, accrued interest reverts to zero and begins building on a daily basis until the next payment. Accrued interest of a FIXED INCOME instrument can be computed via: where C is the coupon, AD is the actual number of days that have elapsed since the last coupon, and n is number of days in the coupon period. See also CLEAN PRICE, DIRTY PRICE.ACCUMULATED DIVIDEND A DIVIDEND that has been declared, but not yet paid, to investors holding CUMULATIVE PREFERRED STOCK. No dividends are payable to holders of COMMON STOCK until accumulated dividends have been paid. Since accumulated dividends are contractually owed to investors, they are reflected as a LIABILITY on the issuer

name: accumulation unit
subject: trust
definition: A trust or mutual fund when divident income is reinvested to increase the amount of the total investment.

name: accumulation unit
subject: income
definition: A trust or mutual fund when divident income is reinvested to increase the amount of the total investment.

name: accumulation period
subject: time annuitant
definition: The amount of time an insurance policy is complete and no more claims can be made. Or the time when an annuitant makes a payment to the annuity guarantor.

name: accumulated fund
subject: extra income
definition: A fund for a nonprofit. Extra income over expenses are added to the fund and payments taken out.

name: accumulated fund
subject: extra income
definition: A fund for a nonprofit. Extra income over expenses are added to the fund and payments taken out.

name: acknowledged instrument
subject: person
definition: The document that is recognised formally before an authorised official. The person who acknowledges the instrument says that it is authentic and has been executed  freely and voluntarily.

name: acquisition
subject: company
definition: The purchase of one company by another in order to fulfill particular strategic goals related to revenues, market share, product/ service offerings, or competition. An acquisition may be structured as a stock acquisition, where the acquiring company offers investors in the target company a specific price for their COMMON STOCK, or an asset acquisition, where the acquiring company offers to buy a portion or majority of the target company

name: acquired knowledge
subject: external firm
definition: When an external firm is hired to gain knowledge.

name: acrobat reader
subject: software
definition: Software used to read and print documents. The files are in a PDF format.

name: actio bone fidei
subject: action
definition: Latin phrase. An action of good faith or a group of actions where the judge is authorised to take into account equitable considerations.

name: actio aestimatoria; actio quanti minoris
subject: two names
definition: Two names of an action which lay in behalf of a buyer to reduce the contract price, not to cancel the sale; the judex had power, however, to cancel the sale. Hunter, Rom. Law, 332

name: actio realis
subject: term in the civil law
definition: A real action. The proper term in the civil law was rci vindieatio. Inst. 4, 0. 3.

name: acting
subject: term
definition: A term employed to designate a locum tennis who is performing the duties of an office to which he does not himself claim title; c. g., “Acting Supervising Archi

name: actio noxalis
subject: master
definition: A noxal action ; an action which lay against a master for a crime committed or injury done by his slave; and in which the master had the alternative either to pay for the damage done or to deliver up the slave to the complaining partv. Inst. 4, 8, pr.; Ileinecc. Elein. lib. 4. tit. S. So called from noxa, the offense or injury committed. Inst. 4. 8, 1.

name: actio judicati
subject: which judge
definition: An action instituted, after four months had elapsed after the rendition of judgment, in which the judge issued his warrant to seize, first, the movables, which were sold within eight days afterwards; and then the immovables, which were delivered in pledge to the creditors, or put under the care of a curator, and if, at the end of two mouths, the debt was not paid, the land was sold. Dig. 42, 1; Code, 8. 34.

name: actio rerum amotaruin
subject: action
definition: An action for things removed; an action which, in cases of divorce, lay for a husband against a wife, to recover things carried away by the latter, in contemplation of such divorce. Dig. 25, 2; Id. 25, 2, 25, 30. It also lay for the wife against the husband in such cases. Id. 25, 2, 7, 11; Cod. 5, 21.

name: actionable fraud
subject: essential ingredient
definition: Deception practiced in order to induce another to part with property or surrender some legal right; a false representation made with an iutention to deceive; may be committed by stating what is known to be false or by professing knowledge of the truth of a statement which is false, but in either case, the essential ingredient is a falsehood uttered with intent to deceive. Marsh v. Falker, 40 N. Y. 575; Farrington v. Bullard, 40 Barb. (N. Y.) 512; Ilecht v. Metzler, 14 Utah, 408, 48 Pac. 37. 00 Am. St. Rep. 900; Sawyer v. Prickett, 19 Wall. 140, 22 L. Ed. 105.

name: actionable
subject: action
definition: That for which an action will lie; furnishing legal ground for an action.

name: action of abstracted multures
subject: action
definition: An action for multures or tolls against those who are thirled to a mill, i. e., bound to grind their corn at a certain mill, and fail to do so. Bell.

name: action of a writ
subject: phrase
definition: A phrase used when a defendant pleads some matter by which he shows that the plaintiff had no cause to have the writ sued upon, although it may be that he is entitled to another writ or action for the same matter. Cowelh

name: action of a writ
subject: plaintiff
definition: A phrase used when a defendant pleads some matter by which he shows that the plaintiff had no cause to have the writ sued upon, although it may be that he is entitled to another writ or action for the same matter. Cowelh

name: active customers
subject: customer
definition: A customer who has visited a firm or used its products in the year. They will buy again likely.

name: active customers
subject: customer
definition: A customer who has visited a firm or used its products in the year. They will buy again likely.

name: active
subject: active debt
definition: That is in action; that demands action ; actually subsisting; the opposite of passive. An active debt is one which draws interest. An active trust is a confidence connected with a duty. An active use is a present legal estate.

name: actions rescissory
subject: writing
definition: In Scotch law. These are either (1) actions of proper improbation for declaring a writing false or forged; (2) actions of reduction-improbation for the production of a writing in order to have it set aside or its effect ascertained under the certification that the writing if not produced shall be declared false or forged; and (3) actions of simple reduction, for declaring a writing called for null until produced. Ersk. Prin. 4, 1, 5.

name: activity based costing (abc)
subject: product
definition: Matching cost to activity. Any product uses activities, resources, and costs. This model was developed by Robert Kaplan and Robin Cooper in the late 1980s.

name: activity based costing (abc)
subject: product
definition: Matching cost to activity. Any product uses activities, resources, and costs. This model was developed by Robert Kaplan and Robin Cooper in the late 1980s.

name: active trust
subject: trust fund trustee
definition: A trust fund where the trustee has active duties. These duties can be handling assets, collections, and sales. AKA special trust. Refer to bare trust.

name: acton burnel, statute of
subject: statute
definition: In English law. A statute, otherwise called “Slatutum de ilcrcatoribus,” made at a parliament held at the castle of Acton Burnel in Shropshire, in the 11th year of the reign of Edward I. 2 Reeves, Eng. Law, 158-102.

name: acton burnel, statute of
subject: statute
definition: In English law. A statute, otherwise called “Slatutum de ilcrcatoribus,” made at a parliament held at the castle of Acton Burnel in Shropshire, in the 11th year of the reign of Edward I. 2 Reeves, Eng. Law, 158-102.

name: activity status
subject: stage activity
definition: A stage where an activity has not yet begun, started activities are continuing, or an activity is complete.

name: activity ratios
subject: ratio
definition: Ratios of finance measuring how well a firm uses assets.

name: activity level
subject: object
definition: How an object uses company assets to complete.

name: activity level
subject: object
definition: How an object uses company assets to complete.

name: activity duration
subject: zero
definition: The time to finish an activity. If a zero is the duration its a milestone.

name: actual cash value policy
subject: insurer
definition: Homeowners insurance that allows insurer to deduct depreciation from replacement cots when paying a claim. Refer to market value policy.

name: actual violence
subject: assault
definition: An assault with actual violence is an assault with physical force put in action, exerted upon the person assailed. The term violence is synonymous with physical force, and the two are used interchangeably in relation to assaults. State v. Wells. 31 Conn. 210.

name: actual turnover
subject: time person
definition: How many times a person spends their money in a period of time.

name: actus me invito factus non est mens actus
subject: act
definition: An act done by me, against my will, is not my act. Branch, Princ.

name: ad litem
subject: guardian ad litem
definition: For the suit; for the purposes of the suit; pending the suit. A guardian ad litem is a guardian appointed to prosecute or defend a suit on behalf of a party incapacitated by infancy or otherwise.

name: ad largum
subject: ire ad
definition: At large; at liberty; free, or unconfined. Ire ad largutn, to go at large. Plowd. 37. At large; giving details, or particulars; in extenso. A special verdict was formerly called a verdict at large. Plowd. 92.

name: ad interim
subject: officer
definition: In the mean time. An officer ad interim is one appointed to fill a temporary vacancy, or to discharge the duties of the office during the absence or temporary incapacity of its regular incumbent.

name: ad hoc
subject: attorney ad hoc
definition: For this; for this special purpose. An attorney ad hoc, or a guardian or curator ad hoc, is one appointed for a special purpose, generally to represent the client or infant in the particular action in which the appointment is made. Sallier v. Rosteet. 108 La. 37S, 32 South. 3S3; Bienvenu v. Insurance Co., 33 La. Ann. 212.

name: ad hoc
subject: guardian
definition: For this; for this special purpose. An attorney ad hoc, or a guardian or curator ad hoc, is one appointed for a special purpose, generally to represent the client or infant in the particular action in which the appointment is made. Sallier v. Rosteet. 108 La. 37S, 32 South. 3S3; Bienvenu v. Insurance Co., 33 La. Ann. 212.

name: ad hoc
subject: curator ad hoc
definition: For this; for this special purpose. An attorney ad hoc, or a guardian or curator ad hoc, is one appointed for a special purpose, generally to represent the client or infant in the particular action in which the appointment is made. Sallier v. Rosteet. 108 La. 37S, 32 South. 3S3; Bienvenu v. Insurance Co., 33 La. Ann. 212.

name: ad quod damnum
subject: king
definition: The name of a writ formerly issuing from the English chancery, commanding the sheriff to make in- | quiry “to what damage” a specified act, if done, will tend. Ad quod damnum is a writ which ought to be sued before the king grants certain liberties, as a fair, market, or such like, which may be prejudicial to others, and thereby it should be inquired whether it will be a prejudice to grant them, and to whom It will be prejudicial, and what prejudice will come thereby. There is also another writ of ad quod damnum, if any one will turn a common highway and lay out another way as beneficial. Terines de la Ley.

name: ad questiones facti non respondent
subject: jndice ad qnestione
definition: jndices; ad qnestiones legis non respond- J ent juratores. Judges do not answer questions of fact; juries do not answer questions of law. 8 Coke, 30S; Co. Litt. 295.

name: ad pages sold
subject: firm
definition: The page views on an ad that a firm has sold to an advertiser. AKA the sell through rate.

name: adawlut
subject: adaw- lut
definition: Corrupted from Adalat, justice, equity; a court of justice. The terms “Dewanny Adawlut” and “Foujdarry Adaw- lut” denote the civil and criminal courts of justice in India. Wharton.

name: adaptive exponential smoothing
subject: variation
definition: A prediction techinique that uses seasonal variations. The variations become a coefficient and is applied to the calculations in the company. It is an extended version of exponential smoothing.

name: adaptability
subject: way company
definition: The way a company or entity reacts to change. It requires learning and competition.

name: adaptability
subject: entity
definition: The way a company or entity reacts to change. It requires learning and competition.

name: ad vitam aut culpam
subject: phrase
definition: For life or until fault. This phrase describes the tenure of an office which is otherwise said to be held “for life or during good behavior.” It is equivalent to quamdiu bene se gcsscrit.

name: additional insured
subject: policy
definition: When a policy covers more than one insured party. They are added by signing or being referred to in the defintion.

name: additional death benefit
subject: special situation
definition: An extra payment made on the event of death in life insurance. This is done if a special situation takes place at a speficic time.

name: addiction
subject: stopping use
definition: Becoming over dependant on a drug or habit. Stopping use causes withdrawl symptoms. Its a chronic disease that requires life long care. Any excessive craving.

name: added damages
subject: added damage
definition: Damages that are added on to the amount that is actually due or damages that are added as a punishment for the defendant. Added damages is sometimes called smart money.

name: address for service
subject: document
definition: An address that is given to deliver legal documents. If the document is delivered to that address its considered delivered to the party.

name: additive alternate bid
subject: bid
definition: A bid adds more to the quoted price if a change to the work is accepted.

name: adequate protection
subject: debtor
definition: When a debtor in bankruptcy provides some type of collateral to protect a claim holder from depreciation, pending the formulation of a repayment plan. Pending that plan, the debtor has continued possession or use of the collateral.

name: adequate protection
subject: plan debtor
definition: When a debtor in bankruptcy provides some type of collateral to protect a claim holder from depreciation, pending the formulation of a repayment plan. Pending that plan, the debtor has continued possession or use of the collateral.

name: adequate protection
subject: plan debtor
definition: When a debtor in bankruptcy provides some type of collateral to protect a claim holder from depreciation, pending the formulation of a repayment plan. Pending that plan, the debtor has continued possession or use of the collateral.

name: adequacy of coverage
subject: coverage
definition: Deciding the value of an asset to protect it from loss. The coverage is insurance.

name: adjonrnamentnm est ad diem dicere seu diem dare
subject: adjournment
definition: An adjournment is to appoint a day or give a day. 4 Inst. 27. Hence the formula “cat sine die.”

name: adit
subject: water
definition: In mining law. A lateral entrance or passage into a mine; the opening by which a mine is entered, or by which water and ores are carried away; a horizontal excavation in and along a lode. Electro- Magnetic M. & D. Co. v. Van Auken, 9 Colo. 204, 11 Pac. 80; Gray v. Truby, 6 Colo. 278.

name: adit
subject: ore
definition: In mining law. A lateral entrance or passage into a mine; the opening by which a mine is entered, or by which water and ores are carried away; a horizontal excavation in and along a lode. Electro- Magnetic M. & D. Co. v. Van Auken, 9 Colo. 204, 11 Pac. 80; Gray v. Truby, 6 Colo. 278.

name: adhocism
subject: company
definition: An organizations management style that doesn’t plan ahead, responding to only urgent situations, and focuses on fire fighting. This is the way the company sets their goals. Refer to adhocracy.

name: adhesive
subject: bonding agent
definition: A synthetic bonding agent to attach two surfaces. One that is made from animal or plant substances is ‘glue.’

name: adhesive
subject: one
definition: A synthetic bonding agent to attach two surfaces. One that is made from animal or plant substances is ‘glue.’

name: adjudication of bankruptcy
subject: judgment
definition: The judgment or decree of a court having jurisdiction, that a person against whom a petition in bankruptcy has been filed, or who has filed his voluntary petition, be ordered and adjudged to be a bankrupt.

name: adjudication of bankruptcy
subject: decree
definition: The judgment or decree of a court having jurisdiction, that a person against whom a petition in bankruptcy has been filed, or who has filed his voluntary petition, be ordered and adjudged to be a bankrupt.

name: adjudication contra hasreditatem jaccnteju
subject: causa purpose
definition: When a debtor’s heir apparent renounces the succession, any creditor may obtain a decree cwjuitiunis causa, the purpose of which is that the amount o

name: adjusted breakeven
subject: investor
definition: A measure of the number of years it takes for an investor to recover the initial CONVERSION PREMIUM paid when purchasing a CONVERTIBLE BOND, after accounting for the fact that the investor may purchase more COMMON STOCK than represented by the CONVERSION RATIO. Adjusted breakeven is typically computed as: where Convprem is the conversion premium, C is the COUPON, PCB is the price of the convertible bond, S is the price of the common stock, and DPS is DIVIDENDS per share. See also EQUIVALENT BREAKEVEN, SIMPLE BREAKEVEN.ADJUSTMENTBONDABOND issued as a RECAPITALIZATION instrument by a company in FINANCIAL DISTRESS, often as an INCOMEBOND that only pays investors COUPON interest as earnings permit.

name: adjusted breakeven
subject: price
definition: A measure of the number of years it takes for an investor to recover the initial CONVERSION PREMIUM paid when purchasing a CONVERTIBLE BOND, after accounting for the fact that the investor may purchase more COMMON STOCK than represented by the CONVERSION RATIO. Adjusted breakeven is typically computed as: where Convprem is the conversion premium, C is the COUPON, PCB is the price of the convertible bond, S is the price of the common stock, and DPS is DIVIDENDS per share. See also EQUIVALENT BREAKEVEN, SIMPLE BREAKEVEN.ADJUSTMENTBONDABOND issued as a RECAPITALIZATION instrument by a company in FINANCIAL DISTRESS, often as an INCOMEBOND that only pays investors COUPON interest as earnings permit.

name: adjusted breakeven
subject: dps
definition: A measure of the number of years it takes for an investor to recover the initial CONVERSION PREMIUM paid when purchasing a CONVERTIBLE BOND, after accounting for the fact that the investor may purchase more COMMON STOCK than represented by the CONVERSION RATIO. Adjusted breakeven is typically computed as: where Convprem is the conversion premium, C is the COUPON, PCB is the price of the convertible bond, S is the price of the common stock, and DPS is DIVIDENDS per share. See also EQUIVALENT BREAKEVEN, SIMPLE BREAKEVEN.ADJUSTMENTBONDABOND issued as a RECAPITALIZATION instrument by a company in FINANCIAL DISTRESS, often as an INCOMEBOND that only pays investors COUPON interest as earnings permit.

name: adm’r
subject: abbreviation
definition: This abbreviation will be Judicially presumed to mean “administrator.” Moseley v. Mastin, 37 Ala. 210, 221.

name: adlamwr
subject: proprietor
definition: In Welsh law. A proprietor who, for some cause, entered the service of another proprietor, and left him after the expiration of a year and a day. lie was liable to the payment of 30 pence to his patron. Wharton.

name: adjutant general
subject: person
definition: This person is the chief administrative officer of the Army.

name: adjustment policies
subject: government
definition: When the government helps reduce or get rid of debt owed.

name: adjustment income
subject: inheritor
definition: A policy that affords a living to the inheritor in the event of the death of the insured until the inheritor can maintain a living on their own.

name: adjustment bond
subject: bankruptcy
definition: Bonds that are issued and recapitalized when a firm is failing and ready to declare bankruptcy replacing existing bonds held by shareholders.

name: administration suit
subject: suit
definition: In English practice. A suit brought In chancery, by any one interested, for administration of a decedent’s estate, when there is doubt as to its solvency. Stimson.

name: administration of estates
subject: management
definition: The management and settlement of the estate of an intestate, or of a testator who has no executor, performed under the supervision of a court, by a person duly qualified and legally appointed, and usually involving (1) the collection of the decedent’s assets; (2) payment of debts and claims against him and expenses ; (3) distributing the remainder of the estate among those entitled thereto. The term is applied broadly to denote the management of an estate by an executor, and also the management of estates of minors, lunatics, etc., in those cases where trustees have been appointed by authority of law to take charge of such estates in place of the legal owners. Bouvier; Crow v. Ilubard, 02 Md. 505. Administration is principally of the following kinds, viz.: Ad colligendum bona dcfuncti. To collect the goods of the deceased. Special letters of administration granted to one or more persons, authorizing them to collcct and preserve the goods of the deceased, are so called. 2 Bl. Comm. 505; 2 Steph. Comm. 241. These are otherwise termed “letters ad colligendum,” and the party to whom they are granted, a “collector.” An administrator ad colligendum is the mere agent or officer of the court to collect and preserve the goods of the deceased until some one is clothed with authority to administer them, and cannot complain that another is appointed administrator in chief. Flora v. Menace, 12 Ala. 830. Ancillary administration is auxiliary and subordinate to the administration at the place of the decedent’s domicile; it may be taken out in any foreign state or country where assets are locally situated, and is merely for the purpose of collecting such assets and paying debts there.

name: administration of estates
subject: settlement
definition: The management and settlement of the estate of an intestate, or of a testator who has no executor, performed under the supervision of a court, by a person duly qualified and legally appointed, and usually involving (1) the collection of the decedent’s assets; (2) payment of debts and claims against him and expenses ; (3) distributing the remainder of the estate among those entitled thereto. The term is applied broadly to denote the management of an estate by an executor, and also the management of estates of minors, lunatics, etc., in those cases where trustees have been appointed by authority of law to take charge of such estates in place of the legal owners. Bouvier; Crow v. Ilubard, 02 Md. 505. Administration is principally of the following kinds, viz.: Ad colligendum bona dcfuncti. To collect the goods of the deceased. Special letters of administration granted to one or more persons, authorizing them to collcct and preserve the goods of the deceased, are so called. 2 Bl. Comm. 505; 2 Steph. Comm. 241. These are otherwise termed “letters ad colligendum,” and the party to whom they are granted, a “collector.” An administrator ad colligendum is the mere agent or officer of the court to collect and preserve the goods of the deceased until some one is clothed with authority to administer them, and cannot complain that another is appointed administrator in chief. Flora v. Menace, 12 Ala. 830. Ancillary administration is auxiliary and subordinate to the administration at the place of the decedent’s domicile; it may be taken out in any foreign state or country where assets are locally situated, and is merely for the purpose of collecting such assets and paying debts there.

name: administered price
subject: firm management
definition: The price a firm’s management decides to charge. There are no negotiations to get to this figure.

name: adminicular evidence
subject: such as is
definition: Ill ecclesiastical law. Auxiliary or supplementary evidence; such as is presented lor the purpose of explaining and completing other evidence.

name: admeasurement of dower
subject: dower- ess
definition: In practice. A remedy which lay for the heir on reaching his majority to rectify an assignment of dower made during his minority, by which the dower- ess had received more than she was legally entitled to. 2 Bl. Comm. 130; Gilb. Uses, 379. In some of the states the statutory proceeding enabling a widow to compel the assignment of dower is called “admeasurement of dower.”

name: administrative receiver
subject: official
definition: When an official appointed by a higher power takes over a company including its debt.

name: administrative lag
subject: organization
definition: The time it takes for an organization to recognize the problem and than solve it.

name: administrative dissolution
subject: government
definition: When the government closes down an organization. This is due to lack of cooperation in requirements.

name: administrative change
subject: change
definition: A change to contract that does not affect any parties rights.

name: admission board
subject: party
definition: An organization’s group that allows or denies together if another party can buy rights to be a member. This person may be a shareholder.

name: administrator’s deed
subject: holder
definition: When a property is given to the next of kin by way of a deed to the property. The holder of the deed owns the property.

name: admonition
subject: latter
definition: In ecclesiastical law, this is the lightest form of punishment, consisting in a reprimand and warning administered by the judge to the defendant. If the latter does not obey the admonition, he may be more severely punished, as by suspension, etc.

name: admonitio trina
subject: threefold
definition: A triple c r threefold warning, given, in old times, to a prisoner standing mute, before he was subjected to the peine forte ct dure. 4 Bl. Comm. 325 ; 4 Steph. Comm. 391.

name: admitted company
subject: company
definition: When an insurance company can write policy for other states. The company must be approved to act in each state they wish to work in.

name: adstipulator
subject: accessory party
definition: In Roman law. An accessory party to a promise, who received the same promise as his principal did, and could equally receive and exact payment; or lie only stipulated for a part of that for which the principal stipulated, and then his rights were coextensive with the amount of his own stipulation. Sandars, Just. Inst. (5th Ed.) 348.

name: adrogation
subject: adoption
definition: In the civil law. The adoption of one who was impubes; that is, if a male, under fourteen years of age; if a female, under twelve. Dig. 1, 7, 17, 1.

name: adrift
subject: anthony
definition: Sea-weed, between high and low water-mark, which has not been deposited on the shore, and which during flood-tide is moved by each rising and receding wave, is adrift, although the bottom* of the mass may touch the beach. Anthony v. Gifford, 2 Allen (Mass.) 549.

name: adpromissor
subject: guarantor surety
definition: In the civil and Scotch law. A guarantor, surety, or cautioner ; a peculiar species of fidejussor; one who adds his own promise to the promise given by the principal debtor, whence the name.

name: adpromissor
subject: specie
definition: In the civil and Scotch law. A guarantor, surety, or cautioner ; a peculiar species of fidejussor; one who adds his own promise to the promise given by the principal debtor, whence the name.

name: advance option
subject: advance option
definition: A shortterm LINE OF CREDIT granted by an UNDERWRITER to an issuer of securities that can be drawn if the underwriter cannot successfully place the securities. The advance option thus guarantees the issuer access to shortterm funds regardless of the relative success of the NEW ISSUE.

name: adultery
subject: adultery
definition: Adultery is the voluntary sexual intercourse of a married person with a person other than the offender’s husband or wife. Civil Code Cal.

name: advena
subject: one
definition: In Roman law. One of foreign birth, who lias left his own country and settled elsewhere, and who has not acquired citizenship in his new locality; often called albanus. Du Cange.

name: advancement of charges
subject: pay
definition: When a service provider pays small charges for a customer who will pay the debt later.

name: advance refunding
subject: exchange
definition: An exchange of outstanding GOVERNMENT BONDS for a NEW ISSUE of securities prior to final maturity of the original issue, typically arranged to take advantage of a lower INTEREST RATE environment.

name: adverse claim
subject: sheriff
definition: A claim set up by a stranger to goods upon which the sheriff has levied an execution ex attachment

name: adverse balance of trade
subject: company
definition: When a company has more profit in import than export.

name: adversary system
subject: defense attorney
definition: The court system where a judge decides on a case argued by a prosecutor who is suing the plaintiff and the defense attorney who defends their plaintiff. A jury has also been used to decide such cases. AKA accusatorial procedure. Refer to inquisitorial sy

name: adversary proceedings
subject: action in law
definition: Any action in law where there are opposing parties.

name: advergame
subject: purpose
definition: A video game with advertisements in it. Some games sole purpose is to advertise. Other times a sponsor is advertised. The internet has helped raise this type of advertisement.

name: adventurer
subject: person
definition: A person who takes a risk in a business venture or a person promoting a mine or a person who owns shares in a mine.

name: adventure, bill of
subject: writing
definition: In mercantile law. A writing signed by a merchant, stating that the property in goods shipped in his name belongs to another, to the adventure or chance of which the person so named is to stand, with a covenant from the merchant to account to him for the produce.

name: adventure, bill of
subject: writing
definition: In mercantile law. A writing signed by a merchant, stating that the property in goods shipped in his name belongs to another, to the adventure or chance of which the person so named is to stand, with a covenant from the merchant to account to him for the produce.

name: advertisements of qtjeen elizabeth
subject: queen
definition: Certain articles or ordinances drawn up by Archbishop Parker and some of the bishops in 1504, at the request of Queen Elizabeth, the object of which was to enforce decency and uniformity in the ritual of the church. The queen subsequently refused to give her official sanction to these advertisements, and left them to be enforced by the bishops under their general powers. Phillim. Ecc. Law, 910; 2 Prob. Div. 270; Id. 354.

name: adverse witness
subject: witness
definition: A witness who gives negative evidence against the party who called them as a witness. Refer to hostile witness.

name: adverse trustee
subject: employee
definition: A party related to a person owning a trust. Or an employee who has interest in the company trust.

name: adverse opinion
subject: audit opinion
definition: An AUDIT OPINION by an external auditor indicating that a company

name: advertising elasticity of demand
subject: amount demand
definition: The amount demand changes prices for goods and services. If the item costs less more are sold. It it cost more less are sold and the price goes up.

name: advisor account
subject: account
definition: An account managed by the customer who takes advise from their broker.

name: adviser
subject: party
definition: A party who gets a fee for managing a mutual fund. Its usually less than one percent of the assets value. AKA advising bank.

name: advised
subject: court
definition: Prepared to give Judgment, after examination and deliberation. “The court took time to be advised.” 1 Leon. 187.

name: advice of acceptance
subject: receipt
definition: A receipt from a collecting bank proving the original bank has paid its debt and the amounts paid.

name: advice of acceptance
subject: receipt
definition: A receipt from a collecting bank proving the original bank has paid its debt and the amounts paid.

name: advice of acceptance
subject: original bank
definition: A receipt from a collecting bank proving the original bank has paid its debt and the amounts paid.

name: advice of acceptance
subject: original bank
definition: A receipt from a collecting bank proving the original bank has paid its debt and the amounts paid.

name: advocate, queen’s
subject: member
definition: A member of the College of Advocates, appointed by letters patent, whose office is to advise and act as counsel for the crown in questions of civil, canon, and international law. His rank is next after the solicitor general.

name: advocate, queen’s
subject: member
definition: A member of the College of Advocates, appointed by letters patent, whose office is to advise and act as counsel for the crown in questions of civil, canon, and international law. His rank is next after the solicitor general.

name: aerobic
subject: activity
definition: A term meaning that an activity requires oxygen to complete its work. Refer to anearobic.

name: aerobic
subject: activity
definition: A term meaning that an activity requires oxygen to complete its work. Refer to anearobic.

name: advowson presenta- tive
subject: usual kind
definition: The usual kind of advowson, where the patron has the right of presentation to the bishop, or ordinary, and moreover to demand of him to institute his clerk, if he finds him canon- ically qualified. 2 Bl. Comm. 22; 1 Crabb, Real Prop. p. 131,

name: advowson donative
subject: patron
definition: Where the patron has the right to put his clerk in possession by his mere gift, or deed of donation, without any presentation to the bishop, or institution by him. 2 Bl. Comm. 23; 1 Crabb, Real Prop. p. 131,

name: advowee, or avowee
subject: person
definition: The person or patron who has a right to present to a benefice. Fleta, lib. 5, c. 14.

name: advowee, or avowee
subject: patron
definition: The person or patron who has a right to present to a benefice. Fleta, lib. 5, c. 14.

name: affectus
subject: one
definition: Disposition; intention, impulse or affection of the mind. One of the causes for a challenge of a juror is propter affectum, on account of a suspicion of bias or favor. 3 Bl. Comm. 363; Co. Litt. 156.

name: affectio tua nomen imponit operi tuo
subject: disposition
definition: Your disposition (6r intention) gives name (or character) to your work or act. Bract, fol. 26. 1016.

name: affiliate marketing
subject: site
definition: Marketing on websites to target specific groups. The site with the ad can get a commission from a sale made from their ad. Refer to affiliate model.

name: affile
subject: term
definition: A term employed in old practice, signifying to put on file. 2 Maule & S. 202. In modern usage it is contracted to file.

name: affidavit of merits
subject: defendant
definition: One setting forth that the defendant has a meritorious defense (substantial and not technical) and stating the facts constituting the same. Palmer v. Rogers, 70 Iowa, 381, 30 N. W. 645.

name: affidavit of merits
subject: defendant
definition: One setting forth that the defendant has a meritorious defense (substantial and not technical) and stating the facts constituting the same. Palmer v. Rogers, 70 Iowa, 381, 30 N. W. 645.

name: affidavit of defense
subject: defendant
definition: An affidavit stating that the defendant has a good defense to the plaintiff’s action on the merits of the case.

name: affidavit of defense
subject: defendant
definition: An affidavit stating that the defendant has a good defense to the plaintiff’s action on the merits of the case.

name: affinity card
subject: percentage
definition: A credit card that an organization promotes. A percentage is paid to the promoter in commission.

name: affine pricing
subject: price
definition: When a price has an initial charge with per unit cost added to it.

name: affirmative defense
subject: complaint
definition: In code pleading. New matter constituting a defense ; new matter which, assuming the complaint to be true, constitutes a defense to it. Carter v. Eighth Ward Bank, 33 Misc. Rep. 128, 07 N. Y. Supp. 300.

name: affirmation of fact
subject: statement
definition: the statement the confirms the details of the contract or the transaction and is not just an opinion being expressed.

name: affirmation
subject: witness
definition: In practice. A solemn and formal declaration or asseveration that an affidavit is true, that the witness will tell the truth, etc., this being substituted for an oath in certain cases.

name: affreightment
subject: contract of affreightment
definition: A contract of affreightment is a contract with a ship-owner to hire his ship, or part of it, for the carriage of goods. Such a contract generally takes the form either of a charter-party or of a bill of lading. Maude & P. Mer. Shipp. 227; Smith, Merc. Law, 295; Bramble v. Culmer, 78 Fed. 501, 24 C. C. A. 182; Auten v. Bennett, 88 App. Div. 15, 84 N. Y. Supp. 689. In French law, freighting and affreighting are distinguished. The owner of a ship freights it, (le frete;) he is called the freighter, (frcteur;) he is the letter or lessor, (locateur, locator.) The merchant affreights (af- frete) the ship, and is called the affreighter, (affretcur;) he is the hirer, (locataire, conductor.) Emerig. Tr. des Ass. c. 11,

name: affreightment
subject: contract
definition: A contract of affreightment is a contract with a ship-owner to hire his ship, or part of it, for the carriage of goods. Such a contract generally takes the form either of a charter-party or of a bill of lading. Maude & P. Mer. Shipp. 227; Smith, Merc. Law, 295; Bramble v. Culmer, 78 Fed. 501, 24 C. C. A. 182; Auten v. Bennett, 88 App. Div. 15, 84 N. Y. Supp. 689. In French law, freighting and affreighting are distinguished. The owner of a ship freights it, (le frete;) he is called the freighter, (frcteur;) he is the letter or lessor, (locateur, locator.) The merchant affreights (af- frete) the ship, and is called the affreighter, (affretcur;) he is the hirer, (locataire, conductor.) Emerig. Tr. des Ass. c. 11,

name: affordable method
subject: budget method
definition: A budget method used to decide how much they can afford to spend on marketing. Refer to adaptive control method, competitive parity method, objectives and task method, and pertentage of sales method.

name: affordability
subject: resource
definition: When an acquisition is analyzed and is deemed to be worth the resources it takes to manage it.

name: after sight
subject: fact
definition: This term as used in a bill payable so many days after sight, means after legal sight: that is, after legal presentment for acceptance. ‘Hie mere fact of having seen the bill or known of its existence does not constitute legnl “sight.” Mitchell v. Degrand, 17 Fed. Cas. 494.

name: after sight
subject: bill
definition: This term as used in a bill payable so many days after sight, means after legal sight: that is, after legal presentment for acceptance. ‘Hie mere fact of having seen the bill or known of its existence does not constitute legnl “sight.” Mitchell v. Degrand, 17 Fed. Cas. 494.

name: after sight
subject: know
definition: This term as used in a bill payable so many days after sight, means after legal sight: that is, after legal presentment for acceptance. ‘Hie mere fact of having seen the bill or known of its existence does not constitute legnl “sight.” Mitchell v. Degrand, 17 Fed. Cas. 494.

name: against the box
subject: holder
definition: When a holder in long position sells the very same stock from the company.

name: afternoon
subject: word
definition: This word has two senses. It may mean the whole time from noon to midnight; or it may mean the earlier part of that time, as distinguished from the evening. When used in a statute its meaning must be determined by the context and the circumstances of the subject- matter. Reg. v. Knapp, 2 EL. & Bl. 451.

name: agency by appointment
subject: entity
definition: When an entity is made agent to act on anothers behalf.

name: aged assets
subject: aged assets
definition: ASSETS held for resale by a BANK or SECURITIES FIRM that have been owned for a long period of time (i.e., many months). Aged assets may indicate misvaluation.

name: age setback
subject: mean
definition: Assuming women live longer than men. This means they will pay more premiums and thusly a discount is given for this.

name: age setback
subject: mean
definition: Assuming women live longer than men. This means they will pay more premiums and thusly a discount is given for this.

name: age of reason
subject: age
definition: The age of 18 when a person is considered able to know right from wrong. They are considered an adult now. Refer to legal age.

name: age of capacity
subject: person
definition: When a person reaches 18 years of age. This is the legal adult age. Refer to legal age.

name: agency shop clause
subject: union members
definition: When union members must pay a fee monthly. It is for employees of a company that requires employees to join the union.

name: agency security
subject: security
definition: In the United States, NOTES or BONDS issued by governmentsponsored or governmentguaranteed institutions (e.g., FEDERAL NATIONAL MORTGAGE ASSOCIATION, GOVERNMENT NATIONAL MORTGAGE ASSOCIATION, FEDERAL HOME LOAN MORTGAGE CORPORATION). The securities carry explicit or implicit government support related to PRINCIPAL and interest payments, and thus carry the strongest CREDIT RATINGS. Agency securities, which are issued with short to longterm maturities and fixed or floating coupons, are exempt from REGISTRATION requirements established by the SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION.

name: agency security
subject: security
definition: In the United States, NOTES or BONDS issued by governmentsponsored or governmentguaranteed institutions (e.g., FEDERAL NATIONAL MORTGAGE ASSOCIATION, GOVERNMENT NATIONAL MORTGAGE ASSOCIATION, FEDERAL HOME LOAN MORTGAGE CORPORATION). The securities carry explicit or implicit government support related to PRINCIPAL and interest payments, and thus carry the strongest CREDIT RATINGS. Agency securities, which are issued with short to longterm maturities and fixed or floating coupons, are exempt from REGISTRATION requirements established by the SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION.

name: agency problem
subject: abuse of power
definition: When an abuse of power is used to benefit the agent not the company.

name: agency of record
subject: advertising agency
definition: When an advertising agency can buy space for the advertiser.

name: agency in fact
subject: agency
definition: the agency that happens where there is an agreement between the agent and the principal.

name: agency costs
subject: agency costs
definition: Direct and indirect costs arising from the separation of ownership (i.e., COMMON STOCK shareholders) and control (i.e., DIRECTORS and managers) that ultimately lead to a reduction in ENTERPRISE VALUE. Agency costs can include the expenses associated with implementing processes for monitoring, reporting, and auditing.

name: agent’s lien
subject: agent
definition: When an agent has ownernship of their controled parties goods.

name: agent for service of process
subject: officer
definition: An officer who gets all the legal notices in the company. AKA registered agent.

name: aggregate excess of loss reinsurance
subject: agreement reinsurer
definition: A REINSURANCE agreement where the REINSURER provides the CEDING INSURER with coverage on a large number of small losses arising from multiple policies, once an agreed ATTACHMENT point has been reached.

name: aggressor
subject: party
definition: The party who first offers violence or offense. He who begins a quarrel or dispute, either by threatening or striking another.

name: aggressor
subject: party
definition: The party who first offers violence or offense. He who begins a quarrel or dispute, either by threatening or striking another.

name: agnati
subject: cognate
definition: In Roman law. The term included “all the cognates who trace their connection exclusively through males. A table of cognates is formed by taking each lineal ancestor in turn and including all his descendants of both sexes in the tabular view. If, then, in tracing the various branches of such a genealogical table or tree, we stop whenever we come to the name of a female, and pursue that particular branch or ramification no further, all who remain after the descendants of women have been excluded are agnates, and their connection together is agnatic relationship.” Maine, Anc. Law, 142. All persons are agnatically connected together who are under the same patria potestas.

name: agistor
subject: one
definition: One who takes in horses or other animals to pasture at certain rates. Story, Bailm.

name: agistor
subject: one
definition: One who takes in horses or other animals to pasture at certain rates. Story, Bailm.

name: agistor
subject: one
definition: One who takes in horses or other animals to pasture at certain rates. Story, Bailm.

name: agreement of sale
subject: contract
definition: the contract used to purchase something that is to be carried out some time in the future where the owner has agreed to sell and purchaser has agreed to buy.

name: agreed amount clause
subject: rule
definition: A rule that states insurance and coinsurance must be the same amount.

name: aids
subject: benevolence
definition: In feudal law, originally mere benevolences granted by a tenant to his lord, in times of distress; but at length the lords claimed them as of right They were principally three: (1) To ransom the lord’s person, if taken prisoner; (2) to make tiie lord’s eldest son and heir apparent a knight; (3) to give a suitable portion to the lord’s eldest daughter on her marriage. Abolished by 12 Car. II. c. 24. Also, extraordinary grants to the crown by the house of commons, and which were the origin of the modern system of taxation. 2 Bl. Comm. 03, 64.

name: aided recall
subject: subject
definition: Testing ads for their memorability. A subject is shown an ad and asked what they remembe about it. They are also asked if they saw it before.

name: aid prayer
subject: proceeding
definition: In English practice. A proceeding formerly made use of, by way of petition in court, praying in aid of the tenant for life, etc., from the reversioner or remainder- man, when the title to the inheritance was in question. It was a plea in suspension of the action. 3 Bl. Comm. 300.

name: air freight consolidator
subject: company
definition: When a company gives shipments but does not own their own plane. They take the goods and bring them to the aircraft. An air waybill proves the shipment was received. A tracking number as well is given by the actual carrier.

name: air emissions
subject: chimney
definition: When pollutants are released into the atmosphere by a source. A car or factory chimney can be a source.

name: airport transfer
subject: hotel
definition: A drop off or pick up sevice that a hotel or tour offers airport customers.

name: airport transfer
subject: tour
definition: A drop off or pick up sevice that a hotel or tour offers airport customers.

name: airpass
subject: tourist
definition: A fare allowing a tourist to travel a country for a certain time.

name: air travel card
subject: airline
definition: When an airline gives a credit card for use of buying tickets.

name: ajournment
subject: document
definition: In French law. The document pursuant to which an action or suit is commenced, equivalent to the writ of summons in England. Actions, however, are in some cases commenced by requite or petition. Arg. Fr. Merc. Law, 545.

name: albus liber
subject: book
definition: The white book; an ancient book containing a compilation of the law and customs of the city of Loudon. It has lately been reprinted by order of the master of the rolls.

name: algarum maris
subject: corruption
definition: Probably a corruption of Laganum maris, lagan being a right, in the middle ages, like jetsam and flotsam, by which goods thrown from a vessel in distress became the property of the king, or the lord on whose shores they were stranded. Spelman; Jacob; Du Cange.

name: alfet
subject: criminal
definition: A cauldron into which boiling water was poured, in which a criminal plunged his arm up to the elbow, and there held it for some time, as an ordeal. Du Cange.

name: alimony
subject: alimony
definition: The allowance made to a wife out of her husband’s estate for her support, either during a matrimonial suit, or at its termination, when she proves herself entitled to a separate maintenance, and the fact of a marriage is established. Alimony is an allowance out of the husband’s estate, made for the support of the wife when living separate from him. It is either temporary or permanent. Code Ga. 1SS2,

name: all
subject: term
definition: Collectively, this term designates the whole number of particulars, individuals, or separate items; distributively. it may be equivalent to “each” or “every.” State v. Maine Cent. R. Co., 66 Me. 510; Sherburne v. Sischo, 143 Mass. 442, 9 N. E. 797.

name: allegata
subject: word
definition: In Roman law. A word which the emperors formerly signed at the bottom of their rescripts and constitutions; under other instruments they usually wrote signata or testata. Enc. Loud.

name: allegata
subject: word
definition: In Roman law. A word which the emperors formerly signed at the bottom of their rescripts and constitutions; under other instruments they usually wrote signata or testata. Enc. Loud.

name: all time order
subject: order
definition: An order for a good thats in its last stage and is going to be discontinued. The order must be big enough to satisfy demand.AKA life of type order.

name: all the traffic will bear
subject: excessive charge
definition: An excessive charge that is still within the customers pay range. This makes the price as high as is possible without going past a predetermined limit.

name: all purpose statement
subject: reader
definition: A report that fits requirement of readers. The readers can be creditors or company members just to name two. It is filed with all purpose statements.

name: all purpose statement
subject: reader
definition: A report that fits requirement of readers. The readers can be creditors or company members just to name two. It is filed with all purpose statements.

name: allergic reaction
subject: body
definition: An unusual responce to an allergen. The body is attempting to fight off the strange substance. It can be mild or severe. Refer to intolerance.

name: allegiance
subject: ry allegiance
definition: Ry allegiance is meant the obligation of fidelity and obedience which the individual owes to the government under which he lives, or to his sovereign in return for the protection he receives. It may be an absolute and permanent obligation, or it may be a qualified and temporary one. The citizen or subject owes an absolute and permanent allegiance to his government or sovereign, or at least until, by some open and distinct act, he renounces it and becomes a citizen or subject of another government or another sovereign. The alien, while domiciled in the country, owes a local and temporary allegiance, which continues during the period of his residence. Carlisle v. U. S

name: allegiance
subject: individual
definition: Ry allegiance is meant the obligation of fidelity and obedience which the individual owes to the government under which he lives, or to his sovereign in return for the protection he receives. It may be an absolute and permanent obligation, or it may be a qualified and temporary one. The citizen or subject owes an absolute and permanent allegiance to his government or sovereign, or at least until, by some open and distinct act, he renounces it and becomes a citizen or subject of another government or another sovereign. The alien, while domiciled in the country, owes a local and temporary allegiance, which continues during the period of his residence. Carlisle v. U. S

name: allonge
subject: indorsement
definition: When the indorsements on a bill or note have filled all the blank space, it is customary to annex a strip of paper, called an “allonge,” to receive the further Indorsements. Fountain v. Bookstaver, 141 III. 4G1, 31 N. E. 17; Haug v. Itilev, 101 Ga. 372. 29 S. E. 44, 40 L. It. A. 244; Bishop v. Chase. 150 Mo. 158, 56 S. W. 10S0, 79 Am. St. Rep. 515.

name: allocutus
subject: proceed
definition: In criminal procedure, when a prisoner is convicted on a trial for treason or felony, the court is bound to demand of him what he has to say as to why the court should not proceed to judgment against him; this demand is called the “allocutus,” or “allocution,” and is entered on the record. Archb. Crim. Pi. 173; State Y. Ball, 27 Mo. 324.

name: allocutus
subject: proceed
definition: In criminal procedure, when a prisoner is convicted on a trial for treason or felony, the court is bound to demand of him what he has to say as to why the court should not proceed to judgment against him; this demand is called the “allocutus,” or “allocution,” and is entered on the record. Archb. Crim. Pi. 173; State Y. Ball, 27 Mo. 324.

name: allocation of resources
subject: cost
definition: Seeing how scarce a resource really is amont the company. The costs are analyzed to provide goods and services. It measures how efficient the economy is and reduces loss.

name: alloy steel
subject: steel
definition: When an iron based alloy has silicon, copper, manganese, and tungsten added to it to make a steel. Any steel with non standard amounts of the above elements is carbon steel.

name: alloy
subject: coining amount
definition: An inferior or cheaper metal mixed with gold or silver in manufacturing or coining. As respects coining, the amount of alloy is fixed by law, and is used to increase the hardness and durability of the coin.

name: allowance method
subject: rule
definition: When a rule is made to cover debts with a percent of profits. Any loss or excess in the next period will taken care of in the next period. The other method is called direct write off method.

name: allowance method
subject: loss
definition: When a rule is made to cover debts with a percent of profits. Any loss or excess in the next period will taken care of in the next period. The other method is called direct write off method.

name: allowance method
subject: excess
definition: When a rule is made to cover debts with a percent of profits. Any loss or excess in the next period will taken care of in the next period. The other method is called direct write off method.

name: allowability
subject: cost
definition: A cost that is reasonable, alloccabile, fits the GAAP, and fits contract terms.

name: allotment note
subject: writing
definition: In English law. A writing by a seaman, whereby he makes an assignment of part of his wages in favor of his wife, father or mother, grandfather or grandmother, brother or sister. Every allotment note must be in a form sanctioned by the board of trade. The allottee, that is, the person in whose favor it is made, may recover the amount in the county court. Mozley & Whitley.

name: alphabet stock
subject: separate classes
definition: Separate classes of COMMON STOCK issued by a company, where each class (often denoted by a letter of the alphabet) represents a different subsidiary. Investors in an alphabet stock receive the RENT RIGHTS and CONTROL RIGHTS associated with that stock, but not those of the overarching parent company. See also CLASSIFIED STOCK.

name: alphabet stock
subject: investor
definition: Separate classes of COMMON STOCK issued by a company, where each class (often denoted by a letter of the alphabet) represents a different subsidiary. Investors in an alphabet stock receive the RENT RIGHTS and CONTROL RIGHTS associated with that stock, but not those of the overarching parent company. See also CLASSIFIED STOCK.

name: alternate legacy
subject: legacy
definition: the legacy of the will maker or testator who gives one of two or more things without actually designating which one.

name: alternate legacy
subject: maker
definition: the legacy of the will maker or testator who gives one of two or more things without actually designating which one.

name: alternate legacy
subject: testator
definition: the legacy of the will maker or testator who gives one of two or more things without actually designating which one.

name: alternate hypothesis
subject: original
definition: The accepted hypothesis if the original is proven incorrect.

name: alterins circumventio alii non prse- bet actionem
subject: deceiving
definition: The deceiving of one person does not afford an action to another. Dig. 50, 17, 49.

name: alternative minimum tax (amt)
subject: rich parties
definition: The way US taxes make sure rich parties pay a minimum despite breaks. They must file with and without breaks and pay the highest tax.

name: alternative hypothesis
subject: chosen hypothesis
definition: The chosen hypothesis when the original is proven wrong.

name: alternative futures
subject: anything
definition: The idea that anything has more than one path it can take in its lifetime. Foresight and decision making change the path.

name: amanuensis
subject: one
definition: One who writes on behalf of another that which lie dictates.

name: amanuensis
subject: one
definition: One who writes on behalf of another that which lie dictates.

name: altman zscore
subject: measure
definition: Edward Altman’s way to file bankruptcy. It measures how well a party can pay debts and prevent insolvency.

name: altman zscore
subject: party
definition: Edward Altman’s way to file bankruptcy. It measures how well a party can pay debts and prevent insolvency.

name: altius tollendi
subject: servitude
definition: In the civil law. A servitude which consists in the right, to him who is entitled to it, to build his house as high as he may think proper. In general, however, every one enjoys this privilege, unless he Is restrained by some contrary title. Sandars, Just. Inst 119.

name: alternative writ
subject: person
definition: A writ commanding the person against whom it is issued to do a specified thing, or show cause to the court why he should not be compelled to do it. Allee v. McCoy, 2 Marv. (Del.) 405, 30 Atl. 350.

name: alternative tariff
subject: shipper
definition: When a shipper can choose the freight rates when they have two or more are available.

name: ambiguity upon tlie factum
subject: particular clause
definition: An ambiguity in relation to the very foundation of the instrument itself, as distinguished from an ambiguity in regard to the construction of its terms. The term is applied, for instance, to a doubt as to whether a testator meant a particular clause to be a part of the will, or whether it was introduced with his knowledge, or whether a codicil was meant to republish a former will, or whether the residuary clause was accidentally omitted. Fatherly v. Fatherly, I Cold. (Tenn.) 461, 465, 78 Am. Dec. 499.

name: ambiguity upon tlie factum
subject: codicil
definition: An ambiguity in relation to the very foundation of the instrument itself, as distinguished from an ambiguity in regard to the construction of its terms. The term is applied, for instance, to a doubt as to whether a testator meant a particular clause to be a part of the will, or whether it was introduced with his knowledge, or whether a codicil was meant to republish a former will, or whether the residuary clause was accidentally omitted. Fatherly v. Fatherly, I Cold. (Tenn.) 461, 465, 78 Am. Dec. 499.

name: ambiguity principle
subject: insure
definition: In insurance a rule that words must be clear and favor the the firm. The insured has no input on the contract.

name: amended bill of lading (b/l)
subject: term
definition: When the terms of a B/L has condition changes but the charges are not changed. Refer to corrected bill of lading.

name: ambulatory will
subject: right testator
definition: the right a testator has that enables them to change a will.

name: american conference of governmental industrial hygienists (acgih)
subject: limit
definition: A government agency that controls work exposure for chemicals and other agents. The limits are followed world wide.

name: american college
subject: agent
definition: A school that researches life insurance and publishes the results for the public to read. Agents can also continue their education here.

name: american breakfast
subject: hotel
definition: When a hotel offers breakfast. It includes 2 eggs, bacon or sausage, bread or toast, jelly, butter, pancakes, cereal, coffee, tea, and juice. AKA american style breakfast. Refer to continental breakfast and english breakfast.

name: american arbitration association
subject: organisation
definition: a voluntary and non-profit organisation that has a panel of arbitrators who hear labour and other sorts of disputes.

name: american agency system
subject: independent agents
definition: When independent agents sell insurance for a bigger company. AKA independent agency system.

name: american service
subject: hotel
definition: The way a hotel or restaurant serves its customers. Portions of food are plated in the kitchen by employees and served individually by a member of serving staff. Refer to english service and french service.

name: american service
subject: restaurant
definition: The way a hotel or restaurant serves its customers. Portions of food are plated in the kitchen by employees and served individually by a member of serving staff. Refer to english service and french service.

name: american recovery and reinvestment act
subject: congress
definition: When congress passed a bill of 32 billion in recovery funds to help struggling states and prevent unemployment from harming the economy. Police and fire services were also aided. It was done to stimulate the economy and improve home sales. College costs w

name: amitinus
subject: child
definition: The child of a brother or sister; a cousin; one who has the same grandfather, but different father and mother. Calvin.

name: amitinus
subject: child
definition: The child of a brother or sister; a cousin; one who has the same grandfather, but different father and mother. Calvin.

name: amitinus
subject: child
definition: The child of a brother or sister; a cousin; one who has the same grandfather, but different father and mother. Calvin.

name: amotion
subject: ouster
definition: A putting or turning out; dispossession of lands. Ouster is an amotion of possession. 3 Bl. Comm. 399, 208. A moving or carrying away; the wrongful taking of personal chattels. Archb. Civil PI. Introd. c. 2,

name: amortization table
subject: each payment
definition: A chart of amortization payment on a big loan on a fixed period in installments. Each payment takes off principal and interest. It shows both interest and principal paid to date.

name: analog to digital (ad) conversion
subject: digitizer
definition: This is needed for computers or data use over digital media. Digitizers and chips do the conversion.

name: analog to digital (ad) conversion
subject: chip
definition: This is needed for computers or data use over digital media. Digitizers and chips do the conversion.

name: anafhroeisia
subject: impotentia
definition: In medical jurisprudence. Impotentia cceundi; frigidity; incapacity for sexual intercourse existing in either man or woman, and in the latter case sometimes called “dyspareunia.”

name: ancient deed
subject: nothing
definition: A deed 30 years old and shown to come from a proper custody and having nothing suspicious about it is an “ancient deed” and may be admitted in evidence without proof of its execution. Havens v. Seashore Land Co., 47 N. J. Eq. 305. 20 Atl. 497; Davis v. Wood. 101 Mo. 17. 01 S. W. 095

name: anchorage
subject: prestation
definition: In English law. A prestation or toll for every anchor cast from a ship in a port; and sometimes, though there be no anchor. Hale, de Jure Mar. pt. 2, c. 0. See 1 W. Bl. 413 et seq.; 4 Term. 2G2.

name: anchorage
subject: toll
definition: In English law. A prestation or toll for every anchor cast from a ship in a port; and sometimes, though there be no anchor. Hale, de Jure Mar. pt. 2, c. 0. See 1 W. Bl. 413 et seq.; 4 Term. 2G2.

name: ancillary administration
subject: decedent
definition: When a decedent leaves property in a foreign state, (a state other than that of his domicile.) administration may be granted in such foreign state for the purpose of collecting the assets and paying the debts there, and bringing the residue into tiie general administration. This is called “ancillary” (auxiliary, subordinate) administration. Pisano v. Shanlev Co., 00 N. .T. Law. 1. 48 Atl. 01S: In re Gable’s Estate. 79 Iowa. 17R. 44 N. W. 352. 9 L. II. A. 218; Steele v. Insurance Co.. supra.

name: angylde
subject: e. price
definition: In Saxon law. The rate fixed by law at which certain injuries to person or property were to be paid for; in injuries to the person, it seems to be equivalent to the “were,” i. e., the price at which every man was valued It seems also to have been the fixed price at which cattle and other goods were received as currency, and to have been much higher than the market price, or ceap gild. Wharton.

name: animus hominis est anima script!
subject: intention
definition: The intention of the party is the soul of the Instrument. 3 Bulst. 07; Fitm. Prin. & Sur. 2G. In order to give life or effect to an instrument, it is essential to look to the intention of the individual who executed it

name: animus defamandi
subject: phrase
definition: The intention of defaming. The phrase expresses the malicious intent which is essential in every ease of verbal injury to render it the subject of an action for libel or slander.

name: animus revertendi
subject: man
definition: The intention of returning. A man retains his domicile if he leaves it animo rcvertrndi. In re Miller’s Estate, 3 Rawle (Pa.) 312. 24 Am. Dec. 345 ; 4 Bl. Comm. 225; 2 Russ. Crimes, 18: Poph. 42. 52; 4 Coke, 40. Also, a term employed in the civil law, in expressing the rule of ownership in tamed animals.

name: announcement
subject: statement
definition: A statement made official by press. It can be damage control or a new product. Refer to press release.

name: annual income
subject: annual income
definition: Annual income is annual receipts from property. Income means that which comes in or is received from any business, or investment of capital, without reference to the outgoing expenditures. Betts v. Betts, 4 Abb. N. C. (N. Y.) 400.

name: annual wage reporting (awr)
subject: tax
definition: How employers report wages paid and tax withheld to the SSA. The W2 form is used for this. The SSA takes this data and credits the company.

name: annus luctus
subject: widow
definition: The year of mourning. It was a rule among the Romans, and also the Danes and Saxons, that widows should not marry infra annum luctus, (within the year of mourning.) Code 5, 9, 2; 1 Bl. Comm. 457.

name: annus est mora motus quo suum plan- eta pervolvat circulum
subject: year
definition: A year is the duration of the motion by which a planet revolves through its orbit. Dig. 40, 7, 4, 5; Calvin.; Bract. 3596.

name: annuity unit
subject: withdrawl
definition: When a party starts making payments from a retirement fund but keeps contributing to it at the same time. A withdrawl is the only transaction registered.

name: antapocha
subject: transcript
definition: In the Roman law. A transcript or counterpart of the instrument called “apoclia.” signed by the debtor and delivered to the creditor. Calvin.

name: antapocha
subject: counterpart
definition: In the Roman law. A transcript or counterpart of the instrument called “apoclia.” signed by the debtor and delivered to the creditor. Calvin.

name: ansel, ansul, or auncel
subject: ancient mode
definition: In old English law. An ancient mode of weighing by hanging scales or hooks at either end of a beam or staff, which, being lifted with one’s finger or hand by the middle, showed the equality or difference between the weight at one end and the thing weighed at the other. Termes de la Ley, 60.

name: ansel, ansul, or auncel
subject: ancient mode
definition: In old English law. An ancient mode of weighing by hanging scales or hooks at either end of a beam or staff, which, being lifted with one’s finger or hand by the middle, showed the equality or difference between the weight at one end and the thing weighed at the other. Termes de la Ley, 60.

name: anonymous ftp
subject: public section
definition: A way to download files from the internet without a password. The public section is used to access the data. Anonymous can be a username as well. The users email and password can also be used. They cannot send files or access the nonpublic areas of the si

name: anonymizing
subject: email
definition: Hiding the source of an email causing the email to be an anonymous message.

name: anti manifesto
subject: term
definition: A term used in International law to denote a proclamation or manifesto published by one of two belligerent powers, alleging reasons why the war Is defensive on its part.

name: antejuramentum
subject: both accuser
definition: In Saxon law. A preliminary or preparatory oath, (called also “prwjuramcntum,” and “juramcntum calumnicB,”) which both the accuser and accused were required to make before any trial or purgation; the accuser swearing that he would prosecute the criminal, and the accused making oath on the very day that he was to undergo the ordeal that he was innocent of the crime with which he was charged. Whishaw.

name: antejuramentum
subject: accuse
definition: In Saxon law. A preliminary or preparatory oath, (called also “prwjuramcntum,” and “juramcntum calumnicB,”) which both the accuser and accused were required to make before any trial or purgation; the accuser swearing that he would prosecute the criminal, and the accused making oath on the very day that he was to undergo the ordeal that he was innocent of the crime with which he was charged. Whishaw.

name: antigreenmail provision
subject: manager
definition: A clause in a charter that prevents buyback of stockshared for the board of directors. Managers cannot buy back stock at premiums because of greenmail.

name: antigraphtjs
subject: officer duty
definition: In Roman law. An officer whose duty It was to take care of tax money. A comptroller.

name: antiglobalization
subject: individual
definition: An economic movement that is not fond of capitalism or globalization. They feel that an individual can reach goals without the negative effects of capitalism. The emphasis is on economic efficiency and human decency rather than corporate obsession with pr

name: antidilution clause
subject: stockholder
definition: A rule that stops a firm from giving more stock without letting stockholders to buy the new shares first. It is done to keep stockholders percentage of ownership intact.

name: anticipatory breach of contract
subject: contract
definition: the failure to perform a promise that is in a contract before the contract has had a chance to go into effect.

name: anytoany distributed computing
subject: logical connections
definition: The structure of an online market that computers use to communicate with other computer systems. Logical connections are made rather than wired ones.

name: anyoccupation policy
subject: person
definition: An idea that defines disability in respect to insurance and those who are not able to work anymore. The person can get benefits only if they remain disabled.

name: any-and-all bid
subject: investor
definition: A TAKEOVER mechanism where a company seeking to acquire a target firm agrees to pay the same price for any shares that are tendered. The anyandall bid stands in contrast to the TWOTIER BID, where investors receive an inducement PREMIUM for tendering their shares by an initial cutoff date.

name: anton piller order
subject: plaintiff
definition: When the plaintiff must allow a defendant on their property, view evidence, and answer questions of the court. It is for copyright issues mostly. It’s goal is to prevent evidence from being destroyed. It’s not a search warrant but it must be followed. Its

name: api gravity
subject: scale
definition: Its the scale used to show the lightness or heaviness of a crude product. Liquid hydrocarbons are also measured on this scale.

name: apparent agency
subject: party
definition: Conduct by an AGENT that causes another party to believe the agent is authorized to conduct business on behalf of a PRINCIPAL, whether or not that is the case. A principal may be legally bound by apparent agency. See also ACTUAL AUTHORITY, EXPRESS AUTHORITY.APPORTIONMENT The practice of dividing an INSURED

name: apparent agency
