definition: Conduct by an AGENT that causes another party to believe the agent is authorized to conduct business on behalf of a PRINCIPAL, whether or not that is the case. A principal may be legally bound by apparent agency. See also ACTUAL AUTHORITY, EXPRESS AUTHORITY.APPORTIONMENT The practice of dividing an INSURED

name: apparent maturity
subject: apparent maturity
definition: The apparent maturity of a negotiable instrument payable at a particular time is the day on which, by its terms, it becomes due. or, when tliat is a holiday, the next business day. Civil tiode Cal.

name: apparator
subject: sheriff
definition: A furnisher or provider. Formerly the sheriff, in England, had charge of certain county affairs and disbursements, in which capacity he was called “apparator eomitutus,” and received therefor a considerable emolument. Cowell.

name: apparator
subject: capacity
definition: A furnisher or provider. Formerly the sheriff, in England, had charge of certain county affairs and disbursements, in which capacity he was called “apparator eomitutus,” and received therefor a considerable emolument. Cowell.

name: apostata capiendo
subject: writ
definition: An obsolete English writ which issued against an apostate, or one who had violated the rules of his religious order. It was addressed to the sheriff, and commanded him to deliver the defendant into the custodv of the abbot or prior. Reg. Orig. 71, 207; Jacob; Wharton.

name: apostata
subject: apostate deserter
definition: In civil and old English law. An apostate; a deserter from the faith; one who has renounced the Christian faith. Cod. 1, 7; Reg. Orig. 716.

name: appearance day
subject: cru- ger
definition: The day for appearing: that on which the parties are hound to come into court. Cru- ger v. McCracken (Tex. Civ. App.) 26 S. W. 282.

name: appearance by attorney
subject: appearance by attorney
definition: This term and “appearance by counsel” are distinctly different. the former being the substitution of a legal agent for the personal attendance of the suitor, the latter the attendance of an advocate without whose aid neither the party attending nor his attorney in his stead could safely proceed ; and an appearance by attorney does not supersede the appearance by counsel. Mercer v. Watson. 1 Watts (Pa.) 351.

name: apparura
subject: in old english law apparura
definition: In old English law the apparura were furniture, implements, tackie, or apparel. Carucarum, apparura, plow- tackle. Cowell.

name: apparura
subject: in old english law apparura
definition: In old English law the apparura were furniture, implements, tackie, or apparel. Carucarum, apparura, plow- tackle. Cowell.

name: applet
subject: java

name: appellor
subject: criminal
definition: In old English law. A criminal who accuses his accomplices, or who challenges a jury.

name: appellee
subject: party
definition: The party in a cause against whom an appeal is taken; that is, the party who has an interest adverse to setting aside or reversing the judgment. Slayton v. Horsey, 97 Tex. 341, 78 S. W. 919. Sometimes also called the “respondent” In old English law. Where a person charged with treason or felony pleaded guilty and turned approver or “king’s evidence,” and accused another as his accomplice in the same crime, in order to obtain his own pardon, the one so accused was called the “appellee.” 4 Bl. Comm. 330.

name: application service provider (asp)
subject: network
definition: A company that provides computer services to their clients. The network is used to access software that the client needs for its use.

name: application server
subject: computer
definition: A computer that has app programs to serve the client computer when the request is put in by other network users.

name: application program
subject: slang term
definition: A program that is complete and performs its task but does not perform maintenance. The slang term for this is an app. AKA application software.

name: applicatio est vita regulse
subject: application
definition: Application is the life of a rule. 2 Bulst. 79.

name: apportum
subject: which thing
definition: In old English law. The revenue, profit, or emolument which a thing brings to the owner. Commonly applied to a corody or pension. Blount.

name: appointed actuary
subject: insurance companies
definition: A party that insurance companies appoint to document liability.

name: appraisal value
subject: that appraiser
definition: An opinion that an appraiser gives for the worth of property. The factors that go into this are location, area, improvements, and amenities. The three methods to do this are cost approach, income approach, adn market comparison approach. AKA appraised val

name: appraisal right
subject: buyer
definition: When a merger occurs the buyer must buy the stock at fair market value. This value is decided by a third independent party. The true worth is retained.

name: appraisal date
subject: day appraiser
definition: A day when an appraiser is to visit. AKA valuation date.

name: appropriation account

definition: 1. part of income that is how profits are used to pay debt or increase profit. It states the profit amount not how it got there. 2. an account held by government agency that is credited from a budget.

name: appropriated expenditure
subject: fund
definition: A department’s funds to do the work they are asked. The funds given are the appropriated expenditures.

name: apprizing
subject: creditor
definition: In Scotch law. A form of process by which a creditor formerly took possession of the estates of the debtor in payment of the debt due. It is now superseded by adjudications.

name: apprenticeship
subject: one person
definition: A contract by which one person, usually a minor, called the “apprentice,” is bound to another person, called the “master,” to serve him during a prescribed term of years in his art, trade, or business, in consideration of being instructed by the master in such art or trade, and (commonly) of receiving his support and maintenance from the master during such term. The term during which an apprentice is to serve. The status of an apprentice; the relation subsisting between an apprentice and his master.

name: apprenticeship
subject: apprentice
definition: A contract by which one person, usually a minor, called the “apprentice,” is bound to another person, called the “master,” to serve him during a prescribed term of years in his art, trade, or business, in consideration of being instructed by the master in such art or trade, and (commonly) of receiving his support and maintenance from the master during such term. The term during which an apprentice is to serve. The status of an apprentice; the relation subsisting between an apprentice and his master.

name: approved endorsed note
subject: iou
definition: This an IOU or an agreement to pay a debt that is endorsed by a person who has good credit.

name: approved endorsed note
subject: agreement
definition: This an IOU or an agreement to pay a debt that is endorsed by a person who has good credit.

name: approved data

definition: Data that a system needs to function. A designer and the customer must agree to what data is necessary.

name: approval proof

name: approval authority

definition: The power an officer has in a firm to commit the firm to a contract.

name: appropriator
subject: one
definition: One who makes an appropriation; as, an appropriator of water. Lux v. Ilaggin, 69 Cal. 255, 10 Pac. 736. In English ecclcsiastical law. A spiritual corporation entitled to the profits of a benefice.

name: appropriations bill
subject: congress
definition: When congress uses public money for a specific goal. The bills are voted on every year and must be clarified before being passed. It must be edited until both parties agree on the terms.

name: aqile immittend
subject: accomplice
definition: In criminal law. An accomplice in crime who accuses others of the same offense, and is admitted as a witness at the discretion of the court to give evidence against his companions in guilt. He is vulgarly called “Queen’s Evidence.” He is one who confesses himself guilty of felony and accuses others of the same crime to save himself from punishment. Myers v. People, 20 111. 175. In old English law. Certain men sent into the several counties to increase the farms (rents) of hundreds and wapentakes, which formerly were let at a certain value to the sheriff. Cowell. Bailiffs of lords in their franchises. Sheriffs were called the king’s “approvers” in 1 Edw. III. st. 1, c. 1. fermes de la Ley, 49. Approvers in the Marches were those who had license to sell and purchase beasts there.

name: apta viro
subject: woman
definition: Fit for a husband; marriageable ; a woman who has reached marriageable years.

name: apt time
subject: thing
definition: Apt time sometimes depends upon lapse of time; as, where a thing is required to be done at the first term, or within a given time, it cannot be done afterwards. But the phrase more usually refers to the order of proceedings, as fit or suitable. Pugh v. York, 74 N. C. 383.

name: approximation
subject: situation
definition: This situation can arise when a charitable gift is applied as near as is possible to the original wishes of the donor.

name: aquagium
subject: mark
definition: A canal, ditch, or watercourse running through marsby grounds. A mark or gauge placed in or on tlie banks of a running stream, to indicate the height of the water, was called “aquagaugium.” Spei- man.

name: aquagium
subject: gauge
definition: A canal, ditch, or watercourse running through marsby grounds. A mark or gauge placed in or on tlie banks of a running stream, to indicate the height of the water, was called “aquagaugium.” Spei- man.

name: arbitrage certificate
subject: firm
definition: A proof that a firm is following provisions for local tax regimen.

name: arbitrium est judicium boni viri, secundum aequum et bonum
subject: award
definition: An award is the judgment of a good man, according to justice. 3 Bulst. 04.

name: arendator
subject: farmer
object: one rents estate belonging to crown

name: arendator
subject: renter
object: one rents estate belonging to crown

object: one rents estate belonging to crown
definition: A farmer or renter; in some provinces of Russia, one who farms the public rents or revenues; a “crown arenda- tor” is one who rents an estate belonging to the crown.

name: arendator

definition: A farmer or renter; in some provinces of Russia, one who farms the public rents or revenues; a “crown arenda- tor” is one who rents an estate belonging to the crown.

name: area of mutual interest (ami)
subject: piece
definition: When a piece of land has many oil and gas companies that own it. A contract is made to establish percentage owned and how long the current contract is valid.

name: area of mutual interest (ami)
subject: contract
definition: When a piece of land has many oil and gas companies that own it. A contract is made to establish percentage owned and how long the current contract is valid.

definition: An area of a market used to measure the audience reached by a broadcast. The area gets the same programing.

name: argumentum ab impossibili valet in lege
subject: argument
definition: An argument drawn from an impossibility is forcible in law. Co. Litt. 92a.

name: argumentum a communiter acciden- tibus in jure frequens est
subject: argument
definition: An argument drawn from things commonly happening is frequent in law. Broom, Max. 44.

name: argumentative instruction
subject: jury
definition: where the court will suggest that the jury pay particular notice to certain facts of a case. It may influence the decision of the jury as long as the verdict is not prejudiced.

name: aromatics
subject: hydrocarbon
definition: A hydrocarbon taken fro petroleum products that release a sweet odor. The common ones are benzene tolune, and xlene. They are used for solvents, additives, and feedstocks.

name: armorial bearings
subject: gentry
definition: In English law. A device depicted on the (now imaginary) shield of one of the nobility, of which gentry is the lowest degree. The criterion of nobility is the bearing of arms, or armorial bearings, received from ancestry. A r m o r u m appellatione, non solum scuta et gladii et galeae, sed et fustes e

name: arrest without warrant
subject: arrest
definition: This an arrest that is carried out by a peace officer or a private citizen where there is certainty or absolute certainty that a particular crime has been committed.

name: arrest without warrant
subject: arrest
definition: This an arrest that is carried out by a peace officer or a private citizen where there is certainty or absolute certainty that a particular crime has been committed.

name: arrears
subject: example
definition: A remaining debt or liability after the due date. An example of this would be a loan payment. AKA arrearage.

name: arrestment ^jurisdictions fundandze causa
subject: process
definition: In Scotch law. A process to bring a foreigner within the jurisdiction of the courts of Scotland. The warrant attaches a foreigner’s goods within the jurisdiction, and these will not be released unless caution or security be given.

name: articles of association
subject: form
definition: Articles subscribed by the members of a joint-stock company or corporation organized under a general law, and which create the corporate union between them. Such articles are in the nature of a partnership agreement, and commonly specify the form of organization, amount of capital, kind of business to be pursued, location of the company, etc. Articles of association are to be distinguished from a charter. in that the latter is a grant of power from the sovereign or the legislature.

name: articulated pleading
subject: each
definition: This applies to the setting forth of a complaint or the defense against a complaint in separate clauses or articles that each specify a particular issue in the  case.

name: articles, lords of
subject: system
definition: A committee of the Scottish parliament, which, in the mode of its election, and by the nature of its powers, was calculated to increase the influence of the crown, and to confer upon it a power equivalent to that of a negative before debate. This system appeared inconsistent with the freedom of parliament, and at the revolution the convention of estates declared it a grievance, and accordingly it was suppressed by Act 1000, c. 3. Wharton.

name: artificial intelligence
subject: software
definition: A software used to make computers and robots work better than humans. The systems are rule based or neutral networks. It is used to help make new products, robotics, human language understanding, and computer vision.

name: artificer
subject: one
definition: One who buys goods in order to reduce them, by his own art or industry, into other forms, and then to sell them. Lansdale v. Brashear, 3 T. B. Mou. (Ky.) 335. One who is actually and personally engaged or employed to do work of a mechanical or physical character, not including one who takes contracts for labor to be performed by others. Ingram v. Barnes, 7 El. & Bl. 135; Chawner v. Cummings, 8 Q. B. 321. One who is master of his art, and whose employment consists chiefly in manual labor. Wharton; Cunningham.

name: artifice
subject: term
definition: This term applies to any trick or a cunning device that is used.

name: artifice
subject: term
definition: This term applies to any trick or a cunning device that is used.

name: as is
subject: buyer
definition: A clause stating that an item is bought with no warranty. The buyer takes the item as it is with any apparent or nonapparent faults.

name: as against; as between
subject: word
definition: These words contrast the relative position of two persons, with a tacit reference to a different relationship between one of them and a third person. For instance, the temporary bailee of a chattel is entitled to it as be- tivccn himself and a stranger, or as against a stranger; reference being made by this form of words to the rights of the bailor. Wharton.

name: asphalt
subject: oil refining
definition: The black hydrocarbons that are naturally left ver. Or crude oil refining left overs. It is used on roads, roofs, and water proofing. AKA bitumen, coal tar, pitch, and tar.

name: assembly line
subject: each worker
definition: A tool used by Henry Ford to make cars. Each worker has one task to do that is repeated. The next worker takes on the next task. etc…. This is done until the finished product is at the end of the line. The workers can be human and non human. It is effic

name: assayer
subject: one business
definition: One whose business it is to make assays of the precious metals.

name: assessment period
subject: term
definition: This term describes the taxable period.

name: asset liquidity risk
subject: carrying value
definition: The RISK of loss arising from an inability to sell or pledge ASSETS at, or near, their carrying value when needed; a subcategory of LIQUIDITY RISK. See also ASSET FUNDING LIQUIDITY RISK, ENDOGENOUS LIQUIDITY RISK, EXOGENOUS LIQUIDITY RISK, FUNDINGLIQUIDITY RISK.

name: asset earning power
subject: way company
definition: The way a company calculates profitability. Earnings and taxes are elements in the equation.

name: asset depreciation range system (adr)
subject: system
definition: A system the IRS uses to rule the classes of assets. Replaced only briefly in 1981 it was reestablished in 1986. Each asset has an upper and lower limit in its lifetime.

name: asset demand
subject: interest
definition: The assets held as cash whose value will go down if interest goes up an vice versa.

name: asset deficiency
subject: bankruptcy
definition: When a firms risks are greater than assets. Bankruptcy may be an option.

name: asset acquisition strategy
subject: scheme
definition: A scheme to take over a company when a firm buys the targets assets not its shares or stock.

name: asset acquisition strategy
subject: scheme
definition: A scheme to take over a company when a firm buys the targets assets not its shares or stock.

name: asset-at-expiry option
subject: price
definition: A BINARYBARRIER OPTION that grants the buyer a payoff at expiry equal to a fixed ASSET amount if the price of the UNDERLYING market reference breaches the BARRIER at any time during the transaction. See also ASSETATHIT OPTION, BINARY OPTION.ASSETATHIT OPTION A BINARYBARRIER OPTION that grants the buyer an immediate payoff equal to a fixed ASSET amount if the price of the UNDERLYING market reference exceeds the BARRIER. See also ASSETATEXPIRY OPTION, BINARY OPTION.ASSETBACKED SECURITY (ABS) A NOTE or BOND collateralized by CASH FLOWS from a pool of ASSETS such as ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE, LEASES, or consumer or auto LOANS. Investors in ABS have an undivided interest in the assets that have been secured; assets in the pool are transferred to a SPECIAL PURPOSE ENTITY established as a TRUST, which issues the securities that are sold to investors.

name: asset turnover ratio
subject: well firm
definition: How well a firm uses its asset to create income. The higher the ratio the better. Each type of asset is calculated such as cash to sales, inventory to sales, and fixed assets to sales. The ratio is called capital intensity.

name: asset stripping
subject: buyer
definition: When a buyer of a company sells off the assets right away to gain back the cost paid for the business.

name: asset stripping
subject: buyer
definition: When a buyer of a company sells off the assets right away to gain back the cost paid for the business.

name: assignable contract
subject: new owner
definition: A contract that allows an owner to give rights or obligations to a new owner. The new owner will also get any benefits before contract close. Exchange traded contracts are not assignable.

name: assignment of insurance
subject: death
definition: When a life insurance policies benefits are used as collateral. If death should occur the lender is paid first than the beneficiary. Only life insurance can be used this way.

name: assignment of errors
subject: error
definition: the statement of mistakes that have supposedly been made during a trial in a lower court. These errors are used to take the case to a higher court.

name: assignment of claims
subject: contractor
definition: When a contractor lets a customer pay directly to a third party doing work.

name: assignment of accounts receivable
subject: lender
definition: When accounts are pledged as collateral for a loan. The lender gets repayment from these accounts if default occurs. Refer to asset based lending.

name: assisa de clarendon
subject: statute
definition: The assise of Clarendon. A statute or ordinance passed in the tenth year of Henry II., by which those that were accused of any heinous crime, and not able to purge themselves, but must abjure the realm, had liberty of forty days to stay and try what succor they could get of their friends towards their sustenance in exile. Bract, fol. 136; Co. Litt. 159a; BL.LAW DICT.(2D ED.)

name: assisa de clarendon
subject: ordinance
definition: The assise of Clarendon. A statute or ordinance passed in the tenth year of Henry II., by which those that were accused of any heinous crime, and not able to purge themselves, but must abjure the realm, had liberty of forty days to stay and try what succor they could get of their friends towards their sustenance in exile. Bract, fol. 136; Co. Litt. 159a; BL.LAW DICT.(2D ED.)

name: assisa armorum
subject: statute
definition: Assise of arms. A statute or ordinance requiring the keeping of arms for the common defense. Hale, Com. Law, c. 11.

name: assisa armorum
subject: ordinance
definition: Assise of arms. A statute or ordinance requiring the keeping of arms for the common defense. Hale, Com. Law, c. 11.

name: assimilation
subject: underwriter
definition: Buying the whole new issue by public buyers. If underwriters do this its called absorption.

name: assignor
subject: one
definition: One who makes an assignment of any kind; one who assigns or transfers property.

name: assignment with preferences
subject: other
definition: An assignment for the benefit of creditors, with directions to the assignee to prefer a specified creditor or class of creditors, by paying their claims in full before the others receive any dividend, or in some other manner. More usually termed a “preferential assignment.”

name: assignment under documentary credit
subject: beneficiary
definition: When a beneficiary gives profits to a third party in a letter of credit. This requires no approval.

name: assisa panis et cerevisise
subject: name
definition: Assise of bread and ale, or beer. The name of a statute passed in the fifty-first year of Henry III., containing regulations for the sale of bread and ale; sometimes called the “statute of bread and ale.” Co. Litt. 1596; 2 Reeve, Hist. Eng. Law, 56; Cowell; Bract, fol. 155.

name: associate’s degree
subject: college
definition: When a college gives a student a degree after two years. It is about 60 credits and can be applied to get a bachelors degree that will take an additional two years.

name: associate in research and planning (arp)
subject: certificate
definition: The certificate given by the IIA to professionals who have taken six tests. It tests research, planning, decision support, and market feasibility analysis.

name: associate in claims (aic)
subject: insurance institution
definition: The certification for insurance brokers. The Insurance Institution of America offers this program. They must handle bodily injury claims, property loss adjustments, and liability claims.

name: assumption of mortgage
subject: contract buyer
definition: A contract when a buyer takes responsibilty for payments to save closing costs or interest rates. The original party is secondarily responsible unless released.

name: assumption of indebtedness
subject: agreement
definition: the agreement of one person who will pay the debts of another person.

name: assumption fee
subject: person
definition: A change a lender puts on a buyer of property. This person assumes the mortgage. Refer to assumption of mortgage.

name: assumption endorsement
subject: insurance policy
definition: When an insurance policy has something added to it to protect the holder if they are insolvent. The reinsurer must pay the holder directly. The middle man is taken out of the payment process. AKA cut through endorsement.

name: assumption endorsement
subject: reinsurer
definition: When an insurance policy has something added to it to protect the holder if they are insolvent. The reinsurer must pay the holder directly. The middle man is taken out of the payment process. AKA cut through endorsement.

name: assumption
subject: which case
definition: The act or agreement of assuming or taking upon one’s self; the undertaking or adoption of a debt or obligation primarily resting upon another, as where the purchaser of real estate “assumes” a mortgage resting upon it in which case he adopts the mortgage debt as his own and becomes personally liable for its payment. Eggleston v. Morrison, 84 111. App. 631; Locke v. Homer, 131 Mass. 93, 41 Am. Rep. 199; Springer v. De Wolf, 194 111. 218, 62 N. E. 542, 56 L. R. A. 465, 88 Am. St Rep. 155; Lenz v. Railroad Co., Ill Wis. 198, 86 N. W. 607. The difference between the purchaser of land assuming a mortgage on it and simply buying subject to the mortgage, is that in the former case he makes himself personally liable for the payment of the mortgage debt, while in the lat ter case he does not. Hancock v. Fleming, 103 Ind. 533, 3 N. E. 254; Braman v. Dowse, 12 Cush. (Mass.) 227. Where one “assumes” a lease, he takes to himself the obligations, contracts, agreements, and benefits to which the other contracting party was entitled under the terms of the lease. Cincinnati, etc., R. Co. v. Indiana, etc., R. Co., 44 Ohio St. 287, 314, 7 N. EX 152.

name: asylum
subject: sanctuary
definition: 1. A sanctuary, or place of refuge and protection, where criminals and debtors found shelter, and from which they could not be taken without sacrilege. State v. Bacon, 6 Neb. 291; Cromie v. Institution of Mercy, 3 Bush (Ivy.) 391. 2. Shelter; refuge; protection from the hand of justice. The word includes not only place, but also shelter, security, protection; and a fugitive from justice, who has committed a crime in a foreign country, “seeks an asylum” at all times when he claims the use of the territories of the United States. In re De Giacomo, 12 Blatchf. 395, Fed. Cas. No. 3,747. 3. An institution for the protection and relief of unfortunates, as asylums for the poor, for the deaf and dumb, or for the insane. Lawrence v. Leidigh, 58 Kan. 594, 50 Pac. 600, 62 Am. St Rep. 631.

name: asylum
subject: place
definition: 1. A sanctuary, or place of refuge and protection, where criminals and debtors found shelter, and from which they could not be taken without sacrilege. State v. Bacon, 6 Neb. 291; Cromie v. Institution of Mercy, 3 Bush (Ivy.) 391. 2. Shelter; refuge; protection from the hand of justice. The word includes not only place, but also shelter, security, protection; and a fugitive from justice, who has committed a crime in a foreign country, “seeks an asylum” at all times when he claims the use of the territories of the United States. In re De Giacomo, 12 Blatchf. 395, Fed. Cas. No. 3,747. 3. An institution for the protection and relief of unfortunates, as asylums for the poor, for the deaf and dumb, or for the insane. Lawrence v. Leidigh, 58 Kan. 594, 50 Pac. 600, 62 Am. St Rep. 631.

name: asterisk
subject: star symbol
definition: The star symbol that indicates a foot note or end note has additional information. Refer to star paging.

name: asynchronous transmission mode (atm)
subject: current limit
definition: The high speed data transmissions used in networks for realtime voice, video, and data. The current limit is 25 to 622 million Mb/sec. If on optical fiber cable it cannot be used on telephone lines. AKA cell relay.

name: atlantic spread
subject: trader
definition: When a trader holds position in a european option and a corresponding american option.

name: atlantic spread
subject: trader
definition: When a trader holds position in a european option and a corresponding american option.

name: atlanta fed index
subject: anything
definition: A survey done in Georgia, Florida, Louisiana, Alabama, and Tennessee. Anything above zero is expansion and anything below is contraction.

name: atlanta fed index
subject: anything
definition: A survey done in Georgia, Florida, Louisiana, Alabama, and Tennessee. Anything above zero is expansion and anything below is contraction.

name: attachiamenta de gpinis et boscis
subject: privilege
definition: A privilege granted to the officers of a forest to take to their own use thorns, brush, and windfalls, within their precincts. Kenn. Par. Antiq. 209.

name: atmospherics
subject: retail store
definition: When a retail store has displays, smells, and environmental elements to influence mood.

name: attendance management
subject: positive approach
definition: When a positive approach is used to reduce absence at work. Reward and punishment is used to get the desired result.

name: attempted murder
subject: person
definition: the term used when a person has planned to kill another person and was unsuccessful.

name: attempted assault
subject: term
definition: the term used when an attempt to cause harm to a person has been carried out.

name: attempt
subject: which in fact
definition: In criminal law. An effort or endeavor to accomplish a crime, amounting to more than mere preparation or planning for it, and which, if not prevented, would have resulted in the full consummation of the act attempted, but which, in fact, does not bring to pass the party’s ultimate design. People v. Moran, 123 N. Y. 254, 25 N. E. 412, 10 L. R. A. 109, 20 Am. St. Rep. 732; Gandy v. State, 13 Neb. 445, 14 N. W. 143; Scott v. People, 141 111. 195, 30 N. E. 329; Brown v. State, 27 Tex. App. 330, 11 S. W. 412; U. S. v. Ford (D. C.) 34 Fed. 26; Com. v. Eagan, 190 Pa. 10, 42 Atl. 374. An intent to do a particular criminal thing combined with an act which falls short of the thing intended. 1 Bish. Crim. Law,

name: attainted
subject: person
definition: where a person has received a sentence of attainder that results from a conviction of committing high treason.

name: attainder
subject: person
definition: That extinction of civil rights and capacities which takes place whenever a person who has committed treason or felony receives sentence of death for his crime. 1 Steph. Comm. 408; 1 Bish. Crim. Law,

name: attainder
subject: person
definition: That extinction of civil rights and capacities which takes place whenever a person who has committed treason or felony receives sentence of death for his crime. 1 Steph. Comm. 408; 1 Bish. Crim. Law,

name: attainder
subject: that extinction
definition: That extinction of civil rights and capacities which takes place whenever a person who has committed treason or felony receives sentence of death for his crime. 1 Steph. Comm. 408; 1 Bish. Crim. Law,

name: attachment of risk
subject: buyer
definition: When the buyer accepts risk of loss of a purchased item.

name: attestor of a cautioner
subject: person
definition: In Scotch practice. A person who attests the sufficiency of a cautioner, and agrees to become subsidiarie liable for the debt. Bell.

name: attesting witness
subject: person
definition: the person who signs his name on a document tat the maker or maker’s request and certifies its identity and existence.

name: attesting witness
subject: one
definition: One who signs his name to an instrument, at the request of the party or parties, for the purpose of proving and identifying it. Skinner v. Bible Soc., 92 Wis. 209, Oo N. W. 1037.

name: attorney general
subject: patent , office
definition: In English law. The chief law officer of the realm, being created by letters patent, whose office is to exhibit informations and prosecute for the crown iu matters criminal, and to file bills in the exchequer in any matter concerning the king’s revenue. State v. Cunningham, 83 Wis. 90, 53 N. W. 35, 17 L. R. A. 145, 35 Am. St. Rep. 27. In American law. The attorney general of the United States is the head of the department of justice, appointed by the president, and a member of the cabinet. He appears in behalf of the government in all cases iu the supreme court in which it is interested, and gives his legal advice to the president and heads of departments upon questions submitted to him. In each state also there is an attorney general, or similar officer, who appears for the people, as iu England the attorney general appears for the crown. State v. District Court, 22 Mont. 25, 55 Pac. 910; People v. Kramer, 33 Misc. Rep. 209, 68 N. Y. Supp. 383.

name: attorney general
subject: patent , office
definition: In English law. The chief law officer of the realm, being created by letters patent, whose office is to exhibit informations and prosecute for the crown iu matters criminal, and to file bills in the exchequer in any matter concerning the king’s revenue. State v. Cunningham, 83 Wis. 90, 53 N. W. 35, 17 L. R. A. 145, 35 Am. St. Rep. 27. In American law. The attorney general of the United States is the head of the department of justice, appointed by the president, and a member of the cabinet. He appears in behalf of the government in all cases iu the supreme court in which it is interested, and gives his legal advice to the president and heads of departments upon questions submitted to him. In each state also there is an attorney general, or similar officer, who appears for the people, as iu England the attorney general appears for the crown. State v. District Court, 22 Mont. 25, 55 Pac. 910; People v. Kramer, 33 Misc. Rep. 209, 68 N. Y. Supp. 383.

name: attribution rules
subject: canada
definition: How canada prevents investors from skipping out on taxes. Transfering assets to poorer family members is forbidden.

name: attribute
subject: seller
definition: 1.an appealing element an item has that will make a customer want to buy it. It is what the seller wants you to think about their product. 2.the visual elemet placed on a numeric scale. It is compared to two extremes and is decided to be worthwhile or not

name: attractive nuisance doctrine
subject: owner
definition: The principle that states that people have something on their premises that is attractive to children but has inherent dangers. The owners are expected to take all reasonable care that no harm comes to the children.

name: audi alteram partem
subject: other side
definition: Hear the other side; hear both sides. No man should be condemned unheard. Broom, Max. 113. See L. R. 2 P. C. 106.

name: auctioneers
subject: middleman
definition: A middleman who sells items in an auction format. A bidder bids until they win. They are paid through commission of final sale.

name: auditing evidence
subject: record
definition: An auditors evidence that is placed on statements. All records must be cross checked for accuracy.

name: audit program
subject: procedure auditing firm
definition: The procedure an auditing firm uses to audit.

name: auditors of the imprest
subject: officer
definition: Officers in the English exchequer, who formerly had the charge of auditing the accounts of the customs, naval and military expenses, etc.. now performed by the commissioners for auditing public accounts.

name: authentic record
subject: document
definition: A document that represents what is supposed to and has not been changed. AKA authentic document.

name: authentic act
subject: officer
definition: In the civil law. An act which has been executed before a notary or other public officer authorized to execute such functions, or which is testified by a public seal, or has been rendered public by the authority of a competent magistrate, or which is certified as being a copy of a public register. Nov. 73, c. 2; Cod. 7, 52, 6, 4, 21; Dig. 22, 4. The authentic act, as relates to contracts, is that which has been executed before a notary public or other officer authorized to execute such functions, in presence of two witnesses, free, male, and aged at least fourteen years, or of three witnesses, if the party be blind. If the party does not know how to sign, the notary must cause him to affix his mark to the instrument. All proc&s verbals of sales of succession property, signed by the sheriff or other person making the same, by the purchaser and two witnesses, are authentic acts. Civil Code La. art. 2234.

name: auter droit
subject: g. trustee
definition: In right of another, e. g., a trustee holds trust property in right of his cestui que trust. A prochein amy sues in right of an infant. 2 Bl. Comm. 176.

name: austerity budget
subject: budget
definition: When a budget is decided by the government to reduce deficit. The goal is to cut comsumer spending.

name: authority of the court
subject: power
definition: This the power granted to the court that allows it to act on certain types of legal matters.

name: authoritarian leadership
subject: leader
definition: When a leader makes rules, procedures, and goal. They are done with no input from anyone else.

name: authoritarian leadership
subject: leader
definition: When a leader makes rules, procedures, and goal. They are done with no input from anyone else.

name: authentics
subject: novel
definition: In the civil law. A Latin translation of the Novels of Justinian by an anonymous author; so called because the Novels were translated entire, in order to distinguish it from the epitome made by Julian. There is another collection so called, compiled by Irnier, of incorrect extracts from the Novels and inserted by him in the Code, in the places to which they refer.

name: authenticity
subject: document
definition: The validity of a document or record. The document is kept in original form with no tampering.

name: authentication key
subject: digital code
definition: A digital code used to keep electronic payments secure from any third parties. The amount, time, and date are used for this.

name: authentication certificate
subject: digital certificate
definition: The way access is given for electronic commerce. This digital certificate shows the entity issuing, the entity issued, a serial number, dates, and a digital fingerprint.

name: authorized user
subject: party
definition: A party allowed to manage an account. This can be for any type of account. They are not required all the time to repay debt incurred.

name: authorized person
subject: party
definition: A party empowered to act in an office due to a contract.

name: automatic coverage
subject: automatic coverage
definition: An INSURANCE contract that automatically comes into effect when an INSURED acquires new property or revalues existing property. Automatic coverage eliminates the possibility of UNDERINSURANCE.

name: automatic call distributor
subject: menu
definition: A telephone device that works through a computer to help callers. It has menus, plays messages, sends calls to the parties needed.

name: automated commercial environment (ace)
subject: agency system
definition: The Customs agency system used to process imports and exports. It is faster and decreases time lost moving goods. It also increases security.

name: automated attendant
subject: menu
definition: Equipment that uses a computer to answer phones rather than people. A message is played and the menu is used to access the party wanted.

name: automatic reinstatement clause
subject: insurer
definition: A clause in an INSURANCE contract indicating that after the INSURER has paid the INSURED on a CLAIM, the original contract limits are automatically renewed.

name: automatism
subject: ambulatory automatism
definition: In medical jurisprudence, this term is applied to actions or conduct of an individual apparently occurring without will, purpose, or reasoned intention on his part; a condition sometimes observed in persons who, without being actually insane, suffer from an obscuration of the mental faculties, loss of volition or of memory, or kindred affections. “Ambulatory automatism” describes the pathological impulse to purposeless and irresponsible wanderings from place to place often characteristic of patients suffering from loss of memory with dissociation of personality.

name: automatic withdrawal
subject: investor
definition: When an investor gets payments periodically from their gains income.

name: automatic identification
subject: way machine
definition: The way a machine can identify a container or item with capture technologies.

name: automatic identification
subject: way machine
definition: The way a machine can identify a container or item with capture technologies.

name: autoregression analysis
subject: regression analysis
definition: When regression analysis is used to link the data in a time series.

name: autoregression
subject: datum
definition: When the data from a previous time period affect the next one.

name: autopoiesis
subject: living system
definition: The idea that any living system can maintain stability despite any changes. It is self regulated.

name: autonomous work group
subject: each member
definition: A group of employees that work on the same project. Each member has great responsibility for their part of the project. The project succeeds if all parties perform their tasks correctly.

name: autonomation
subject: operator
definition: When machines and operators can work together. The operator gives the machine a human touch. Both automatic and semi automatic processes make it easy for the operator.

name: autonomation
subject: operator
definition: When machines and operators can work together. The operator gives the machine a human touch. Both automatic and semi automatic processes make it easy for the operator.

name: autre vie
subject: person
definition: Another’s life. A person holding an estate for or during the life of another is called a tenant “pur autre vie,” or “pur terme d’autre vie.” Litt.

name: autre vie
subject: person
definition: Another’s life. A person holding an estate for or during the life of another is called a tenant “pur autre vie,” or “pur terme d’autre vie.” Litt.

name: autre vie
subject: person
definition: Another’s life. A person holding an estate for or during the life of another is called a tenant “pur autre vie,” or “pur terme d’autre vie.” Litt.

name: autre vie
subject: person
definition: Another’s life. A person holding an estate for or during the life of another is called a tenant “pur autre vie,” or “pur terme d’autre vie.” Litt.

name: autre vie
subject: person
definition: Another’s life. A person holding an estate for or during the life of another is called a tenant “pur autre vie,” or “pur terme d’autre vie.” Litt.

name: avalizor
subject: third party
definition: When a third party becomes a guarantor to make sure a payment is made even if default occurs. It is more common in Europe than in the US.

name: average adjuster
subject: party
definition: A party hired to asses loss for maritime insurance. The claim will be deemed general average or pearticular average. AKA average adjustor.

name: average price per share
subject: way cost
definition: The way cost is decided using cost of shares and the numbe of them that are held. Refer to average down and average up.

name: average without percentage
subject: amount
definition: The broadest marine coverage that pays partial or total loss. The amount is paid in full no matter the average.

name: average up
subject: investor
definition: When an investor buys long position shares to reduce prices and make more profit. Compare this term to average down and dollar cost averaging.

name: avoiding
subject: minimal assertiveness
definition: When minimal assertiveness is used to handle a conflict. Each party tends to stay away from the other.

name: avoiding
subject: each party
definition: When minimal assertiveness is used to handle a conflict. Each party tends to stay away from the other.

name: avowry
subject: defendant avoivs
definition: A pleading In the action of replevin, by which the defendant avoivs, that is, acknowledges, the taking of the distress or property complained of, where lie took It in his own right, and sets forth the reason of it; as for rent in arrear, damage done, etc. 3 Bl. Comm. 149; 1 Tidd. Pr. 045. Brown y. Bissett, 21 N. J. Law, 274; Hill v. Miller, 5 Serg. & R. (Pa.) 357. Avowry is the setting forth, as in a declaration, the nature and merits of the defendant’s case, showing that the distress taken by him was lawful, which must be done with such sufficient authority as will entitle him to a retor- no habendo. Hill v. Stocking, 6 Hill (N. Y.) 284. An avowry must be distinguished from a justification. The former species of plea admits the plaintiff’s ownership of the property, but alleges a right in the defendant sufficient to warrant him in taking the property and which still subsists. A justification, on the other hand, denies that the plaintiff had the right of property or possession in the subject-matter, alleging it to have been in the defendant or a third person, or avers a right sufficient to warrant the defendant in taking it, although such right has not continued in force to the time of making answer

name: avowry
subject: pleading
definition: A pleading In the action of replevin, by which the defendant avoivs, that is, acknowledges, the taking of the distress or property complained of, where lie took It in his own right, and sets forth the reason of it; as for rent in arrear, damage done, etc. 3 Bl. Comm. 149; 1 Tidd. Pr. 045. Brown y. Bissett, 21 N. J. Law, 274; Hill v. Miller, 5 Serg. & R. (Pa.) 357. Avowry is the setting forth, as in a declaration, the nature and merits of the defendant’s case, showing that the distress taken by him was lawful, which must be done with such sufficient authority as will entitle him to a retor- no habendo. Hill v. Stocking, 6 Hill (N. Y.) 284. An avowry must be distinguished from a justification. The former species of plea admits the plaintiff’s ownership of the property, but alleges a right in the defendant sufficient to warrant him in taking the property and which still subsists. A justification, on the other hand, denies that the plaintiff had the right of property or possession in the subject-matter, alleging it to have been in the defendant or a third person, or avers a right sufficient to warrant the defendant in taking it, although such right has not continued in force to the time of making answer

name: avowant
subject: one
definition: One who makes an avowry.

name: availability under documentary credit
subject: way credit
definition: The way credit is made available. It can be a sight payment, negotiation, or deferring payments.

name: automatic extension
subject: extension
definition: A statement on a listing that requires the owner to pay the broker to sell or lease property at a rate agreed upon. An extension can be added to make the rate stay past the maturation date. It is not allowed in certain states.

name: authorized capital
subject: issuance
definition: The maximum number of shares of COMMON STOCK a company is permitted to issue, per the terms of its ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION. Issuance in excess of authorized capital requires an amendment to the articles.

name: authorized bank
subject: bank government
definition: A bank the government uses to move decentralized payments. The payment are normally limited to the countries central payment agency.

name: authorize
subject: person
definition: This enables a person to act; it gives the authority for a person to carry out an act.

name: authorization risk
subject: risk of loss
definition: The RISK of loss that occurs when an employee or AGENT of a company commits the firm to a legally binding, but unauthorized, transaction; in most instances the firm will be required to perform as contracted. A subcategory of PROCESS RISK.

name: auditor 1
subject: official
definition: 1. An official of a government agency whose job is to inspect and examine records of public m monies made by appointed authorities. 2. An appointee of the court.

name: auditor
subject: officer function
definition: A public officer whose function is to examine and pass upon the accounts and vouchers of officers who have received and expended public money by lawful authority. In practice. An officer (or officers) of the court, assigned to state the items of debit and credit between the parties in a suit where accounts are in question, and exhibit the balance. Whitwell v. Willardj 1 Mete. (Mass.) 218. In English law. An officer or agent of the crown, or of a private individual, or corjioration, who examines periodically the accounts of under officers, tenants, stewards, or bailiffs, and reports the state of their accounts to his principal.

name: auditor
subject: officer function
definition: A public officer whose function is to examine and pass upon the accounts and vouchers of officers who have received and expended public money by lawful authority. In practice. An officer (or officers) of the court, assigned to state the items of debit and credit between the parties in a suit where accounts are in question, and exhibit the balance. Whitwell v. Willardj 1 Mete. (Mass.) 218. In English law. An officer or agent of the crown, or of a private individual, or corjioration, who examines periodically the accounts of under officers, tenants, stewards, or bailiffs, and reports the state of their accounts to his principal.

name: attorney’s letter
subject: cpa
definition: When a CPA sends a letter for information about a pending concern. It is part of the audit. The pending issue has impact on the company and its position. The letter confirms the information sent as accurate.

name: attachment of property
subject: court
definition: when the court takes the property and will hold it during the course of the trial. The property is security should the case be decided against the defendant.

name: attachment of property
subject: property
definition: when the court takes the property and will hold it during the course of the trial. The property is security should the case be decided against the defendant.

name: attachment of privilege
subject: process
definition: In English law. A process by which a man, by virtue of his privilege, calls another to litigate in that court to which he himself belongs, and who has the privilege to answer there. A writ issued to apprehend a person in a privileged place. Termes de la Ijey.

name: at sight
subject: bill
definition: A bill to be paid on the day presented to the party. AKA sight bill or sight draft. Refer to after sight.

name: association or syndicate pool
subject: insurer
definition: When insurers get together to write large risk insurance and split expense and premiums. Refer to risk.

name: association or syndicate pool
subject: insurer
definition: When insurers get together to write large risk insurance and split expense and premiums. Refer to risk.

name: assisa de ut- rnm
subject: obsolete writ
definition: An obsolete writ, which lay for the parson of a church whose predecessor had alienated the land and rents of it.

name: assisa de ut- rnm
subject: obsolete writ
definition: An obsolete writ, which lay for the parson of a church whose predecessor had alienated the land and rents of it.

name: assignment of rents
subject: lender
definition: When a lender directly gets payments for a loan from the property mortgaged in the case of default.

name: assetbased lending
subject: collateral quality
definition: Financing that uses the asset being purchased as collateral for the funds to buy it. The collateral’s quality is the important factor here. The loan amount is based on the asset value and its marketability upon default. Its off balance sheet financing. AK

name: asset-or-nothing option
subject: price
definition: A BINARYBARRIER OPTION that grants the buyer a payoff equal to a fixed ASSET value if the price of the UNDERLYING market reference exceeds the STRIKE PRICE at expiry. See also BINARY OPTION, CASHORNOTHING OPTION.ASSET STRIPPING The process of selling corporate ASSETS acquired in a TAKEOVER or ACQUISITION. Such disposals may occur when the value of selling assets and using the proceeds to repay DEBT or invest in alternative ventures is estimated to be greater than the value of preserving them on the balance sheet. See also BREAKUP VALUE, LIQUIDATION VALUE.ASSET SWAP An OVERTHECOUNTER INTEREST RATE SWAP that exchanges BOND COUPONS from fixed rates into floating, or vice versa, creating a synthetic investment that meets an investor

name: asset-or-nothing option
subject: binary option
definition: A BINARYBARRIER OPTION that grants the buyer a payoff equal to a fixed ASSET value if the price of the UNDERLYING market reference exceeds the STRIKE PRICE at expiry. See also BINARY OPTION, CASHORNOTHING OPTION.ASSET STRIPPING The process of selling corporate ASSETS acquired in a TAKEOVER or ACQUISITION. Such disposals may occur when the value of selling assets and using the proceeds to repay DEBT or invest in alternative ventures is estimated to be greater than the value of preserving them on the balance sheet. See also BREAKUP VALUE, LIQUIDATION VALUE.ASSET SWAP An OVERTHECOUNTER INTEREST RATE SWAP that exchanges BOND COUPONS from fixed rates into floating, or vice versa, creating a synthetic investment that meets an investor

name: articles of dissolution
subject: document
definition: A document filed to make the closing of an organization official.

name: arson
subject: arson at common law
definition: Arson, at common law, is the act of unlawfully and maliciously burning the house of another man. 4 Steph. Comm. 99; 2 Ituss. Crimes, 896; Steph. Crim. Dig. 298. Arson, by the common law, is the willful and malicious burning of the house of another. The word “house,” as here understood, includes not merely the dwelling- house, but all outhouses which are parcel thereof. State v. McGowan, 20 Conn. 245, 52 Am. Dec. 336; Graham v. State, 40 Ala. 664; Allen v. State, 10 Ohio St. 300; State v. Porter, 90 N. C. 719; Hill v. Com., 98 Pa. 195; State v. McCoy, 162 Mo. 383, 62 S. W. 991. Arson is the malicious and willful burning of the house or outhouse of another. Code Ga. 18S2,

name: arrestando ipsum qui pecu- niam recepit
subject: writ
definition: In old English law. A writ which issued for apprehending a person who had taken the king’s prest money to serve in the wars, and then hid himself in order to avoid going.

name: arrestando ipsum qui pecu- niam recepit
subject: writ
definition: In old English law. A writ which issued for apprehending a person who had taken the king’s prest money to serve in the wars, and then hid himself in order to avoid going.

name: argentarius miles
subject: money
definition: A money IKH’ter in the English exchequer, who carries the money from the lower to the upper exchequer to be examined and tested. Spelman.

name: arches court
subject: court
definition: In English ecclesiastical law. A court of appeal belonging to the Archbishop of Canterbury, the judge of which is called the “Dean of the Arches,” because his court was anciently held in the church of Saint Mary-le-Bow, (Sancta Maria de Arcubux,) so named from the steeple, which is raised upon pillars built archwise. The court was until recently held in the hall belonging to the College of Civilians, commonly called “Doctors’ Commons.” It is now held in Westminster Hall. Its proper jurisdiction is only over the thirteen peculiar parishes belonging to the archbishop in London, but, the ollice of Dean of the Arches having been for a long time united with that of the archbishop’s principal official, the Judge of the Arches, in right of such added office, it receives and determines appeals from the sentences of all inferior ecclesiastical courts within the province. 3 Bl. Comm. 04.

name: arbitrator
subject: person
definition: A private, disinterested person, chosen by the parties to a disputed question, for the purpose of hearing their contention, and giving judgment between them; to whose decision (award) the litigants submit themselves either voluntarily, or, in some cases, coinpulsorily, by order of a court. Gordon v. U. S., 7 Wall. 195, 19 L. Ed. 35; Mobile v. Wood (C. C.) 95 Fed. 538; Burchell v. Marsh, 17 IIow. 349, 15 L. Ed. 90; Miller v. Canal Co., 53 Barb. (N. Y.) 595; Fudickar v. Insurance Co., 02 N. Y. 399. “Referee” is of frequent modern use as a synonym of arbitrator, but is in its origin of broader signification and less accurate than arbitrator.

name: aqua cedit solo
subject: water
definition: Water follows the land. A sale of land will pass the water which covers it. 2 Bl. Comm. 18; Co. Litt. 4.

name: appropriation of payments
subject: creditor
definition: This means the application of a payment to the discharge of a particular debt. Thus, if a creditor has two distinct debts due to him from his debtor, and the latter makes a general payment on account, without specifying at the time to which debt he intends the payment to apply, it is optional for the creditor to appropriate (apply) the payment to either of the two debts he pleases. Gwin v. McLean. 02 Miss. 121; Martiu v. Draher, 5 Watts (Pa.) 544. In English ecclesiastical law. The perpetual annexing of a benefice to some spiritual corporation either sole or aggregate, BL.LAW DICT.(2D ED.)

name: appropriation of payments
subject: debt
definition: This means the application of a payment to the discharge of a particular debt. Thus, if a creditor has two distinct debts due to him from his debtor, and the latter makes a general payment on account, without specifying at the time to which debt he intends the payment to apply, it is optional for the creditor to appropriate (apply) the payment to either of the two debts he pleases. Gwin v. McLean. 02 Miss. 121; Martiu v. Draher, 5 Watts (Pa.) 544. In English ecclesiastical law. The perpetual annexing of a benefice to some spiritual corporation either sole or aggregate, BL.LAW DICT.(2D ED.)

name: appellant
subject: party
definition: The party who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another.

name: apocrisarius cancellarius
subject: officer
definition: In the civil law. An officer who took charge of the royal seal and signed royal dispatches.

name: annuity death benefit
subject: beneficiary
definition: A promise on an annuity contract that a beneficiary gets the value of an annuity if the pwner passes away before payments run out.

name: anode
subject: component
definition: The component of an electrolytic cell called an electrode where oxidation takes place usually causing corrosion.

name: and interest
subject: buyer
definition: A term in bond price that means interest is not included in the figure yet. The buyer will get the interest on top of the value.

name: anaerobic
subject: example
definition: Anything not needing oxygen and may be harmed by it. An example of this is bacteria. Spelled anerobic sometimes. Refer to aerobic.

name: american economics association (aea)
subject: group
definition: A group started in 1885 to research and discuss economic trends. The headquarters are in Nashville, Tennessee. The members are scholars, business men, government employees, and nonprofit members. A meeting is held yearly to discuss issues at hand. A membe

name: amenities
subject: something
definition: Extra features to make something appear more desirable or to make something seem more valuable than it is.

name: ambulance chaser
subject: term
definition: the term used to describe the attorney with a dubious reputation who solicits his clients from the victims of accidents. See indirect solicitation.

name: ambasciator
subject: person
definition: A person sent about In the service of another; a person sent on a service. A word of frequent occurrence in the writers of the middle ages. Spelman.

name: ambactus
subject: messenger servant
definition: A messenger; a servant sent about; one whose services his master hired out. Spelman.

name: alternative routing
subject: cargo
definition: When cargo is brought on an another route that offers the same tax and terms. Refer to alernative tariff.

name: alternate verdict
subject: evidence
definition: A jury decision if evidence is lacking to charge guilty. A lesser offense is usually used to punish teh defendant.

name: all holders’ rule
subject: shareholder
definition: A rule that doesn’t allow a public offer to be made on a new issue before the shareholders get to make their offers.

name: alienation clause
subject: owner
definition: 1. in insurance it is a rule that cancels insurance if the owner sells the property. 2.in a loan it is the rule stating the asset is owned once the loan is paid in full.

name: alias writ
subject: alias writ
definition: An alias writ is a second writ issued in the same cause, where a former writ of the Bame kind had been issued without effect In such case, the language of the second writ is, “We command you, as we have before [sicut alias] commanded you,” etc. Roberts v. Church, 17 Conn. 142; Farris v. Walter, 2 Colo. App. 450, 31 Pac. 231.

name: air ticket &amp; boarding (atb) card
subject: person
definition: A ticket that a person uses to board a plane. A machine reads it and is called ATB2.

name: agreed
subject: word
definition: Settled or established by agreement. This word in a deed creates a covenant. This word is a technical term, and it is synonymous with “contracted,” McKisick v. McKisick, Meigs (Tenn.) 433. It means, ex vi termini, that it is the agreement of both parties, whether both sign it or not. each and both consenting to it. Aikin v. Albany, V. & C. R. Co., 26 Barb. (N. Y.) 298.

name: agiotage
subject: speculator
definition: A speculation on the rise and fall of the public debt of states, or the public funds. The speculator is called “ag- iotcur.”

name: agiotage
subject: speculator
definition: A speculation on the rise and fall of the public debt of states, or the public funds. The speculator is called “ag- iotcur.”

name: aggregate and sole
subject: corporation sole
definition: A corporation sole is one consisting of one person only, and his successors in some .particular station, who are incorporated by law in order to give them some legal capacities and advantages, particularly that of perpetuity, which in their natural persons they could not have had. In this sense, the sovereign in England is a sole corporation, so is a bishop, so are some deans distinct from their several chapters, and so is every parson and vicar. 3 Steph. Comm. 168. 169; 2 Kent, Comm. 273. Warner v. Beers, 23 Wend. (N. Y.) 172; Codd v. Itathbone. 19 N. Y. 39; First Parish v. Dunning, 7 Mass. 447. A corporation aggregate is one composed of a number of individuals vested with corporate powers; and a “corporation,” as the word is used in general popular and legal speech, and as defined at the head of this title, means a “corporation aggregate.”

name: agency by necessity
subject: one party
definition: When one party makes decisions for another. It is because the other party cannot make the decisions.

name: age discrimination act
subject: act
definition: This the federal law that denies any unfair treatment to employees that is based on their age. This act will protect employees up to 70 years of age.

name: age discrimination act
subject: act
definition: This the federal law that denies any unfair treatment to employees that is based on their age. This act will protect employees up to 70 years of age.

name: aftermarket
subject: part
definition: The second hand market for parts to maintain equipment. Some are very large. AKA replacement market or secondary market.

name: affidavit of service
subject: affidavit
definition: An affidavit intended to certify the service of a writ, notice, or other document.

name: affidatus
subject: one
definition: One who is not a vassal, but who for the sake of protection has connected himself with one more powerful. Spelman ; 2 Bl. Comm. 46.

name: advance payment bond
subject: loss
definition: A promise regargind advance payment. If the loss does not occur the money is returned. AKA advance payment guarantee.

name: adulter
subject: one
definition: Lat. One who corrupts; one who seduces another man’s wife. Adulter solidorum. A corruptor of metals; a counterfeiter. Calvin.

name: adult children
subject: son
definition: Any sons or daughters who have attained the age of an adult.

name: adult children
subject: daughter
definition: Any sons or daughters who have attained the age of an adult.

name: adult
subject: male infant
definition: In the civil law. A male infant who has attained the age of fourteen ; a female infant who has attained the age of twelve. Dom. Liv. Prel. tit. 2,

name: adoption
subject: act
definition: The act of one who takes another’s child into his own family, treating him as his own, and giving him all the rights and duties of his own child. A juridical act creating between two persons certain relations, purely civil, of paternity and filiation. 0 Demol.

name: adopted child
subject: child
definition: The child who is not the natural child of the parents but has become a true child by legal action. Can be considered a legal heir.

name: admission to the bar
subject: denote person attorney
definition: The expression denotes a person, an attorney , has been admitted to the bar after fulfilling all the requirements and is able to practice law.

name: administrative system
subject: system
definition: The system that is created by legislation where an agency is empowered to make a binding rule and regulation.

name: administrative assistant
subject: employee
definition: An employee who is the runner to the administrative executive. They type, file, and do office related jobs.

name: adjournal
subject: original records
definition: A term applied in Scotch law and practice to the records of the criminal courts. The original records of criminal trials were called “bukis of adiornale,” or “books of adjournal,” few of which are now extant An “act of adjournal” is an order of the court of justiciary entered on its minutes.

name: adjournal
subject: extant act
definition: A term applied in Scotch law and practice to the records of the criminal courts. The original records of criminal trials were called “bukis of adiornale,” or “books of adjournal,” few of which are now extant An “act of adjournal” is an order of the court of justiciary entered on its minutes.

name: actus servi in iis quibus opera ejus conimuniter adliibita est, actus domini habetur
subject: act
definition: The act of a servant in those things in which he is usually employed, is considered the act of his master. Lofft, 227.

name: actuarial pricing
subject: actuarial pricing
definition: In INSURANCE, the pricing of RISK based on probabilities of loss occurrence constructed from statistical distributions. Actuarial pricing is used to develop PREMIUMS that are intended to cover losses from underwritten risks and provide future benefits payable to beneficiaries. See also ACTUARIAL EQUIVALENT.

name: actore non probante reus absolvitur
subject: plaintiff
definition: When the plaintiff does not prove his case the defendant is acquitted. Hob. 103.

name: actor sequitur forum rei
subject: rci
definition: According as rci is intended as the genitive of res, a tiling, or reus, a defendant, this phrase means: The plaintiff follows the forum of the property in suit, or the forum of the defendant’s residence. Branch, Max. 4.

name: actor sequitur forum rei
subject: rci
definition: According as rci is intended as the genitive of res, a tiling, or reus, a defendant, this phrase means: The plaintiff follows the forum of the property in suit, or the forum of the defendant’s residence. Branch, Max. 4.

name: actor sequitur forum rei
subject: plaintiff
definition: According as rci is intended as the genitive of res, a tiling, or reus, a defendant, this phrase means: The plaintiff follows the forum of the property in suit, or the forum of the defendant’s residence. Branch, Max. 4.

name: activity center
subject: two or more activities
definition: When two or more activities have a grouped cost.

name: activity based management (abm)
subject: management
definition: When management adds activities that help and removes ones that don’t. It improves efficiency and market effectiveness. It tries to reduce cost, measure performance, improve cash flow, improve quality, and enhance value or a product.

name: active market
subject: market
definition: When the market experiences heavy trading.

name: act of man
subject: owner
definition: Marine insurance that covers cargo sacrifice to keep a vessel safe. The owner takes some percent of the value.

name: acquisition financing
subject: fund
definition: Funds acquired to purchase an additional business immediately usually repaid with shares or interest from the company purchased.

name: accumulated earnings tax
subject: tax
definition: A tax that occurs when a company overstates income and profits.

name: accumulated earnings tax
subject: tax
definition: A tax that occurs when a company overstates income and profits.

name: accumulated earnings tax
subject: company
definition: A tax that occurs when a company overstates income and profits.

name: accumulated earnings tax
subject: company
definition: A tax that occurs when a company overstates income and profits.

name: accountant’s responsibility
subject: accountants job
definition: An accountants job to be careful with funds, follow rules and standards, and show a fair view of the position.

name: accountant’s responsibility
subject: accountants job
definition: An accountants job to be careful with funds, follow rules and standards, and show a fair view of the position.

name: banking
subject: business
definition: The business of receiving money on deposit, loaning money, discounting notes, issuing notes for circulation, collecting money on notes deposited, negotiating bills, etc. Bank v. Turner, 154 Ind. 456, 57 N. E. 110. See BANK; BANKER.

name: banker
subject: private person
definition: A private person who keeps a bank; one who is engaged in the business of banking. People v. Doty, 80 N. Y. 228; Auten v. Bank, 174 U. S. 125, 19 Sup. Ct. 628, 43 L. Ed. 920; Richmond v. Blake, 132 U. S. 592, 10 Sup. Ct. 204, 33 L. Ed. 481; Meadowcroft v. People, 163 111. 56, 45 N. E 303, 35 L R. A. 176, 54 Am. St Rep. 447.

name: de cibariis tjtendis
subject: title
definition: Of victuals to be used. The title of a sumptuary statute passed 10 Edw. III. St. 3, to restrain the expense of entertainments. Barring. Ob. St. 240.

name: eligible termination payment
subject: lump sum
definition: Australian; superannuation fund lump sum payment at retirement or employee termination. Also, a lump sum paid an individual at termination or reduction of a pension or annuity. Or, residual capital value paid at the end of annuity term or pension; can also be a lump sum. Refer to Eligible termination payments (ETP)

name: eligible securities
subject: bank
definition: Securities that BANKS are allowed to purchase, hold, and trade on a direct basis, including GOVERNMENT BONDS and AGENCY SECURITIES. Those ruled ineligible under standing regulations must often be traded through a separately incorporated and regulated subsidiary.

name: eligible person
subject: person
definition: A person allowed to participate in services under a contract. Not necessarily an eligible employee. Possibly union members or part of an association. The person may be a spouse or child related to the participating person.

name: eligible offer
subject: something
definition: Something made available when requirements are met. Example: offering a particular coverage to eligible people.

name: eligible contract participant
subject: participant
definition: Participants required to own or be able to commit to a sufficient regulated status and have available a specific amount of assets. Participant can be either an individual or a group. Participants engage in financial transactions not open to retail customers, under requirements outlined in the Commodity Exchange Act.

name: eligible contract participant
subject: participant
definition: Participants required to own or be able to commit to a sufficient regulated status and have available a specific amount of assets. Participant can be either an individual or a group. Participants engage in financial transactions not open to retail customers, under requirements outlined in the Commodity Exchange Act.

name: feal
subject: tenant
definition: Faithful. Tenants by knight service swore to their lords to he fcal and leal; i.e., faithful aud loyal.

name: fdic insured account
subject: maximum
definition: An account that is covered for loss because of lender insolvency. The maximum is $250,000 for each account.

name: fbimje impressionis
subject: primce impressionis
definition: A case primce impressionis (of the first impression) is a case of a new kind, to which no established principle of law or precedent directly applies, and which must be decided entirely by reason as distinguished from authority.

name: favorable balance of trade
subject: country
definition: When a country gets more exports than imports.

name: favorable balance of payments
subject: payments country
definition: The payments a country gets more than it has to make giving surplus. More money is in than out.

name: favor
subject: challenge.favorabilia
definition: Bias; partiality; lenity; prejudice. See CHALLENGE.Favorabilia in lege sunt fiscus, dos, vita, libertas. Jenk. Cent. 94. Things favorablyconsidered in law are the treasury, dower, life, liberty.Favorabiliores rei, potius quam ac- tores, habentur. The condition of the defendantmust be favored, rather than that of the plaintiff. In other words, mclior est conditiodefendentis. Dig. 50, 17, 125; Broom, Max. 715.Favorabiliores sunt executiones aliis proccssibus quibuscunque. Co. Litt. 289.Executions are preferred to all other processes whatever.Favores ampliandi sunt; odia restrin- genda. Jenk. Cent. ISO. Favors are to beenlarged; things hateful restrained.

name: ghost surgery
subject: term
definition: a term used when a patient undergoes surgery and a different surgeon does the operation without the patients consent.

name: ghost surgery
subject: term
definition: a term used when a patient undergoes surgery and a different surgeon does the operation without the patients consent.

name: gestation, utero-gestation
subject: female
definition: In medical jurisprudence. The time during which a female, who has conceived, carriesthe embryo or foetus in her uterus.

name: gestation, utero-gestation
subject: female
definition: In medical jurisprudence. The time during which a female, who has conceived, carriesthe embryo or foetus in her uterus.

name: gerrymander
subject: name
definition: A name given to the process of dividing a state or other territoryinto the authorized civil or political divisions, but with such a geographical arrangementas to accomplish a sinister or unlawful purpose, as, for instance, to secure a majorityfor a given political party in districts where the result would be otherwise if they weredivided according to obvious natural lines, or to arrange school districts so that childrenof certain religions or nationalities shall be brought within one district and those of adifferent Religion or nationality in another district. State v. Whitford, 54 Wis. 150, 11 N.W. 424.

name: gerrymander
subject: geographical arrangementas
definition: A name given to the process of dividing a state or other territoryinto the authorized civil or political divisions, but with such a geographical arrangementas to accomplish a sinister or unlawful purpose, as, for instance, to secure a majorityfor a given political party in districts where the result would be otherwise if they weredivided according to obvious natural lines, or to arrange school districts so that childrenof certain religions or nationalities shall be brought within one district and those of adifferent Religion or nationality in another district. State v. Whitford, 54 Wis. 150, 11 N.W. 424.

name: gerrymander
subject: instance
definition: A name given to the process of dividing a state or other territoryinto the authorized civil or political divisions, but with such a geographical arrangementas to accomplish a sinister or unlawful purpose, as, for instance, to secure a majorityfor a given political party in districts where the result would be otherwise if they weredivided according to obvious natural lines, or to arrange school districts so that childrenof certain religions or nationalities shall be brought within one district and those of adifferent Religion or nationality in another district. State v. Whitford, 54 Wis. 150, 11 N.W. 424.

name: gerontocomi
subject: officer
definition: In the civil law. Officers appointed to manage hospitals for the aged poor.

name: gerke v purcell 25 ohio st 243
subject: charity
definition: Charity, in its widest sense, denotes all the good affections men ought to bear towards each other; in a restricted and common sense, relief of the poor. Morice v.

name: in equity practice
subject: paper
definition: A paper presented to a master in chancery by a party to a cause, being a written statement of the items with which the opposite party should be debited or should account for, or of the claim of the party making it It is more comprehensive than a claim, which implies only the amount due to the person producing it, while a charge may embrace the whole liabilities of the. accounting party. Hoff. Mast. 36.

name: in equity practice
subject: charge
definition: A paper presented to a master in chancery by a party to a cause, being a written statement of the items with which the opposite party should be debited or should account for, or of the claim of the party making it It is more comprehensive than a claim, which implies only the amount due to the person producing it, while a charge may embrace the whole liabilities of the. accounting party. Hoff. Mast. 36.

name: uniformity
subject: uniformity
definition: In taxation. Uniformity In taxation implies equality in the burden of taxation, which cannot exist without uniformity in the mode of assessment, as well as in the rate of taxation. Further, the uniformity must be coextensive with the territory to which it applies. And it must be extended to all property subject to taxation, so that all property may be taxed alike and equally. Exchange Bank v. Hines, 3 Ohio St. 15. And see Edye v. Bobertson, 112 U. S. 580, 5 Sup. Ct. 247, 28 L Ed. 798. Adams v. Mississippi State Bank, 75 Miss. 701, 23 South. 395; People v. Auditor Gereral, 7 Mich. 90.

name: uniform gifts to minors act
subject: holder
definition: Regulation allowing the adult right to contribute funds to a minor’s account that doesn’t need setting up a trust fund. Adult will manage the account until the holder reaches 18 years of age.

name: accountant in charge
subject: person
definition: The person who oversees the accounting audit.

name: accountable
subject: party
definition: This party is assigned responsibilities and is in charge of the account in question.

name: accountability matrix
subject: table
definition: A table used to report on a project that shows everything done and ordered. It makes sure all things are done in proper order and is completed. AKA responsibility matrix.

name: account party
subject: letter of credit
