name: letter of acceptance
subject: that candidate
definition: Formal acceptance of a position or award by the successful candidate using written communication. Details of a position including salary, perquisites, starting date, location of the reporting office, and the name of the superior to whom the candidate will be reporting are typical detail to insure that the candidate has this information correct..

name: letter of attorney
subject: power of attorney
definition: A power of attorney; a written instrument by which one person constitutes another his true and lawful attorney, in order that the latter may dc lor the former, and in his place and stead, some lawful act. People v. Smith, 112 Mich. 192, 70 N. W. 400, 07 Am. St. Rep. 392; Civ. Code La. 1900, art. 2985.

name: letter of attorney
subject: one person
definition: A power of attorney; a written instrument by which one person constitutes another his true and lawful attorney, in order that the latter may dc lor the former, and in his place and stead, some lawful act. People v. Smith, 112 Mich. 192, 70 N. W. 400, 07 Am. St. Rep. 392; Civ. Code La. 1900, art. 2985.

name: non bis in idem
subject: maxim
definition: Not twice for the same; that is, a man shall not be twice tried for the same crime. This maxim of the civil law (Code, 9, 2, 9, 11) expresses the same principle as the familiar rule of our law that a mau shall uot be twice “put iu jeopardy” for the same offense.

name: refractory
subject: refractory materials
definition: Materials that can tolerate extremely high temperatures without degrading or softening. Refractory materials include certain ceramics and super alloys, and are found in furnaces, jet and rocket engines, and the shuttle.

name: refractory
subject: refractory materials
definition: Materials that can tolerate extremely high temperatures without degrading or softening. Refractory materials include certain ceramics and super alloys, and are found in furnaces, jet and rocket engines, and the shuttle.

name: letter of renunciation
subject: stockholder shareholder issue
definition: An allottee-stockholder-shareholder issues this written notification, renouncing or transferring new-issue allotted securities or rights to an issue to other stockholder(s).

name: letter of refusal
subject: state
definition: Refuseal to comply with a stated contract requirement is documented in this written confirmation. Clearly states why and must suggest alternatives for resolution. A subcontractor or vendor not willing to disclose proprietary information to a prime contractor uses this vehicle. May state willingness to disclose directly to the customer under signed non-disclosure. Typically a written statement obtained by a main or prime contractor from a subcontractor or vendor.

name: letter of moral intent
subject: parent company
definition: Parent company gives written notice to a bank of good-faith intention of financial support for a subsidiary working to borrow money from the bank. Not a binding contract of support for the subsidiary. Verifies that the subsidiary is borrowing money with the approval and monitoring by the parent company.

name: letter of moral intent
subject: parent company
definition: Parent company gives written notice to a bank of good-faith intention of financial support for a subsidiary working to borrow money from the bank. Not a binding contract of support for the subsidiary. Verifies that the subsidiary is borrowing money with the approval and monitoring by the parent company.

name: levari facias
subject: writ of execution
definition: Lat. A writ of execution directing the sheriff to cause to be made of the lands and chattels of the judgment debtor the sum recovered by the judgment. Pentland v. Kelly, 6 Watts & S. (Pa.) 4S4.     Also a writ to the bishop of the diocese, commanding him to enter into the benefice of a judgment debtor, and take and sequester the same into his possession, and hold the same until he shall have levied the amount of the judgment out of the rents, tithes, and profits thereof.

name: leveled time
subject: effort skill
definition: Effort, skill, and work conditions reflect differentiating factors in operator performance leading to adjusted average time.

name: leveled time
subject: work conditions
definition: Effort, skill, and work conditions reflect differentiating factors in operator performance leading to adjusted average time.

name: register of patents
subject: public official
definition: a public official who keeps on file by recording the various patents.

name: non-commissioned
subject: subordinate officer
definition: A non-commissioned officer of the army or militia is a subordinate officer who holds his rank, not by commission from the executive authority of the state or nation, but by appointment by a superior officer.

name: registrar
subject: officer
definition: An officer who has the custody or keeping of a registry or register. This word is used in England; “register” is more common in America.

name: registrar
subject: officer
definition: An officer who has the custody or keeping of a registry or register. This word is used in England; “register” is more common in America.

name: registrar
subject: officer
definition: An officer who has the custody or keeping of a registry or register. This word is used in England; “register” is more common in America.

name: liability management
subject: intent
definition: Balancing deposits, CDs, and the like using specific liquidity reserves as a process by which financial institutions mitigate liability. Intent is to reduce liquidity risks and adverse market condition impacts against the banks and other lenders.

name: liability for manufactured products
subject: negligence
definition: If negligence or failure of due diligence is a potential hazard to a person’s life or property, the manufacturers are obligated to take reasonable care.

name: liability for manufactured products
subject: failure
definition: If negligence or failure of due diligence is a potential hazard to a person’s life or property, the manufacturers are obligated to take reasonable care.

name: regulator
subject: regulator
definition: A regulator is an independent device that is used to determine and maintain the operating parameters of a system.

name: regulation z
subject: truth in lending act
definition: The Truth in Lending Act requires lenders to advise the borrower in writing of all costs that are associated with the credit portion of a financial transaction.

name: license and permit bonds
subject: jurisdiction
definition: A jurisdiction-mandated occupation-specific bond that identifies the bearer worker as being licensed to sell occupation-services in that jurisdiction, required to comply with occupational governing laws. Obtaining this bond often requires the bearer to be insured against liabilities.

name: lienor
subject: person
definition: The person having or owning a lien; one who has a right of lien upon prop- erty of another.

name: relationship marketing
subject: company
definition: A marketing strategy in which a company seeks to build long-term relationships with its customers by providing consistent satisfaction.

name: life income
subject: life time option
definition: Even if the principal amount is exhausted this settlement agreement’s life-time option continues paying the beneficiary in installments.

name: life support
subject: sustenance protection
definition: Health, safety, sustenance, protection, and a means of escape, survival, and recovery of personnel is how this application of scientific knowledge ties into critical human factors.

name: life support
subject: means
definition: Health, safety, sustenance, protection, and a means of escape, survival, and recovery of personnel is how this application of scientific knowledge ties into critical human factors.

name: relevant cost
subject: concept
definition: A managerial accounting term that is used to describe costs that are specific to management’s decisions. The concept of relevant costs eliminates unnecessary data that could complicate the decision-making process.

name: relevant cash flow
subject: valuation mechanism
definition: A common valuation mechanism is the ratio of a company’s price to its measured or expected earnings. This is the PE ratio.

name: relevant cash flow
subject: valuation mechanism
definition: A common valuation mechanism is the ratio of a company’s price to its measured or expected earnings. This is the PE ratio.

name: light emitting diode (led)
subject: lighting bulb
definition: Electronic device, the diode, that emits light by restricting electric current through it. LED-based lighting bulbs consume little current and last for decades. Red or green came from older LEDs made from semiconductor material such as gallium arsenide. Any color emits from newer LEDs made from synthetic materials like phenylenevinyl.

name: light emitting diode (led)
subject: lighting bulb
definition: Electronic device, the diode, that emits light by restricting electric current through it. LED-based lighting bulbs consume little current and last for decades. Red or green came from older LEDs made from semiconductor material such as gallium arsenide. Any color emits from newer LEDs made from synthetic materials like phenylenevinyl.

name: nonfeasance
subject: failure
definition: The neglect or failure of a person to do some act which he ought to do. The term is not generally used to denote a breach of contract, but rather the failure to perform a duty towards the public whereby some individual sustains special damage, as where a sheriff fails to execute a writ. Sweet. See Coite v. Lines. 33 Conn. 115; Gregor v. Cady, 82 Me. 131, 19 Atl. 108. 17 Am. St. Rep. 406; Carr v. Kansas City (C. C.) 87 Fed. 1; Minkler v. State. 14 Neb. 1S1, 15 X. W. 330; Illinois Cent. R. Co. v. Foulks. 191 111. 57, 60 X. E. 890.

name: limited distribution
subject: specific location
definition: Specific location or specific chain of stores scopes product sales.

name: limited distribution
subject: specific chain
definition: Specific location or specific chain of stores scopes product sales.

name: limits
subject: loss
definition: In Insurance, this is a multi-used term. Loss or damage payout typically has a maximum benefit as a limit. An insurer often has an age limit beyond which no policy will be issued. Some policies end at an age limit.

name: limits
subject: damage payout
definition: In Insurance, this is a multi-used term. Loss or damage payout typically has a maximum benefit as a limit. An insurer often has an age limit beyond which no policy will be issued. Some policies end at an age limit.

name: limited policies
subject: term
definition: This term is used to refer to a contract with low limits and limited forms, specifically in health insurance. These contracts state the specific occurrences where payment will be made

name: line slip
subject: broker
definition: A broker-written document describing a prospective risk that is given to underwriters to decide on their willingness to insure what fraction of risk described.

name: normal law
subject: law
definition: A law which applies to a normal individual who has no legal liabilities.

name: normal good
subject: income elasticity of demand
definition: Demand for these goods increases  at a slower rate in comparison to the increase in income. The income elasticity of demand for normal goods is a positive number that is  less than one. Inferior goods are the  opposite of normal or necessary goods.

name: renegade
subject: one
definition: One who has changed his profession of faith or opinion ; one who has deserted his church or party.

name: liner service
subject: conference carrier
definition: A conference carrier provides this scheduled service.

name: rent-to-own
subject: rent-to-own
definition: Rent-to-own, also known as rental-purchase, is a type of legally documented transaction under which tangible property, such as furniture, consumer electronics and home appliances, is leased in exchange for a weekly or monthly payment, with the option to purchase at some point during the agreement

name: liquidated damages
subject: specify action
definition: Cash compensation, agreed to by signed, written contract for breach of contract, payable to the aggrieved party. The contract succinctly specifies what actions, or omissions, constitute a breach. To be legally enforceable, the contract’s nature makes damages circumstantially reasonable and difficult to determine. Otherwise, a court could interpret the specified amount as a fine, being in the contract primarily to force proper performance, and not to compensate injury. Under these conditions, the court views damages as ‘unliquidated’ to be assigned by the court based on the case’s merits alone.

name: liquidated damages
subject: omission
definition: Cash compensation, agreed to by signed, written contract for breach of contract, payable to the aggrieved party. The contract succinctly specifies what actions, or omissions, constitute a breach. To be legally enforceable, the contract’s nature makes damages circumstantially reasonable and difficult to determine. Otherwise, a court could interpret the specified amount as a fine, being in the contract primarily to force proper performance, and not to compensate injury. Under these conditions, the court views damages as ‘unliquidated’ to be assigned by the court based on the case’s merits alone.

name: liquidated and unliquidated damages
subject: watt
definition: The former term is applicable when the amount of the damages has been ascertained by the judgment in the action, or when a specific sum of money has been expressly stipulated by the parties to a bond or other contract as the amount of damages to be recovered by either party for a breach of the agreement by the other. Watts v. Shep- pard, 2 Ala. 445; Smith v. Smith, 4 Wend. (N. Y.) 470: Keeble v. Keeble, 85 Ala. 552, 5 South. 149: Eakin v. Scott, 70 Tex. 442, 7 S. W. 777. Unliquidated damages are such as are not yet reduced to a certainty in respect of amount, nothing more being established than the plaintiff’s right to recover; or such as cannot be fixed by a mere mathematical calculation from ascertained data in the case. Cox v. Mclaughlin, 76 Cal. 60, 18 Pac. 100, 9 Am. St. Rep. 164.

name: not negotiable
subject: statement
definition: A statement on a bill of exchange which prohibits it from being transferred or traded. The statement reads ‘not negotiable’, except in the case of check where it can be made non negotiable by crossing it. As such, the actual owner cannot transfer ownership of such bills.

name: not negotiable
subject: case
definition: A statement on a bill of exchange which prohibits it from being transferred or traded. The statement reads ‘not negotiable’, except in the case of check where it can be made non negotiable by crossing it. As such, the actual owner cannot transfer ownership of such bills.

name: not less than (nlt)
subject: negotiating contract
definition: When negotiating a contract, it is the assurance from the vendor that the value of the property will not be less than the proposed value and the estimates that will be submitted later. Depending on the changes made to the property, the NLT value may be higher or lower.

name: liquidity preference theory
subject: investor
definition: When investors expect a higher return with immediately sold. Refer to market segmentation theory.

name: liquidity path
subject: owner
definition: The route taken by a company to have liquidity allowing its owners or founders to convert their ownership in the company to other means of currency or investments. Initial public stock offerings or merger with a larger company are some forms of liquidity paths.

name: liquidity path
subject: founder
definition: The route taken by a company to have liquidity allowing its owners or founders to convert their ownership in the company to other means of currency or investments. Initial public stock offerings or merger with a larger company are some forms of liquidity paths.

name: liquidity crunch
subject: business
definition: High demand with short cash resources available. Businesses and consumers pay higher loan interest rates more difficult to obtain during a liquidity crunch, . Also known as liquidity crisis and credit crunch.

name: liquidity crunch
subject: consumer
definition: High demand with short cash resources available. Businesses and consumers pay higher loan interest rates more difficult to obtain during a liquidity crunch, . Also known as liquidity crisis and credit crunch.

name: listeriosis
subject: cook chill dish
definition: Infected ready-to-eat meat, dairy products, salads, and cook chill dishes transmit Listeria monocytogenes, a grampositive bacteria that causes foodborne disease. Dark red rash over legs and trunks, flulike fever, and lethargy, leading to circulatory collapse and shock are its symptoms. Meningitis, inflammation of connective brain tissue, and miscarriages result from it. Temperatures above 74

name: listed user
subject: member
definition: Members of the same household who do not drive an insured vehicle.

name: notice immediate
subject: term
definition: the term given to the time a person has to make an insurance claim.

name: literary work
subject: word number
definition: Written words, numbers, or symbols in any medium, but not audio visually, expresses an intellectual content.

name: literary work
subject: symbol
definition: Written words, numbers, or symbols in any medium, but not audio visually, expresses an intellectual content.

name: notice of sale
subject: notice
definition: This notice is a legal requirement that has to be issued by the lender before the intended sale of the mortgaged property due to foreclosure.

name: notice of pendency
subject: that piece
definition: used in real estate that indicates that a piece of property has a lien against it and a person needs to take care before taking title to it.

name: notice of pendency
subject: person
definition: used in real estate that indicates that a piece of property has a lien against it and a person needs to take care before taking title to it.

name: repositorium
subject: storehouse
definition: A storehouse or place wherein things are kept; a warehouse. Cro. Car. 555.

name: repositorium
subject: thing
definition: A storehouse or place wherein things are kept; a warehouse. Cro. Car. 555.

name: repositorium
subject: place
definition: A storehouse or place wherein things are kept; a warehouse. Cro. Car. 555.

name: republic
subject: legislative power
definition: A commonwealth; a form of government which derives all its powers directly or indirectly from the general body of citizens, and in which the executive power is lodged in officers chosen by and representing the people, and holding office for a limited period, or at most during good behavior or at the pleasure of the people, and in which the legislative power may be (and in modern republics is) intrusted to a representative assembly. See Federalist, No. 39; Republic of Mexico v. De Arangoiz, 5 Duer (N. Y.) 636; State v. Harris, 2 Bailey (S. C.) 599. In a wider sense, the state, the common weal, the whole organized political community, without reference to tlie form of government; as in the maxim interest reipulliear ut sit finis litium. Co. Litt. 303.

name: novation
subject: novation
definition: Novation is the substitution of a new debt or obligation for an existing one. Civ. Code Cal.

name: novated lease
subject: portion
definition: An agreement in Australia which allows businesses to lease transportation for its employees. However, a portion of the employee’s wage is deducted to cover the leasing costs. The company is liable for any default payments and accompanying taxeson the lease or purchase of the vehicle. In the event that the employee terminates his/her employment, the costs are transferred to the leaving employee.

name: loan application
subject: loan application
definition: Document on which the lender bases the decision to lend. A loan application is neither a pledge by the applicant nor a commitment by the lender. Contains essential financial and other borrower information. Detailed business plan, 3-year and loan-life current and projected income statements showing profit and loss, balance sheet, and cash flow statement are required for a business loan. Loan amount and purpose, period and means of repayment, and guaranties and/or collateral offered are required of a company applying for a loan. Banks generally use standard forms for the applicant to fill-in for a consumer loan. Also known as credit application.

name: loan agreement
subject: formal document
definition: Formal document, the signed contract, evidence a loan. Negative and positive covenants, guaranties, financial reporting requirements, applicable interest rate and fees, and how the loan will be repaid and over what period, type and value of the collateral pledged, are some of the parts and inclusions to a loan agreement.

name: noyau dur
subject: longstanding business
definition: When the french have longstanding business with a company they expect this form of loyalty.

name: loan officer
subject: person
definition: Person authorized to act on behalf of the lender within specified limits as an official representative of a lending institution.

name: rescue doctrine
subject: states person
definition: a principle that states a person who causes an injury may be held liable for the injuries sustained by a third person who comes in to help, or rescue, the injured party.

name: lobbyist
subject: name
definition: the name given to a person who tries to influence the legislators to vote in favour of a certain legislation.

name: numeric reliability
subject: probability
definition: The probability that an item will fulfill its operations for the duration specified without being spoilt.

name: numeric reliability
subject: that item
definition: The probability that an item will fulfill its operations for the duration specified without being spoilt.

name: numbered account
subject: bank
definition: The allocation of a unique number to identify an account holder instead of his name. All banks follow this system of allocation and reference.

name: resident
subject: one
definition: One who has his residence in a place.  “Resident” and “inhabitant” are distinguishable in meaning. The word “inhabitant” implies a more fixed and permanent abode than does “resident;” and a resident may not be entitled to all the privileges or subject to all the duties of an inhabitant. Frost v. Brisbin, 19 Wend. (N. Y.) 11, 32 Am. Dec. 423.  Also a tenant, who was obliged to reside on his lord’s land, and not to depart from the same; called, also, “homme levant et couch- ant,” and in Normandy, “resscant du fief.”

name: residual security
subject: financial tool
definition: A financial tool used to increase a companies dilution. After all other tranches are used this is the last move. The value is uncertain due to market variables. The issuer of the security retains what is left.

name: log date
subject: logging activities
definition: Made while logging activities in a log book, this is the specific calendar date and/or time that the entry was posted.

name: log date
subject: logging activities
definition: Made while logging activities in a log book, this is the specific calendar date and/or time that the entry was posted.

name: lodgings
subject: habitation
definition: Habitation in another’s house; apartments in another’s house, furnished or unfurnished, occupied for habitation ; the occupier being termed a “lodger.”

name: logographus
subject: clerk register
definition: In Roman law. A public clerk, register, or book-keeper; one LOGS 737

name: logographus
subject: book keeper
definition: In Roman law. A public clerk, register, or book-keeper; one LOGS 737

name: london metal exchange (lme)
definition: Futures exchange for non-ferrous metal and plastics based in London, England. 1571 saw the establishment of the Royal Exchange, London’s first stock exchange, which evolved into the LME.

name: long term care insurance
subject: insure
definition: Once an insured becomes a resident in a nursing home, a daily benefit payout comes from this health insurance.

name: monetary policy
subject: government
definition: Government’s chosen economic strategy, deciding to increase or decrease the country’s money supply. A monetary policy is typically applied through the central bank. Three major tools are: (1) buying or selling national debt, (2) changing credit restrictions, and (3) changing interest rates and reserve requirements. In control of the aggregate demand it plays the dominant role over, by extension, of economic inflation. Also known as monetary regime. Also refer to monetarism.

name: lookout
subject: proper lookout
definition: A proper lookout on a vessel is some one in a favorable position to see, stationed near enough to the helmsman to communicate with him, and to receive communications from him, and exclusively employed in watching the movements of vessels which they are meeting or about to pass. The Genesee Chief v. Fitzhugh, 12 How. 462, 13 L. Ed. 1058.

name: lookback period
definition: Determining if a company is paying employment taxes on the correct depositing schedule during this timeframe. July 1 through the next June 30 is this timeframe. A company decides during this time period if it should pay taxes on a semi-weekly or monthly basis, using the total paid-taxes amount.

name: loss expectancy
subject: insure
definition: Maximum loss estimate most likely due as an exposure. the insured takes special attention to loss prevention measures.

name: loss development factor
subject: claim
definition: Claims reported late give the insurer extra money due to this factor introduced to permit development of losses and reimbursement.

name: loss carryback
subject: accounting adjustment
definition: Current year’s net loss offsets previous year’s taxable income as an accounting adjustment, giving a tax refund as already paid. US tax law allowance. Also refer to loss carryforward.

name: loss assessor
subject: insurer insurance company
definition: The insurer / insurance company hires one for an insured’s insurance claim investigation and settlement an insured. This person is typically and independent entity. Also refer to loss adjustor.

name: loss on sale of assets
subject: company
definition: When a company liquidates assets, it must record income decrease on the balance sheet.

name: loss of specie
subject: cement
definition: Severe damage making an insured item a total loss because the item is no longer what it was when undamaged. Water soaked cement is an example.

name: loss of right to vote
subject: person
definition: the term used when a person who has committed a major criminal act and is not allowed to vote.

name: lot and scot
subject: certain duties
definition: In English law. Certain duties which must be paid by those who claim to exercise the elective franchise within certain cities and boroughs, before they are entitled to vote. It is said that the practice became uniform to refer to the poor- rate as a register of “scot and lot” voters; so that the term, when employed to define a right of election, meant only the payment by a parishioner of the sum to which he was assessed on the poor-rate. Brown.

name: lossless compression
subject: decompression process
definition: Compression-decompression process using compression algorithms, yet experiencing no data loss. Data file size reduction technique. The decompressed file is identical in every way to the original file while not having high compression ratios. Most often used in text file compression.

name: losses outstanding
subject: summary statement
definition: Summary statement of an insurer’s not-yet-settled claims.

name: lucas wedge
subject: economy
definition: When the economy suffers a downturn, this is a visual display of society’s costs. Represents output loss resulting from growth rate tied to the real gross domestic product slowing down.

name: lunar month
subject: two successive new moons
definition: Equal to 29.53 days. Two successive new moons define this period.

name: luminare
subject: lamp
definition: A lamp or candle set burning on the altar of any church or chapel, for the maintenance whereof lands and rent- charges wfere frequently given to parish churches, etc. Keuuett, Gloss.

name: luminare
subject: lamp
definition: A lamp or candle set burning on the altar of any church or chapel, for the maintenance whereof lands and rent- charges wfere frequently given to parish churches, etc. Keuuett, Gloss.

name: luminare
subject: candle set
definition: A lamp or candle set burning on the altar of any church or chapel, for the maintenance whereof lands and rent- charges wfere frequently given to parish churches, etc. Keuuett, Gloss.

name: luminare
subject: candle set
definition: A lamp or candle set burning on the altar of any church or chapel, for the maintenance whereof lands and rent- charges wfere frequently given to parish churches, etc. Keuuett, Gloss.

name: lyndhurst’s (lord) act
subject: statute
definition: This statute (5 & 6 Wm. IV. c. 54) renders marriages within the prohibited degrees absolutely null and void. Theretofore such marriages were voidable merely.

name: lying by
subject: person
definition: A person who, by his presence and silence at a transaction which affects his interests, may be fairly supposed to acquiesce in it, if he afterwards propose to disturb the arrangement, is said to lie prevented from doing so by reason that he has been lying by.

name: return on investment (roi)
subject: which ones
definition: A formula used to determine profit made by an investment or to compare several investments to determine which ones generate the most capital.

name: returning officer
subject: official
definition: The official who conducts a parliamentary election in England. The sheriff In counties, and the mayor in boroughs. Wharton.

name: returnable process
subject: writ
definition: a writ where an officer of the court needs to give a report on his attempts to carry out the process.

name: revenue generation
subject: way company
definition: The way a company sells its services and goods in order to make an income.

name: revenue generation
subject: way company
definition: The way a company sells its services and goods in order to make an income.

name: reverse engineering
subject: method product
definition: A method where a product is de-constructed to see how it was made initially.

name: reverse cashandcarry arbitrage
subject: maturity
definition: When a forward/future is purchased at a price less than the spot price plus the cost of carry and the difference is loaned until maturity creating a profit. Refer to cashandcarry arbitrage.

name: revenue ruling
subject: business
definition: a ruling that is managed by the IRS that helps businesses allocate income and expenditure.

name: revenue ruling
subject: business
definition: a ruling that is managed by the IRS that helps businesses allocate income and expenditure.

name: revenue reserve
subject: revenue reserve
definition: The revenue reserve is that part of profit which has not been given to the shareholder but retained in the buisness for further growth. Hence revenue reserve, is the part of profits retained in the buisness.

name: revenue reserve
subject: revenue reserve
definition: The revenue reserve is that part of profit which has not been given to the shareholder but retained in the buisness for further growth. Hence revenue reserve, is the part of profits retained in the buisness.

name: reverse triangular merger
subject: process company
definition: A process where a company acquires another company and merges its subsidiary company as well.

name: reverse to maturity
subject: holder
definition: When a holder sells high coupon securities back with the understanding that at maturity, they will be able to repurchase these securities.

name: reverse stock split
subject: firm
definition: When a firm reduces its outstanding shares in an attempt to increase their value. They offer half the amount of shares at twice the price per share making the stock appear more valuable when in fact there is no difference. This is not a sign of stability

name: reverse stock split
subject: in fact
definition: When a firm reduces its outstanding shares in an attempt to increase their value. They offer half the amount of shares at twice the price per share making the stock appear more valuable when in fact there is no difference. This is not a sign of stability

name: reverse repo
subject: arrangement broker
definition: The arrangement where a broker or dealer buys a security and sells it on a set date at a higher price.

name: reverse repo
subject: dealer
definition: The arrangement where a broker or dealer buys a security and sells it on a set date at a higher price.

name: reverse mortgage
subject: lender
definition: When a lender gives monthly payments to a borrower using their property equity. This is usually done by elderly homeowners resulting in the borrower eventually owning the home.

name: revise
subject: casey
definition: To review, re-examine for correction; to go over a thing for the purpose of amending, correcting, rearranging, or otherwise improving it; as, to revise statutes, or a judgment. Casey v. Harned, 5 Iowa, 12; Vinsant v. Knox, 27 Ark. 272; Falconer v. Robinson, 46 Ala. 348.

name: revise
subject: casey
definition: To review, re-examine for correction; to go over a thing for the purpose of amending, correcting, rearranging, or otherwise improving it; as, to revise statutes, or a judgment. Casey v. Harned, 5 Iowa, 12; Vinsant v. Knox, 27 Ark. 272; Falconer v. Robinson, 46 Ala. 348.

name: revert
subject: owner
definition: To revert is to return. Thus, when the owner of an estate in land has granted a smaller estate to another person, on the determination of the latter estate, the land is said to “revert” to the grantor. Sweet

name: reversionary annuity
subject: benefit
definition: An annuity that acts as a life insurance policy. Benefits are paid to athe annuitant when the insured dies.

name: reversion value
subject: asset
definition: An assets estimated value at the end of the holding period when it is sold.

name: reversion
subject: reversion
definition: In real property law. A reversion is the residue of an estate left by operation of law in the grantor or his heirs, or in the heirs of a testator, commencing in possession on the determination of a particular estate granted or devised. How. St. Mich. 1882,

name: revocation of probate
subject: term
definition: a term for recalling a will that has been granted probate that happens as  a newer will is found or another substantial cause.

name: reward power
subject: extent
definition: The extent of the control given to an entity to disperse benefits or rewards.

name: reward power
subject: extent
definition: The extent of the control given to an entity to disperse benefits or rewards.

name: rich media ad
subject: animation
definition: An advertisement on the internet that contains an animation, flashing colours, audio and other range of enhancements.

name: rich media ad
subject: animation
definition: An advertisement on the internet that contains an animation, flashing colours, audio and other range of enhancements.

name: rial
subject: which time
definition: A piece of gold coin current for 10s.. in 1 lie reign of Henry VI., at which time there were half-rials and quarter-rials or rial- fartliings. In the beginning of Queen Eliza- beth’s reign, golden rials were coined at 15s. a piece; and in the time of James I. there were rose-rials of gold at 30s. and spur-rials at 15s. Lown. Essay Coins, 38.

name: rial
subject: which time
definition: A piece of gold coin current for 10s.. in 1 lie reign of Henry VI., at which time there were half-rials and quarter-rials or rial- fartliings. In the beginning of Queen Eliza- beth’s reign, golden rials were coined at 15s. a piece; and in the time of James I. there were rose-rials of gold at 30s. and spur-rials at 15s. Lown. Essay Coins, 38.

name: rial
subject: which time
definition: A piece of gold coin current for 10s.. in 1 lie reign of Henry VI., at which time there were half-rials and quarter-rials or rial- fartliings. In the beginning of Queen Eliza- beth’s reign, golden rials were coined at 15s. a piece; and in the time of James I. there were rose-rials of gold at 30s. and spur-rials at 15s. Lown. Essay Coins, 38.

name: right of division
subject: right
definition: In Scotch law. The right which each of several cautioners (sureties) has to refuse to answer for more than his own share of the debt To entitle the cautioner to this right the other cautioners must be solvent and there must be no words in the bond to exclude it. 1 Bell, Comm. 347.

name: right of discussion
subject: that creditor
definition: In Scotch law. The right which the cautioner (surety) has to insist that the creditor shall do his best to compel the performance of the contract by the principal debtor, before he shall be called upon. 1 Bell, Comm. 347.

name: right of rescission
subject: give
definition: The right given to borrowers where they can cancel a mortgage agreement within 3 days of signing the agreement.

name: rights in data
subject: right of possession
definition: The right of possession or use of a title of unpublished data or information where the holder has a competitive advantage.

name: rights in data
subject: use
definition: The right of possession or use of a title of unpublished data or information where the holder has a competitive advantage.

name: right-to-work law
subject: worker
definition: a state law in some states that forbids unions from insisting that worker’s join a union in order to work.

name: right to bear arms
subject: people
definition: the right of the 2nd amendment to allow people to bear arms.

name: riparian rights
subject: allocating
definition: The allocating of rights to use a body of water by individuals who own property around said body of water.

name: risk appraiser
subject: person
definition: A person from the insurer who screens all new applications and will approve or decline an application.

name: rising of court
subject: term
definition: Properly the final adjournment of the court for the term, though the term is also sometimes used to express the cessation of judicial business for the day or for a recess; it is the opposite of “sitting” or “session.” See State v. Weaver, 11 Neb. 163, 8 N. W. 385.

name: rising of court
subject: term
definition: Properly the final adjournment of the court for the term, though the term is also sometimes used to express the cessation of judicial business for the day or for a recess; it is the opposite of “sitting” or “session.” See State v. Weaver, 11 Neb. 163, 8 N. W. 385.

name: risk of ruin
subject: loss
definition: A risk that is so great that business will not be able to be carried on after it. The loss will exceed profit and the worth of the business.

name: risk of ruin
subject: loss
definition: A risk that is so great that business will not be able to be carried on after it. The loss will exceed profit and the worth of the business.

name: risk-adjusted capital ratio
subject: tool
definition: The tool used to measure how a financial institution is able to withstand a recession or risk that is a reflection of ite capital.

name: rod
subject: lineal measure
definition: A lineal measure of sixteen feet and a half, otherwise called a “perch.”

name: robinson-patman anti- discrimination act
subject: name
definition: the name of a statute that forbids a price discrimination between those who bought the commodities of similar grade and quality where the effect of discrimination may diminish competition or to create monopolies.

name: robbery
subject: robbery
definition: Robbery is the felonious taking of personal property In the possession of another, from his person or immediate presence, and against his will, accomplished by means of force or fear. Pen. Code Cal.

name: robber
subject: term
definition: One who commits a robbery. The term is not in law synonymous with “thief,” but applies only to one who steals with force or open violence. See De Roths- child v. Royal Mail Steam Packet Co., 7 Exch. 742; The Manitoba (D. C.) 104 Fed. 151.

name: roadstead
subject: station
definition: In maritime law. A known general station for ships, notoriously used as such, and distinguished by the name; and not any spot where an anchor will find bottom and fix Itself. 1 C. Rob. Adm. 232.

name: role player
subject: person
definition: A person who has been assigned specific functions or taskin a program, process or project.

name: role player
subject: person
definition: A person who has been assigned specific functions or taskin a program, process or project.

name: role player
subject: person
definition: A person who has been assigned specific functions or taskin a program, process or project.

name: role model
subject: person
definition: A person who others aspire to be like, may be a person alive or dead, someone you know or don’t know but would like to be the same as.

name: romney marsh
subject: law
definition: A tract of land in the county of Kent, England, containing twenty- four thousand acres, governed by certain ancient and equitable laws of sewers, composed by Henry de Bathe, a venerable judge iu the reign of king Henry III.; from which laws all commissioners of sewers in England may receive light and direction. 3 Bl. Comm. 73, note t; 4 Inst. 276.

name: romney marsh
subject: law
definition: A tract of land in the county of Kent, England, containing twenty- four thousand acres, governed by certain ancient and equitable laws of sewers, composed by Henry de Bathe, a venerable judge iu the reign of king Henry III.; from which laws all commissioners of sewers in England may receive light and direction. 3 Bl. Comm. 73, note t; 4 Inst. 276.

name: romney marsh
subject: commissioners of sewer
definition: A tract of land in the county of Kent, England, containing twenty- four thousand acres, governed by certain ancient and equitable laws of sewers, composed by Henry de Bathe, a venerable judge iu the reign of king Henry III.; from which laws all commissioners of sewers in England may receive light and direction. 3 Bl. Comm. 73, note t; 4 Inst. 276.

name: romney marsh

Comm. 73, note t; 4 Inst. 276.

name: roman law
subject: term
definition: This term, in a general sense, comprehends all tlie laws which pre- vailed among the Romans, without regard to the time of their origin, including the col- lections of Justinian.  In a more restricted sense, the Germans understand by this term merely the law of Justinian, as adopted by them. Mackeld. Rom. Law,

name: root of title
subject: abstract of title commences
definition: The document with which an abstract of title properly commences is called the “root” of the title. Sweet.

name: round-robin
subject: circle
definition: A circle divided from the center, like Arthur’s round table, whence its supposed origin. In each compartment is a signature, so that the entire circle, when filled, exhibits a list, without priority being given to any name. A common form of round-robin is simply to write the names in a circular form. Wharton.

name: round-robin
subject: entire circle
definition: A circle divided from the center, like Arthur’s round table, whence its supposed origin. In each compartment is a signature, so that the entire circle, when filled, exhibits a list, without priority being given to any name. A common form of round-robin is simply to write the names in a circular form. Wharton.

name: round tripping
subject: strategy business
definition: The strategy where a business will sell an asset and then want it back at a time in the future.

name: rucker plan
subject: worker
definition: An incentive plan for workers to save costs based on a formula relating labour costs to a share of cost of production.

name: routing number
subject: bank
definition: The set of numbers that allow a bank to determine where an account is located. It allows for direct debit payments to come from the right acount t the roght branch of the bank.

name: rules cross
subject: situation parties
definition: the situation where both parties in a suit obtain a rule nisi.

name: rule to show cause
subject: rule
definition: a rule that orders a party to show why he has not carried out certain acts or why they should not be carried out.

name: rule of 72
subject: way
definition: A way used to calculate the time that a sum invested will double at a set interest rate; or calculation of the interest rate needed for a sum to double with a set time frame.

name: running cost
subject: cost
definition: The cost it takes to operate an organisation on a regular basis.

name: run on the bank
subject: number
definition: Where a number of the banks customers all withdraw their money fearing that the institution may become insolvent shortly.

name: run on the bank
subject: customer
definition: Where a number of the banks customers all withdraw their money fearing that the institution may become insolvent shortly.

name: rupert murdoch
subject: billionaire mogul
definition: The billionaire mogul of media who holds the major share in News Corp. An Australian with interests in print, television and music publications.

name: rustler

name: running policy
subject: running policy
definition: A running policy is one which contemplates successive in- surances, and which provides that the object ‘of the policy may be from time to time defined, especially as to the subjects of insurance, by additional statements or indorse- ments. Civ. Code Cal.

name: rotten clause
subject: clause
definition: A clause sometimes inserted in policies of marine insurance, to the effect that “if, on a regular survey, the ship shall be declared unseaworthy by reason of being rotten or unsound,” the insurers shall be discharged. 1 Phil. Ins.

name: risk-free rate of return
subject: rate of return
definition: The rate of return that is optimum for an investment without incurring any risk where the investor receives the principal and a small return over a time period.

name: risk limit
subject: amount
definition: The amount of risk a person from a firm or bank is allowed to expose his employer to.

name: ripuarian eaw
subject: ancient code
definition: An ancient code of laws by which the Ripuarii, a tribe of Franks who occupied the country upon the Rhine, the Meuse, and the Scheldt, were governed. They were first reduced to writing by The- odoric, king of Austrasia, and completed by Dagobert. Spelman.

name: riptoweee, or reaptowee
subject: gratuity
definition: A gratuity or reward given to tenants after they had reaped their lord’s corn, or done other customary duties. Cowell.

name: riptoweee, or reaptowee

name: ring
subject: distribute offices

subject: trade
definition: A trade between two parties of a fixed interest rate with a floating interest rate where there is an increase in the notional principal as the result of an increase in the floating interest rate causing the payments of both interest rates to become larger

name: revel
subject: word revel
definition: A criminal complaint charged that the defendant did “revel, quarrel, commit mischief, and otherwise behave in a disorderly manner.” Held, that the word “revel” has a definite meaning; i. e., “to behave in a noisy, boisterous manner, like a bacchanal.” In re Began, 12 R. I. 300.

name: return nulla bona
subject: particular property
definition: the report of  a court officer that states he has searched for a particular property to be taxes and he can’t find it.

name: lusophone countries
subject: country
definition: Angola, Brazil, Cape Verde, Guinea-Bissau, Mozambique, Portugal, and SaoTome and Principe are countries where Portuguese is the common language.

name: retry a case
subject: mistrial

name: retry a case

definition: This means to try a case again after a mistrial or a hung jury fails to give a verdict.

name: retrocession
subject: his rights
definition: In the civil law. When the assignee of heritable rights conveys his rights back to the cedent, it is called a “retrocession.” Ersk. Inst. 3, 5, 1.

definition: The conversion of a life policy to cash where the effective date becomes the date of issue and not the date of conversion.

name: retribution
subject: word
definition: This word is sometimes used in law, though not commonly in modern times, as the equivalent of “recompense,” or a payment or compensation for services, property, use of an estate, or other value received.

name: retreat to the wale
subject: his danger
definition: In the law relating to homicide in self-defense, this phrase means that the party must avail himself of any apparent and reasonable avenues of escape by which his danger might be avert- ed, and the necessity of slaying his assailant avoided. People v. lams, 57 Cal. 120.

name: lowest responsible bidder
subject: bidder
definition: Business and financial capabilities, past performance, and reputation of this qualified bidder meets the required standards, with this bidder also having the lowest or best bid price.

subject: bidder

name: retirement fund

name: loudermill rights
subject: 1985 supreme court decision cleveland board
definition: 1985 US Supreme court decision, ‘Cleveland Board of Education vs. Loudermill’, gave public employee property rights in their jobs. A public employee cannot be terminated without due process involving a pre-termination hearing, providing an opportunity to present the employee’s side of the story.

name: retaking
subject: take

name: retainer general

definition: when a person hires an attorney on the basis of a period of time and not what he does.

name: retainer
subject: which executor
definition: 1. The right of retainer is the right which the executor or administrator of a deceased person has to retain out of the assets sufficient to pay any debt due to him from the deceased In priority to the other creditors whose debts are of equal degree. 3 Steph. Comm. 203. Miller v. Irby, 63 Ala. 483 ; Taylor v. Deblois, 23 Fed. Cas. 765.  2. In English practice, a “retainer,” as applied to counsel, is commonly used to signify a notice given to a counsel by an attorney on behalf of the plaintiff or defendant in an action, in order to secure his services as advocate when the cause comes on for trial. Holthouse. Agnew v. Walden, 84 Ala. 502, 4 South. 072; Blackman v. Webb, 38 Kan. 008, 17 Pac. 404.  3. A servant, not menial or familiar,

subject: dividend
definition: After all dividends are paid to investors, the earned surplus/undistributed earnings comprise the net earnings that will become the companies equity. AKA earned surplus and undistrinuted earnings. Refer to paid in capital.

name: loss ratio
subject: insurance company
definition: The ability an insurance company has to cover its loss with premiums.

name: retailing

definition: A commercial transaction where a person buys goods or services for use at home.

name: retailing
subject: transaction person
definition: A commercial transaction where a person buys goods or services for use at home.

name: resurrender
subject: mortgagor
definition: Where copyhold land has been mortgaged by surrender, and the mortgagee has been admitted, then, on the mortgage debt being paid off, the mortgagor is entitled to have the land reconveyed to him, by the mortgagee surrendering it to the lord to his use. This is called a “resurren- der.” 2 Dav. Conv. 1332

name: restricted retained earnings
subject: investor
definition: A sum of retained or restricted surplus placed in an account that can only be used to pay in the event that the investor has arrears from a breach of covenant or a deficit from a cumulative preferred stock investor. AKA restricted surplus.

name: loss adjustor
subject: insurer insurance company
definition: The insurer / insurance company hires one for an insured’s insurance claim investigation and settlement an insured. This person is typically and independent entity. Also refer to loss assessor.

name: restitution in kind
subject: situation offender
definition: The situation where an offender is made to make good any losses by the return of the same or new goods to the victim intstead of the paying of damages.

name: long-arm statute
subject: term law
definition: a term where a law of a state gives its courts jurisdiction over people and property outside the state.

name: long-arm statute
subject: term law
definition: a term where a law of a state gives its courts jurisdiction over people and property outside the state.

name: long ton
subject: 2,240 pounds
definition: 2,240 pounds, also called an imperial ton. Mostly replaced these days with the metric ton or tonne. Weighs 1,000 kilograms or 2,204.68 pounds. One million dollars in new one dollar notes is almost a long ton in weight. Also known as gross ton or imperial ton.

name: long term planning
subject: need
definition: Activities of formulating a long-term plan. Future needs estimating typically is an extrapolation of present or known needs. The extrapolation for achieving interim goals starts with current status, projected status roadmap, includes short-term operational as well as tactical plans.

name: resting a case
subject: court
definition: a term used when all evidence has been presented and the court is left to consider the judgement.

name: responsive bidder
subject: responsible bidder
definition: The responsible bidder who shows the most compliance to the needs of the conytract bidding for.

name: long term bond
subject: 15 years
definition: 15 years or longer maturity period for a Bond makes it long-term. Greater credit and inflation risk go with higher interest rates for such bonds. Also known as long bond.

name: long term bond
subject: longer maturity period
definition: 15 years or longer maturity period for a Bond makes it long-term. Greater credit and inflation risk go with higher interest rates for such bonds. Also known as long bond.

name: long term asset
subject: lifespan
definition: Lifespan of over five years in general makes an asset long-term.

name: respondent
subject: party
definition: The party who makes an answer to a bill or other proceeding in chancery.  The party who appeals against the judgment of au inferior court is termed the “ap- pellant;” and he who contends against the appeal, the “respondent.” The word also de- notes the person upou whom an ordinary petition in the court of chancery (or a libel in admiralty) is served, and who is, as it were, a defendant thereto. The terms “re- spondent” and “co-respondent” are used in like manner iu proceedings in the divorce court. Brown; I!rower v. Nellis, 0 Ind. App. 323, 33 N. E. 072; Code Cr. Proc. N. X. 1903,

name: respondeat ouster
subject: that defendant
definition: Upon an issue iu law arising upon a dilatory plea, the form of judgment for the plaintiff is that the defendant answer over, which is thence called a judgment of “respondeat ouster.” This not being a final judgment, the pleading is resumed, and the action proceeds. Steph. PI. 115; 3 Bl. Comm. 303; Bauer ?. Roth, 4 Rawle (Pa.) 91.  Respondeat raptor, qui ignorare non potuit quod pupilium alienum ahduxit. llob. 99. Let the ravisher answer, for he cannot be ignorant that he has taken away another’s ward.  Respondeat superior. Let the master answer. This ma.vini means that a master is liable in certain cases for the wrongful acts of his servant and a principal for those of his agent. Broom, Max. 843. See Southern Ry. Co. v. Morrison, 105 Ga. 543, 31 S. E. 504; liaehl v. Wabash it Co., 119 Mo. 325, 24 S. W. 737; State v. Gillespie, 02 Kan. 409, 03 Pac. 742, 84 Am. St. Rep. 411.

name: respcnsa pr’jdentum
subject: magistrate
definition: Lat. Answers of jurists; responses given upon cases or questions of law referred to them, by certain learned Roman jurists, who, though not magistrates, were authorized to render such opinions. These responsa constituted one of the most important sources of the earlier Roman law, and were of great value in de- veloping its scientific accuracy. They held much the same place of authority as our modern precedents and reports.

name: london interbank offered rate (libor)
subject: five major london banks
definition: The average of rates for which five major London banks will lend $10 million for a period of three or six months. It is the benchmark rate for setting interest rates for adjustable-rate loans and financial instruments. This is the interest rate at which the London banks will offer funds to the interbank market.

name: resource dependence
subject: reliance firm
definition: The reliance a firm has on any inputs from external sources such a senergy, capital and labour.

name: resource dependence
subject: reliance firm
definition: The reliance a firm has on any inputs from external sources such a senergy, capital and labour.

name: resolution trust corporation (rtc)
subject: congressional corporation
definition: A congressional corporation that was established for the sole purpose to contain, manage and sell a failed financial institution in ordr to recover the taxpayer’s expenses.

name: resist
subject: word
definition: To oppose. This word properly describes an opposition by direct action and quasi forcible means. State v. Welch, 37 Wis. 196.

name: logistics
subject: management
definition: Achieving the objectives of a campaign, plan, project, or strategy based on personnel, material, and other resources positioned by procurement, movement, and stationing as a part of planning, execution, and control. ‘Management of inventory in motion and at rest’ is a common definition.

name: logic
subject: term
definition: The science of reasoning, or of the operations of the understanding which are subservient to the estimation of evidence. The term includes both the process itself of proceeding from known truths to unknown, and all other intellectual operations, in so far as auxiliary to this.

name: residuary clause
subject: clause
definition: a clause in a will disposing the rest of a person’s estate after all debts and bequests are paid.

name: residual payment
subject: example
definition: The payment that continues to be received after the services or goods have been provided. An example would be music on a movie sound track that was previously released.

name: resident font
subject: see
definition: Hard font that is installed into a printer’s ‘read only memory’ and is a standard feature. See downloaded font.

name: locked market
subject: bid price
definition: Where bid price equals the asked price as a temporary situation.

name: lockbox
subject: bank
definition: Banking related service allowing a company to drop its deposit in a postal box where the bank will obtain the deposit and post it to the company’s bank account(s). Typically this service is rather secure and only provide to a company depositing large amount of money on a regular basis.

name: lockbox
subject: bank
definition: Banking related service allowing a company to drop its deposit in a postal box where the bank will obtain the deposit and post it to the company’s bank account(s). Typically this service is rather secure and only provide to a company depositing large amount of money on a regular basis.

name: residence
subject: place man
definition: Living or dwelling in a certain place permanently or for a considerable length of time. The place where a man makes his home, or where he dwells permanently or for an extended period of time. The difference between a residence and a domicile may not be capable of easy definition; but every one can see at least this distinction: A person domiciled in one state may, for temporary reasons, such as health, reside for one or more years in some other place deemed more favorable. He does not, by so doing, forfeit his domicile in the first state, or, in any proper sense, become a non-resident of it, unless some intention, manifested by some act, of abandoning his residence in the first state is shown. Walker’s Estate v. Walker, 1 Mo. App. 404. “Residence” means a fixed and permanent abode or dwelling-place for the time being, as contradistinguished from a mere temporary locality of existence. So does “inhabitancy ;” and the two are distinguishable in this respect from “domicile.” In re Wrigley, 8 Wend. (N. Y.) 134. As they are used in the New York Code of Procedure, the terms “residence” and “resident” mean legal residence; and legal residence is the place of a man’s fixed habitation, where his political rights are to be exercised, and where he is liable to taxation. Houghton v. Ault, 10 How. Prac. (N. Y.) 77. A distinction is recognized between legal and actual residence. A person may be a legal resident of one place and an actual resident of another. He may abide in one state or country without surrendering his legal residence in another, if he so intends. Ilis legal residence may be merely ideal, but his actual residence must be substantial. He may not actually abide at his legal residence at all, but his actual residence must be his abiding place. Tipton v. Tipton. 87 Ky. 243. 8 S. W. 440; Hinds v. Hinds. 1 Iowa, 30; Fitzgerald v. Arel, 03 Iowa, 101. 18 N. W. 713, 50 Am. Rep. 733; Ludlow v. Szold, 00 Iowa, 175, 57 N. W. 070.

name: nuptial
subject: nuptia
definition: Pertaining to marriage; constituting marriage; used or done in marriage.     Nuptias non concnbitns sed consensus facit. Co. Litt. 33. Not cohabitation but consent makes the marriage.

name: nuptial
subject: non concnbitns

name: nul tort
subject: latin phrase
definition: a Latin phrase that is the  defence where the defendant claims he has not committed a wrong

name: loan value
subject: lender
definition: Maximum monies a lender values for a collateral asset to secure a loan. Lenders accept assets as a collateral that appraise at a minimum liquidation value of 25 percent higher than the loan amount. The difference between a collateralized asset’s market value and loan advance amount is known as the haircut. The overage is to cover liquidation and other charges in case of a foreclosure.

name: loan shark
subject: person
definition: the slang name that is given to a usurer or a person who lends money and charges more interest than the law allows. See usury.

name: loan receipt agreement
subject: plaintiff
definition: Lawful agreement allowing a civil case co-wrongdoer or tort-feasor to loan interest-free money to the plaintiff or injured party. The plaintiff only repays the loan upon other tort-feasors payoff.

name: loan processing
subject: step
definition: Period from loan application’s receipt through loan’s closure measured as a series of action steps tracing the entire life of the loan. Steps include loan acceptance, posting of loan on lender’s books, track of loan pay down, eventual mailing of written notice of loan closure to the borrower.

name: loan processing
subject: step

name: rescription
subject: scription
definition: In French law. A re- scription is a letter by which one requests some one to pay a certain sum of money, or to account for him to a third person for it Poth. Cont de Change, no. 225.

name: rescription
subject: one

name: rescheduling

name: resale
subject: person
definition: Where a person who has sold goods or other property to a purchaser sells them again to some one else. Sometimes a vendor reserves the right of reselling if the purchaser commits default in payment of the purchase money, and in some cases (e. g., on a sale of perishable articles) the vendor may do so without having reserved the right Sweet

Inst. ! 939.

The effect of it is analogous to that of inhibition. Bell.

subject: literal performance

subject: term

subject: condition
definition: Conditions that a firm must meet before the security, be it a stock, shares, or bonds, is officially quoted or listed for public trading on an organized stock exchange. Some of these conditions state the issuer’s (1) business experience in years, (2) earnings record, (3) total assets value, (4) shares outstanding, and (5) share market value. In the over-the-counter market in the US or in alternative investment markets in the UK. is where smaller firms unable to meet listing requirements, but meet the statutory requirements, sell their securities.

name: listing requirements
subject: condition
definition: Conditions that a firm must meet before the security, be it a stock, shares, or bonds, is officially quoted or listed for public trading on an organized stock exchange. Some of these conditions state the issuer’s (1) business experience in years, (2) earnings record, (3) total assets value, (4) shares outstanding, and (5) share market value. In the over-the-counter market in the US or in alternative investment markets in the UK. is where smaller firms unable to meet listing requirements, but meet the statutory requirements, sell their securities.

name: listing mark
subject: ul mark
definition: Certification mark given as a stamp of approval organizations that apply independent standards or testing on qualifying goods and materials. The ‘UL’ mark is such a mark given by Underwriters’ Laboratory, which is such an organization.

name: listing agreement
subject: broker
definition: An contract that authorizes the broker to sell or lease the property at a set price and terms. The broker receives a commission or other compensation from property owner following the closing.

name: listing agreement
subject: broker
definition: An contract that authorizes the broker to sell or lease the property at a set price and terms. The broker receives a commission or other compensation from property owner following the closing.

name: listing agency
subject: underwriters laboratory
definition: Independent private or public standards or testing organization that assesses goods and materials based on specific criteria and gives its mark, known as listing mark, to be carried on qualifying items as a stamp of approval. Underwriters’ Laboratory is such a organization.

name: replevin
subject: personal action ex delicto
definition: A personal action ex delicto brought to recover possession of goods unlawfully taken, (generally, but not only, applicable to the taking of goods distrained for rent,) the validity of which taking it is the mode of contesting, if the party from whom the goods were taken wishes to have them back in specie, whereas, if he prefer to have damages instead, the validity may be contested by action of trespass or unlawful distress. The word means a redelivery to the owner of the pledge or thing taken in distress. Wharton. And see Sinnott v. Feiock, 165 N. Y. 444, 59 N. E. 265, 53 L. R. A. 565, 80 Am. St. Rep. 736; Healey v. Humphrey, 81 Fed. 990, 27 C. C. A. 39; Mc- Junkin v. Mathers, 158 Pa. 137, 27 Atl. 873; Tracy v. Warren, 104 Mass. 377; Lazard v. Wheeler, 22 Cal. 142: Maclary v. Turner, 9 Houst. (Del.) 281. 32 Atl. 325; Johnson v. Boehme. 66 Kan. 72, 71 Pac. 243, 97 Am. St Rep. 357.

name: replevin
subject: party
definition: A personal action ex delicto brought to recover possession of goods unlawfully taken, (generally, but not only, applicable to the taking of goods distrained for rent,) the validity of which taking it is the mode of contesting, if the party from whom the goods were taken wishes to have them back in specie, whereas, if he prefer to have damages instead, the validity may be contested by action of trespass or unlawful distress. The word means a redelivery to the owner of the pledge or thing taken in distress. Wharton. And see Sinnott v. Feiock, 165 N. Y. 444, 59 N. E. 265, 53 L. R. A. 565, 80 Am. St. Rep. 736; Healey v. Humphrey, 81 Fed. 990, 27 C. C. A. 39; Mc- Junkin v. Mathers, 158 Pa. 137, 27 Atl. 873; Tracy v. Warren, 104 Mass. 377; Lazard v. Wheeler, 22 Cal. 142: Maclary v. Turner, 9 Houst. (Del.) 281. 32 Atl. 325; Johnson v. Boehme. 66 Kan. 72, 71 Pac. 243, 97 Am. St Rep. 357.

name: replevin
subject: party
definition: A personal action ex delicto brought to recover possession of goods unlawfully taken, (generally, but not only, applicable to the taking of goods distrained for rent,) the validity of which taking it is the mode of contesting, if the party from whom the goods were taken wishes to have them back in specie, whereas, if he prefer to have damages instead, the validity may be contested by action of trespass or unlawful distress. The word means a redelivery to the owner of the pledge or thing taken in distress. Wharton. And see Sinnott v. Feiock, 165 N. Y. 444, 59 N. E. 265, 53 L. R. A. 565, 80 Am. St. Rep. 736; Healey v. Humphrey, 81 Fed. 990, 27 C. C. A. 39; Mc- Junkin v. Mathers, 158 Pa. 137, 27 Atl. 873; Tracy v. Warren, 104 Mass. 377; Lazard v. Wheeler, 22 Cal. 142: Maclary v. Turner, 9 Houst. (Del.) 281. 32 Atl. 325; Johnson v. Boehme. 66 Kan. 72, 71 Pac. 243, 97 Am. St Rep. 357.

name: replacement reserves
subject: building components
definition: An amount of money set aside because building components or equipment will wear out in a relatively short time and need to be replaced.Replacement reserves can be a mere accounting entry as a phantom expense item reducing net operating income each month, or it can be money actually deposited into an account and earmarked for replacements

name: replacement reserves
subject: equipment
definition: An amount of money set aside because building components or equipment will wear out in a relatively short time and need to be replaced.Replacement reserves can be a mere accounting entry as a phantom expense item reducing net operating income each month, or it can be money actually deposited into an account and earmarked for replacements

name: replacement reserves
subject: amount
definition: An amount of money set aside because building components or equipment will wear out in a relatively short time and need to be replaced.Replacement reserves can be a mere accounting entry as a phantom expense item reducing net operating income each month, or it can be money actually deposited into an account and earmarked for replacements

name: replacement cost method
subject: replacement cost
definition: Replacement cost is the cost at which, on the date of issue of the material, there could be purchased another lot of material identical to that whose issue is being priced. Under replacement cost method, the issues are priced at the market rate on the date of its issue.

name: replacement cost accounting
subject: practice
definition: An accounting practice in which liabilities and assets are recorded on a balance sheet according to the cost of replacing them, rather than the original amount spent on the liabilities or assets. This practice is intended to take into account current prices when calculating a company’s value. It is the opposite of historic cost accounting.

name: notice
subject: individual
definition: A legal notification or warning that is delivered in a written format or through a formal announcement. An individual or party is considered liable if the party (1) has knowledge of the the notice, (2) received the notice, (3) knows it through experience, (4) has knowledge with regards to an associate fact and (5) could have gained knowledge had an enquiry been undertaken.

name: notice
subject: party
definition: A legal notification or warning that is delivered in a written format or through a formal announcement. An individual or party is considered liable if the party (1) has knowledge of the the notice, (2) received the notice, (3) knows it through experience, (4) has knowledge with regards to an associate fact and (5) could have gained knowledge had an enquiry been undertaken.

name: notice
subject: party
definition: A legal notification or warning that is delivered in a written format or through a formal announcement. An individual or party is considered liable if the party (1) has knowledge of the the notice, (2) received the notice, (3) knows it through experience, (4) has knowledge with regards to an associate fact and (5) could have gained knowledge had an enquiry been undertaken.

name: list price
subject: know
definition: Price manufacturer’s, distributor’s, or retailer’s quoted, published, or displayed by quantity, seasonal, or other computed discounts. Also known as manufacturer’s suggested retail price (MSRP).

name: liquiditytrap
subject: company
definition: When a company holds their assets and does not sell them. It stops any two way traffic of funds causing new buyers to enter the market.

name: liquidity squeeze
subject: bank
definition: Lending institutions’ reluctance to loan reserve money based on short-term money-availability concerns. This makes it more expensive for banks to borrow funds from each other as interbank market interest rates increase placing a hold on those reserve funds.

name: repetitive stress injury (rsi)
subject: one
definition: Repetitive stress injury: An injury that occurs due to recurrent overuse or improper use. One of the best-known repetitive stress injuries is carpal tunnel syndrome, which often results from the trauma of highly repetitive work such as that of supermarket checkers, assembly-line workers, typists, word processors, accountants, and writers.

name: repayment mortgage
subject: repayment mortgage
definition: A repayment mortgage is a term generally used in the UK to describe a mortgage in which the monthly repayments consist of repaying the capital amount borrowed as well as the accrued interest, so that the amount borrowed decreases throughout the term and by the end of the loan term has been fully repaid.[1] This contrasts with an interest-only mortgage (such as an endowment mortgage or some types of balloon payment mortgage) where monthly repayments are for interest, and the borrower must repay the full loan at term in a lump sum.

name: repayment mortgage
subject: that amount
definition: A repayment mortgage is a term generally used in the UK to describe a mortgage in which the monthly repayments consist of repaying the capital amount borrowed as well as the accrued interest, so that the amount borrowed decreases throughout the term and by the end of the loan term has been fully repaid.[1] This contrasts with an interest-only mortgage (such as an endowment mortgage or some types of balloon payment mortgage) where monthly repayments are for interest, and the borrower must repay the full loan at term in a lump sum.

name: notarius
subject: his case
definition: his case is put out of court by some adverse ruling which precludes a recovery. I’.oyce v. Snow. 1ST 111. 181, 58 N. E. 403; Deele.v v. Ileintz. 169 N. Y. 120, 02 N. E. 158; Stults v. Forst, 135 Ind. 207, 34 N. E. 1125; Williams v. Finks, 150 Mo. 597, 57 S. W. 732.     A peremptory nonsuit is a compulsory or involuntary nonsuit, ordered by the court upon a total failure of the plaintiff to substantiate his claim by evidence. Jacques v. Fourthman, 137 Pa. 428, 20 Atl. 802.

name: not to exceed (nte)
subject: negotiating contract
definition: When negotiating a contract, it is the assurance from the vendor that the value of the property will not be greater than the proposed value and the estimates that will be submitted later. Depending on the changes made to the property, the NLT value may be higher or lower.

name: liquidation of lifo layers
subject: company
definition: A company giving up seemingly unsalable inventory using the LIFO method. The company reduces costs and lowers its tax rate.

name: liquidation of lifo layers
subject: company
definition: A company giving up seemingly unsalable inventory using the LIFO method. The company reduces costs and lowers its tax rate.

name: liquidating partner
subject: partner
definition: The partner who upon the dissolution or insolvency of the firm, Is appointed to settle its accounts, collect assets, adjust claims, and pay debts. Garretson v. Brown, 185 Pa. 447, 40 Atl. 300.

name: liquidating partner
subject: dissolution
definition: The partner who upon the dissolution or insolvency of the firm, Is appointed to settle its accounts, collect assets, adjust claims, and pay debts. Garretson v. Brown, 185 Pa. 447, 40 Atl. 300.

name: liquidating partner
subject: insolvency
definition: The partner who upon the dissolution or insolvency of the firm, Is appointed to settle its accounts, collect assets, adjust claims, and pay debts. Garretson v. Brown, 185 Pa. 447, 40 Atl. 300.

name: liquidating dividend
subject: company
definition: A company will issue this type of payment to shareholders if the company is claiming bankruptcy or ceasing business operations. Shareholder company share-count determines a shareholder’s payment amount.

name: liquidating dividend
subject: company
definition: A company will issue this type of payment to shareholders if the company is claiming bankruptcy or ceasing business operations. Shareholder company share-count determines a shareholder’s payment amount.

name: liquidating dividend
subject: company share count
definition: A company will issue this type of payment to shareholders if the company is claiming bankruptcy or ceasing business operations. Shareholder company share-count determines a shareholder’s payment amount.

name: rente
subject: rente
definition: In French law. Rente is the annual return which represents the revenue of a capital or of an immovable alienated. The constitution of rente is a contract by which one of the parties lends to the other a capita] which he agrees not to recall, in con- sideration of the borrower’s paying an annual interest. It is this interest which is called “rente.” Duverger. The word is therefore nearly synonymous with the English “annuity.”  “Rentes,” is the term applied to the French government funds, and “rentier” to a fund- holder or other person having an income from personal property. Wharton.

name: rental property
subject: residential
object: 27.5 year modified accelerated cost recovery system schedule
definition: A type of property that derives more than 80% of its revenue from dwelling units. Residential rental property uses the 27.5 year modified accelerated cost recovery system (MACRS) schedule for depreciation.

name: not guilty by statute
subject: plea
definition: In English practice. A plea of the general issue by a defendant in a civil action, when he intends to give special matter in evidence by virtue of some act or acts of parliament, iu which case he must add the reference to such act or acts, and state whether such acts are public or otherwise. But, if a defendant so plead, he will not be allowed to plead any other defense, without the leave of the court or a judge. Mozley & Whitley.

name: not guilty by statute
subject: which case
definition: In English practice. A plea of the general issue by a defendant in a civil action, when he intends to give special matter in evidence by virtue of some act or acts of parliament, iu which case he must add the reference to such act or acts, and state whether such acts are public or otherwise. But, if a defendant so plead, he will not be allowed to plead any other defense, without the leave of the court or a judge. Mozley & Whitley.

name: nostro account
subject: vostro account
definition: A foreign exchange account in a local bank in the local currency that is maintained by a foreign bank. A vostro account is the account that  is applicable to local banks.

name: noscitur a sociis
subject: know
definition: A latin term for ‘it is known by the company it keeps’, it is the concept that the intended meaning of an ambiguous word  depends on  the context in which it is used.

name: liquefied natural gas (lng)
subject: methane
