Comm. 349.

name: parenthesis
subject: part
definition: Part of a sentence occurring in the middle thereof, and inclosed between marks like ( ), the omission of which part would not injure the grammatical construction of the rest of the sentence. Wharton; In re Schilling, 53 Fed. 81, 3 C. C. A. 440.

name: parent company
subject: parent company
definition: A parent company is one which owns and controls other firms or companies, usually known as subsidiaries. These companies have their own legal entities. Known also as a holding company.

name: paris convention
subject: resident
definition: Created and signed back in 1883, the Paris Convention provided a couple of different rights, specifically i) Any citizen, or resident of a signatory country, will be able to gain access and have equal rights as the country grants to its own citizens and residents. And secondly, the resident of any signatory country has the option of filing a patent within a year, once they have filed a patent in their home country. The Paris Convention is also known as the International Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property.

name: part
subject: portion share
definition: A portion, share, or purpart One of two duplicate originals of a conveyance or covenant, the other being called “counterpart.” Also, in composition, partial or incomplete; as part payment, part performance. Cairo v. Bross, 9 111. App. 406.

name: part
subject: purpart
definition: A portion, share, or purpart One of two duplicate originals of a conveyance or covenant, the other being called “counterpart.” Also, in composition, partial or incomplete; as part payment, part performance. Cairo v. Bross, 9 111. App. 406.

name: part
subject: covenant
definition: A portion, share, or purpart One of two duplicate originals of a conveyance or covenant, the other being called “counterpart.” Also, in composition, partial or incomplete; as part payment, part performance. Cairo v. Bross, 9 111. App. 406.

name: parsonage allowance
subject: parsonage allowance
definition: Allowance provided by a religious constitution to a clergy they have ordained. Primarily, the parsonage allowance covers the fair market rental value of the house, as well as any maintenance costs that might be accrued during the clergy’s stay. Income taxes are also incorporated in to the parsonage allowance.

name: parsonage
subject: certain portion
definition: A certain portion of lands, tithes, and offerings, established by law, for the maintenance of the minister who has the cure of souls. Tomlins.     The word is more generally used for the house set apart for the residence of the minister. Mozley & Whitley. See Wells’ Estate v. Congregational Church, 03 Vt. 116, 21 Atl. 270; Everett v. First Presbyterian Church. 53 N. J. Eq. 500. 32 Atl. 747; Reeves v. Reeves, 5 Lea (Tenn.) 644.

name: partial intestacy
subject: term
definition: the term that applies when a personwho  has left a will but it does not allow disposal of all of his assets.

name: partial distribution
subject: term
definition: a term used when a grant to legatees is made of a portion of an estate before the final settlement is made.

name: partial barrier option
subject: barrier option
definition: When a barrier option has a barrier that is only valid in a certain time frame.

name: partes finis nihil habuerunt
subject: nothing
definition: In old pleading. The parties to the fine had nothing; that is, had no estate which could be conveyed by It. A plea to a fine which had been levied by a stranger. 2 Bl. Comm. 357; 1 P. Wms. 520.

name: participant
subject: person
definition: Any person who takes part in any activity, service or program.

name: participative leadership
subject: which leader
definition: A leadership style in which the leader himself takes part in solving the problems of the team, building connections and helping anyway he/ she can, while still retaining the authority of decision making.

name: participation rate
subject: number
definition: When we talk about the labor market, the rate of participation is the number of people who are currently looking to gain legal employment. It is only calculated with individuals who are above the employment age, which is 15 +.

name: participation in crime
subject: one
definition: a term that si given to a person who is one of a group who has committed an offense.

name: participation
subject: teamwork
definition: Consultation done jointly in any establishment of a goal, sharing of profits or when it comes to making a decision. Teamwork is an example of participation. It helps increasing the commitment of the employees to collective objectives.

name: participating provider
subject: provider
definition: Any medical provider who has been qualified to take part in the Medicare program. Providers receive payment through their carriers.

name: previously
subject: lebrecht
definition: An adverb of time, used in comparing an act or state named with another act or state, subsequent in order of time, for the purpose of asserting the priority of the first. Lebrecht v. Wilcoxon, 40 Iowa, 94.

name: partnership by estoppel
subject: person
definition: A legal, binding partnership that may occur where previously, no formal partnership agreement was in place. A person who exhibits such conduct, or says words which represent, or allow him to be represented, as a partner in any firm becomes liable to any loans or credits that are obtained by the firm. It is also known as the presumption of partnership.

name: pascal
subject: pascal
definition: Named after Blaise Pascal, Pascal is the metric unit used to measure the pressure of anything. It is defined as the newton force per meter (squared).

name: party selling
subject: seller
definition: A method of selling in which the sellers carry out their operations from the residence of the customers, on a rotational basis. The customer obviously earns a commission for allowing the seller. Commonly referred to as a party plan.

name: passage court
subject: ancient court of record
definition: An ancient court of record in Liverpool, once called the “mayor’s court of pays sage,” but now usually called the “court of the passage of the borough of Liverpool.” This court was formerly held before the mayor and two bailiffs of the borough, and had jurisdiction in actions where the amount in question exceeded forty shillings. Mozley & Whitley.

name: passage court
subject: jurisdiction
definition: An ancient court of record in Liverpool, once called the “mayor’s court of pays sage,” but now usually called the “court of the passage of the borough of Liverpool.” This court was formerly held before the mayor and two bailiffs of the borough, and had jurisdiction in actions where the amount in question exceeded forty shillings. Mozley & Whitley.

name: pass-through security
subject: investor
definition: When investors get cashflows from assets in modified or fully modified forms. The assets can be mortgages, certificates, bonds, and loans.

name: pass-book
subject: bank
definition: A book in which a bank or banker enters the deposits made by a cus- tomer, and which is retained by the latter. Also a book in which a merchant enters the items of sales on credit to a customer, and which the latter carries or keeps with him.

name: pass-book
subject: banker
definition: A book in which a bank or banker enters the deposits made by a cus- tomer, and which is retained by the latter. Also a book in which a merchant enters the items of sales on credit to a customer, and which the latter carries or keeps with him.

name: pass-book
subject: merchant
definition: A book in which a bank or banker enters the deposits made by a cus- tomer, and which is retained by the latter. Also a book in which a merchant enters the items of sales on credit to a customer, and which the latter carries or keeps with him.

name: passive retention
subject: company
definition: When a company unexpectedly retains risk leading to losses. This usually occurs when they are not properly managing their reserves or self insurance. Refer to retention and risk retention

name: passive loss
subject: example
definition: Any loss that is incurred due to a passive activity. Examples include loss incurred through rented property, any limited partnership, etc.

name: passive learning
subject: student
definition: When an student gets no response on his learning trend from his instructor, it is known to be passive learning.

name: passive debt
subject: debt
definition: A debt upon which, by agreement between the debtor and creditor, no interest is payable, as distinguished from active debt; i. c., a debt upon which interest is payable. In this sense, the terms “active” and “passive” are applied to certain debts due from the Spanish government to Great Britain. Wharton. In another sense of the words, a debt is “active” or “passive” according as the person of the creditor or debtor is regarded ; a passive debt being that which a man owes; an active debt that which is owing to him. In this meaning every debt is both active and passive,

name: passive debt
subject: no interest
definition: A debt upon which, by agreement between the debtor and creditor, no interest is payable, as distinguished from active debt; i. c., a debt upon which interest is payable. In this sense, the terms “active” and “passive” are applied to certain debts due from the Spanish government to Great Britain. Wharton. In another sense of the words, a debt is “active” or “passive” according as the person of the creditor or debtor is regarded ; a passive debt being that which a man owes; an active debt that which is owing to him. In this meaning every debt is both active and passive,

name: patent
subject: patent
definition: A patent is a legal document which provides protection to the ideas of any individual. Usually issued by the Patent Office of a country, the patent is granted to any firm or individual. Usually, patents constitute of four different classes: Machine (a device or apparatus created by a person for the performance of a specific task, process (a process created by an individual), manufacture (any fabricated or manufactured product) or the composition of matter (any chemical mixture or compound created by a person). Patents can be sued for.

name: patent troll
subject: patent troll
definition: A patent troll is a company, which acquires a range of different patents, without ever having the intention of creating any of the products. The primary purpose of a patent troll is to find infringers, and file a suit in order to make money.

name: patent reexamination
subject: patent
definition: Once the patent has been granted, a patent reexamination might be undertaken to determine whether the usefulness, or claims of the patent still hold true or not.

name: pathogens
subject: example
definition: Microorganisms which are likely to cause diseases. Examples include viruses, fungi or bacteria. Usually found in chemical waste, exhaust water, etc.

name: pathogens
subject: example
definition: Microorganisms which are likely to cause diseases. Examples include viruses, fungi or bacteria. Usually found in chemical waste, exhaust water, etc.

name: path goal theory
subject: subordinate
definition: A belief when it comes to leadership which states that the subordinates will only accept the behavior of the leader as long as they see an immediate, or near future benefit in his/ her actions.

name: paternity tests
subject: man
definition: the name that is given to the blood and DNA tests that are performed to determine if a man is the father of a child.

name: patricide
subject: one
definition: One who has killed his father. As to the punishment of that offense by the Roman law, see Sandars’ Just Inst. (5th Ed.) 496.

name: pax regis
subject: peace
definition: Lat. The peace of the king; that is, the peace, good order, and security for life and property which it is one of the objects of government to maintain, and which the king, as the personification of the power of the state, is supposed to guaranty to all persons within the protection of the law.     This name was also given, in ancient times, to a certain privileged district or sanctuary. The pax 7-egis, or verge of the court, as it was afterwards called, extended from the palace- gate to the distance of three miles, three furlongs, three acres, nine feet, nine palms, and nine barleycorns. Crabb, Eng. Law, 41.

name: pawn shop
subject: individual
definition: A small shop which allows an individual to get a loan, after providing personal property, of an equivalent value, as collateral. If the loan is repaid within the time frame that was agreed, that personal property will be returned. If not, the pawnbroker has the right to liquidate the property in return for the loan.

name: payables turnover
subject: company company
definition: The turnover ratio determining whether the company the company repays its supppliers quicker or slower than before.

name: payables to operating expenses ratio
subject: firm
definition: A ratio written as weeks of operating expenses in terms of the accounts payable at the end of accounting period. It is usually dependent upon the time it would take for a firm to pay its operating expenses, once they have been recognized in the books.

name: payable to holder
subject: phrase
definition: phrase that is used to refer to a bill that is to be paid to whoever presents it. It is poayable to the bearer.

name: payable
subject: payable
definition: A sum of money is said to be payable when a person is under an obliga- tion to pay it. “Payable” may therefore signify an obligation to pay at a future time, but, when used without qualification, “payable” means that the debt is payable at once, as opposed to “owing.” Sweet. And see First Nat. Bank v. Greenville Nat. Bank, 84 Tex. 40. 19 S. W. 334; Easton v. Hyde, 13 Minn. 01 (Gil. 83).

name: paymaster
subject: officer
definition: An officer of the army or navy whose duty is to keep the pay-accounts and pay the wages of the officers and men. Any official charged with the disbursement of public money.

name: payer, or payor
subject: payment person
definition: One who pays, or who is to make a payment; particularly the person who is to make payment of a bill or note. Correlative to “payee.”

name: payer, or payor
subject: payment person
definition: One who pays, or who is to make a payment; particularly the person who is to make payment of a bill or note. Correlative to “payee.”

name: payer
subject: party
definition: The party who makes the payment. Known as a writer too.

name: payee
subject: order
definition: In mercantile law. The person in whose favor a bill of exchange, promissory note, or check is made or drawn; the person to whom or to whose order a bill, note, or check is made payable. 3 Kent, Comm. 75.

name: payday
subject: employee
definition: The day on which an employee receives his salary. Might be quarterly, weekly or monthly.

name: paycheck-to-paycheck
subject: anindividual
definition: A common phrase which depicts that anindividual must pay off all financial obligations with his present earnings from the current pay cycle, till th enext. Those who live a ‘pay check to pay check’ life usually do not possess any liquid assets.

name: paycheck-to-paycheck
subject: pay check
definition: A common phrase which depicts that anindividual must pay off all financial obligations with his present earnings from the current pay cycle, till th enext. Those who live a ‘pay check to pay check’ life usually do not possess any liquid assets.

name: payment history
subject: he/
definition: The history of an employee, depicting the days on which he/ she has received payment, and when dues have been cleared. Helps creditors and lenders in checking whether the employee is worth lending to or not.

name: payment history
subject: he/
definition: The history of an employee, depicting the days on which he/ she has received payment, and when dues have been cleared. Helps creditors and lenders in checking whether the employee is worth lending to or not.

name: payment against documents
subject: which buyer
definition: A setup in which the buyer can receive delivery documents, only after the full payment of the bill of invoice has been made.

name: payroll period
subject: employer
definition: The period during which an employer makes payments to the employees, and during which any authorized deductions are made.

name: payroll deduction insurance
subject: employer
definition: A provision that if activated by the employee, allows the employer to cut the premium of insurance from their paycheck. The amount is sent directly to the insurance company.

name: payroll deduction
subject: payroll deduction
definition: The amount which is not paid by the employer to the employee, even though it is his earning. Typically, payroll deduction occurs fornational insurance policies or tax payments.

name: payroll deduction
subject: payroll deduction
definition: The amount which is not paid by the employer to the employee, even though it is his earning. Typically, payroll deduction occurs fornational insurance policies or tax payments.

name: paypal
subject: company
definition: A company owned by eBay, whose primary function is to process online payments and transfer money from individuals and companies. It was set up in 1998, and accepts 18 currencies at present. The system is based solely over the internet. Funds can be withdrawn ot the bank account, or uploaded from the bank account too.

name: paypal
subject: company
definition: A company owned by eBay, whose primary function is to process online payments and transfer money from individuals and companies. It was set up in 1998, and accepts 18 currencies at present. The system is based solely over the internet. Funds can be withdrawn ot the bank account, or uploaded from the bank account too.

name: payout ratio
subject: payment
definition: The amount of earnings paid to stockholders over the investments lifetime. This payment takes the form of common stock dividends. Refer to dividend yield and plowback ratio.

name: payment under reserve
subject: bank whicih
definition: A payment given to the payee of a letter of credit, where the documents have certain anomalies. The bank whicih will advance the payment might keep it until confirmation has been received by the issuing bank.

name: payment terms
subject: payment
definition: The terms under which a seller is required to finalize a sale. Usually, the payment terms depict the time in which payments must be made, as well as how they must be made.

name: peaceable
subject: peaceable possession
definition: Free from the character of force, violence, or trespass; as, a “peaceable entry” on lands. “Peaceable possession” of real estate Is such as is acquiesced in by all other persons, including rival claimants, and not disturbed by any forcible attempt at ouster nor by adverse suits to recover the possession or the estate. See Stanley v. Schwalby, 147 U. S. SOS, 13 Sup. Ct. 418, 37 L. Ed. 259; Allaire v. Ketcham, 55 N. J. Eq. 10S, 35 Atl. 900; Bowers v. Cherokee Bob, 45 Cal. 504; Gitten v. Lowry, 15 Ga. 336.     Peccata contra naturam sunt gravis- sima. 3 Inst. 20. Crimes against nature are the most heinous.     Peccatum peccato addit qui culpae quam facit patrocinia defensionis ad- jungit. 5 Coke, 49. lie adds fault to fault who sets up a defense of a wrong committed by him.

name: peculiar risk doctrine
subject: owner
definition: A legal principle which states that if the owner of any property is getting construction done on it, the owner will stand responsible for any injuries that occur during the construction.

name: peak-load pricing
subject: amount
definition: If the amount of competition is less, a company that charges high prices for services or goods that are in demand is known to be following a peak load pricing method. Usually edorsed by electricity providing companies during the summer period.

name: peak season endorsement
subject: endorsement
definition: Such an endorsement provides larger coverage on the inventory that has been insured during the peaking seasons.

name: pedigree
subject: person
definition: Lineage ; line of ancestors from which a person descends; genealogy. An account or register of a line of ancestors. Family relationship. Swink v. French, 11 Lea (Tenn.) 80, 47 Am. Bep. 277; People v. Mayne, 118 Cal. 510, 50 Pac. 054, 02 Am. St Rep. 250.

name: peddlers
subject: trader person
definition: Itinerant traders; persons who sell small wares, which they carry with them in traveling about from place to place. In re Wilson. 19 D. C. 341, 12 L. It. A. t’,24 ; Com. v. Farnum, 114 Mass. 270: Hall v. State, 39 Fla. 037, 23 South. 119; Gratl’ty v. Rushville, 107 Ind. 502, 8 N. E. 009, 57 Am. Rep. 128; In re Pringle, 07 Kan. 304, 72 Pac. S04.     Persons, except those peddling newspapers. Bibles, or religious tracts, who sell, or offer to sell, at retail, goods, wares, or other commodities, traveling from place to place, In the street, or through different parts of the country. 12 U. S. St. at Large, p. 458,

name: pegy ratio (peg)
subject: formula
definition: The ratio of measurement which determines how well a stock is performing on the trading market. The formula is to take the total earnings per every share and the ndividing it by the calculated annual rate of return. The stock will have a higher rating if the PEG ratio is higher.

name: pegy ratio (peg)
subject: formula
definition: The ratio of measurement which determines how well a stock is performing on the trading market. The formula is to take the total earnings per every share and the ndividing it by the calculated annual rate of return. The stock will have a higher rating if the PEG ratio is higher.

name: pegging
subject: national currency
definition: When national currency gets its value from another countries currency system. Or when a security company tries to keep its prices close to par value. Refer to crawling peg and managed foreign exchange rate.

name: pegging
subject: security company
definition: When national currency gets its value from another countries currency system. Or when a security company tries to keep its prices close to par value. Refer to crawling peg and managed foreign exchange rate.

name: peers of fees
subject: vassal
definition: Vassals or tenants of the same lord, who were obliged to serve and attend him in his courts, being equal in function. These were termed “peers of fees,” because holding fees of the lord, or because their business in court was to sit and judge, under their lords, of disputes arising upon fees; but, if there were too many in one lordship, the lord usually chose twelve, who had the title of peers, by way of distinction; whence, it is said, we derive our common juries and other peers. Cowell.

name: peers of fees
subject: tenant
definition: Vassals or tenants of the same lord, who were obliged to serve and attend him in his courts, being equal in function. These were termed “peers of fees,” because holding fees of the lord, or because their business in court was to sit and judge, under their lords, of disputes arising upon fees; but, if there were too many in one lordship, the lord usually chose twelve, who had the title of peers, by way of distinction; whence, it is said, we derive our common juries and other peers. Cowell.

name: peers of fees
subject: business
definition: Vassals or tenants of the same lord, who were obliged to serve and attend him in his courts, being equal in function. These were termed “peers of fees,” because holding fees of the lord, or because their business in court was to sit and judge, under their lords, of disputes arising upon fees; but, if there were too many in one lordship, the lord usually chose twelve, who had the title of peers, by way of distinction; whence, it is said, we derive our common juries and other peers. Cowell.

name: pencil hardness
subject: method
definition: An accepted measure of calculating the hardness of any pencil lead. The method is not an official standard. Ranges from 6B to HB in the middle.

name: penalty plan
subject: one
definition: A plan used commonly for mutual funds in which one of the partners who withdraws payment before the maturity date, which levies a penalty payment on the withdrawal. The penalty is highest if the withdrawal is made earlier.

name: penal bond
subject: he/
definition: A deposit made by the contractor in the form of a penalty which ensures that he/ she will fulfill the contract as per the terms of the contract, or be liable to a penalty.

name: penny
subject: english coin
definition: An English coin, being the twelfth part of a shilling. It was also used in America during the colonial period.

name: penetration
subject: term
definition: A term used in criminal law, and denoting (in cases of alleged rape) the insertion of the male part into the female parts to however slight an extent; and by which insertion the offense is complete without proof of emission. Brown.

name: pension shortfall
subject: company
definition: A pension shortfall occurs when a company fails to provide enough funds for paying its employee retirement benefits. The company must be having a defined pension plan set for its employees.

name: pension shortfall
subject: company
definition: A pension shortfall occurs when a company fails to provide enough funds for paying its employee retirement benefits. The company must be having a defined pension plan set for its employees.

name: per curiam opinion
subject: name
definition: the name that is given to the opinion that is rendered by a court where there is more than one judge.

name: per capita debt
subject: money citizen
definition: The total debt owed by the country divided by the total population of the country. It checks how much money a citizen must pay in order to overcome the debts owed.

name: per risk excess reinsurance
subject: person
definition: An insurance term in which the person who is getting insurance will pay the losses up to a certain extent, and the reinsurer will pay for the rest of the loss.

name: per risk excess reinsurance
subject: insurance term
definition: An insurance term in which the person who is getting insurance will pay the losses up to a certain extent, and the reinsurer will pay for the rest of the loss.

name: per qua: servitia
subject: which grantee
definition: Lat. A real action by which the grantee of a seigniory could compel the tenants of the grantor to attorn to himself. It was abolished by St 3 & 4 Wm. IV. c. 27, g 35.

name: percent chart
subject: chart
definition: A chart used to measure the quality control and calculate the stability of any process involved in the quality control .

name: percent chart
subject: chart
definition: A chart used to measure the quality control and calculate the stability of any process involved in the quality control .

name: perambulation
subject: parishioner
definition: The act of walking over the boundaries of a district or piece of land, either for the purpose of determining them or of preserving evidence of them. Thus, in many parishes in England, it is the custom for the parishioners to perambulate the boundaries of the parish in rogation week in every year. Such a custom entitles them to enter any man’s land and abate nuisances in their way. Phillim. Ecc. Law, 1807; Hunt, Bound. 103 ; Sweet See Greenville y. Mason, 57 N. H. 385.

name: perch
subject: measure
definition: A measure of land containing five yards and a half, or sixteen feet and a half in length ; otherwise called a “rod” or “pole.” Cowell.     As a unit of solid measure, a perch of masonry or stone or brick work contains, ac- cording to some authorities and in some localities, sixteen and one-half cubic feet, but elsewhere, or according to others, twenty-flve. Unless defined by statute, it is a very indefinite term and must be explained by evidence. See Baldwin Quarry Co. v. Clements, 38 Ohio St 587; Harris v. Rutledge, 19 Iowa, 3S8, 87 Am. Dec. 441; Sullivan v. Richardson, 33 Fla. 1, 14 South. 692; Wood v. Vermont Cent R. Co., 24 Vt 60&

name: perch
subject: measure
definition: A measure of land containing five yards and a half, or sixteen feet and a half in length ; otherwise called a “rod” or “pole.” Cowell.     As a unit of solid measure, a perch of masonry or stone or brick work contains, ac- cording to some authorities and in some localities, sixteen and one-half cubic feet, but elsewhere, or according to others, twenty-flve. Unless defined by statute, it is a very indefinite term and must be explained by evidence. See Baldwin Quarry Co. v. Clements, 38 Ohio St 587; Harris v. Rutledge, 19 Iowa, 3S8, 87 Am. Dec. 441; Sullivan v. Richardson, 33 Fla. 1, 14 South. 692; Wood v. Vermont Cent R. Co., 24 Vt 60&

name: perception
subject: perception
definition: Taking into possession. Thus, perception of crops or of profits is re- ducing them to possession.

name: perfect equity
subject: term
definition: a term given to the equity or the interest of a buyer in real estate who has fulfilled obligations to the owner.

name: perfect competition
subject: other characteristics
definition: An economic term for a market in which there are lots f buyers and sellers, depicting little individual control over the prices. Other characteristics include the fact that all buyers and sellers are looking to maximize their profits, the buyer or the seller can leave the market without any restraint, and all the sellers and buyers should have access to information regarding the prices, etc. of the gods that are being traded.

name: peremptory defense
subject: plaintiff
definition: A defense which insists that the plaintiff never had the right to institute the suit, or that, if he had, the original rightis extinguished or determined.

name: peremptory challenge
subject: which prisoner
definition: In criminal practice. A species of challenge which a prisoner is allowed to have against a certain number of jurors. without assigning anv cause. Lewis v. U. S

name: peregrini
subject: class
definition: Lat In Roman law. The class of peregrini embraced at the same time both those who had no capacity in law, (capacity for rights or jural relations,) namely, the slaves, and the members of those nations which had not established amicable re- lations with the Roman people. Sav. Dr. Rom.

name: perform
subject: till
definition: To perform an obligation or contract is to execute, fulfill, or accomplish it according to its terms. Tills may consist either In action on the part of the person bound by the contract or in omission to act according to the nature of the subject-matter; but the term is usually applied to any action in discharge of a contract other than payment

name: perfluorocarbon (pfc)
subject: pfc
definition: PFC, as it is commonly known, is a byproduct that appears when aluminum is smelted during the manufacturing process of a semiconductor. A PFC has a couple of carbon atoms, as well as four to six atoms of fluorine.

name: perfluorocarbon (pfc)
subject: pfc
definition: PFC, as it is commonly known, is a byproduct that appears when aluminum is smelted during the manufacturing process of a semiconductor. A PFC has a couple of carbon atoms, as well as four to six atoms of fluorine.

name: perfidy
subject: act
definition: The act of one who has engaged his faith to do a tiling, aud does not do it, but does the contrary. Wolff, Inst 8 300.

name: perfecting bail
subject: certain qualifications
definition: Certain qualifications of a property character being required of persons who tender themselves as bail, when such persons have justified, i. c., es- tablished their sufficiency by satisfying the court that they possess the requisite qualifi- cations, a rule or order of court is made for their allowance, and the bail is then said to be perfected,

name: perfecting bail
subject: certain qualifications
definition: Certain qualifications of a property character being required of persons who tender themselves as bail, when such persons have justified, i. c., es- tablished their sufficiency by satisfying the court that they possess the requisite qualifi- cations, a rule or order of court is made for their allowance, and the bail is then said to be perfected,

name: perfecting bail
subject: bail
definition: Certain qualifications of a property character being required of persons who tender themselves as bail, when such persons have justified, i. c., es- tablished their sufficiency by satisfying the court that they possess the requisite qualifi- cations, a rule or order of court is made for their allowance, and the bail is then said to be perfected,

name: perfecting bail
subject: bail
definition: Certain qualifications of a property character being required of persons who tender themselves as bail, when such persons have justified, i. c., es- tablished their sufficiency by satisfying the court that they possess the requisite qualifi- cations, a rule or order of court is made for their allowance, and the bail is then said to be perfected,

name: perfect tender rule
subject: that buyer
definition: A rule which states that a buyer can reject the delivery of goods if they do not meet a certain standard, or are lesser than the ordered quantity.

name: performance indicators
subject: performance indicators
definition: In business terminology, performance indicators are commonly used to analyze certain objectives.

name: performance evaluation
subject: individual
definition: A formal analysis of any individual’s actions pertaining to his/ her job, as well as the results of those actions, in relation to a particular position. When we talk about financial trading, the goal of performance evaluation is to analyze the extent to which an individual has added monetary value to the clients, as well as to the firm.

name: peripheral device
subject: example
definition: Any device that can be connected to the computer for input, output or communication functions. Examples include printer, scanner, keyboard, mouse, etc.

name: permanent establishment
subject: example
definition: A fixed location from where business operations take place. Examples include offices, workshops and factories, etc. Taxes are charged on the permanent establishment if a business intends to perform for a longer period of time.

name: permanent establishment
subject: example
definition: A fixed location from where business operations take place. Examples include offices, workshops and factories, etc. Taxes are charged on the permanent establishment if a business intends to perform for a longer period of time.

name: permanent employee
subject: employee
definition: An employee who is hired to work without any time frame for his exit. For instance, a contractual employee might have his contract rescinded, or will have to leave if it is not renewed, but a permanent employee has no such constraint.

name: permanent employee
subject: permanent employee
definition: An employee who is hired to work without any time frame for his exit. For instance, a contractual employee might have his contract rescinded, or will have to leave if it is not renewed, but a permanent employee has no such constraint.

name: permanent alimony
subject: term
definition: a term that is applied to the court granted allowance to a spouse who is legally divorced or separated.

name: perl
subject: perl
definition: PERL is a programming language which is used to create applications and programs that focus heavily upon Computer Graphics Interaction. A number of different tasks can be handled by PERL. The language was created in 1987, with the purpose of manipulating text only.

name: perks
subject: employee
definition: Bonuses, or extra incentives that are given to employees exclusive of their salaries. For instance, an employee gets a credit card and a car from the company, as a ‘perk’.

name: perks
subject: employee
definition: Bonuses, or extra incentives that are given to employees exclusive of their salaries. For instance, an employee gets a credit card and a car from the company, as a ‘perk’.

name: permanent resident
subject: person
definition: Any person who possesses his own permanent residence, and resides there is a permanent resident.

name: perpetual debt
subject: investor
definition: A bond with no maturity date. Investors receive coupons but the principal is never paid. Refer to undated security, console, irredeemable bond, and perpetual floating rate note.

name: perpetual curacy
subject: office
definition: The office of a curate in a parish where there is no spiritual rector or vicar, but where a clerk (curate) is appointed to officiate there by the impropriator. 2 Burn. Ecc. Law, 55. The church or benefice tilled by a curate under these circumstances is also so called.

name: perpetual curacy
subject: office
definition: The office of a curate in a parish where there is no spiritual rector or vicar, but where a clerk (curate) is appointed to officiate there by the impropriator. 2 Burn. Ecc. Law, 55. The church or benefice tilled by a curate under these circumstances is also so called.

name: perpetrator
subject: erson
definition: Generally, this term denotes the x>erson who actually commits a crime or delict, or by whose immediate agency it occurs. But, where a servant of a rail- road company is killed through the negligence of a co-employe, the company itself may be regarded as the “perpetrator” of the act, within the meaning of a statute giving an action against the perpetrator. Philo v. Illinois Cent. R. Co., 33 Iowa, 47.     Perpetua lex est nullam legem huma- ii am ac positivam perpetuam esse, et clausula quae abrogationem excludit ab initio non valet. It is a perpetual law that no human and positive law can be perpetual, and a clause [in a law] which precludes the power of abrogation is void 06 initio. Bac. Max. p. 77, in reg. 19.

definition: Generally, this term denotes the x>erson who actually commits a crime or delict, or by whose immediate agency it occurs. name: person
subject: which place
definition: A man considered according to the rank he holds in society, with all the rights to which the place he holds entitles him, and the duties which it imposes. 1 Bouv. Inst. no. 137. A human being considered as capable of having rights and of being charged with duties; while a “thing” is the object over which rights may be exercised.

name: perquisitor
subject: purchaser
definition: In old English law. A purchaser; one who first acquired an estate to his family; one who acquired an estate by sale, by gift, or by any other method, except only that of descent 2 Bl. Comm. 220.

name: personal guarantee
subject: arrangement
definition: An arrangement in which a person becomes liable for the debts of another party, in case the other party fails to clear their dues on time. Can be regarded similar to a blank check that has been signed, but does not have a date.

name: personal savings rate
subject: individual
definition: The percentage at which an individual saves his/ her disposable income.

name: personal management
subject: goal
definition: To plan, highlight and set a route to fulfill the goals in a person’s life is known as personal management. Goals should be both short term as well as long term.

name: personal management
subject: goal
definition: To plan, highlight and set a route to fulfill the goals in a person’s life is known as personal management. Goals should be both short term as well as long term.

name: personal lines
subject: common examples
definition: A term used to refer to the insurance which provides cover to an individual or their families. Common examples include medical insurance, etc.

name: personal use property
subject: example
definition: Any property that can be utilized for personal use. Examples include clothing, vehicles, furniture, etc.

name: personal spending
subject: personal spending
definition: The amount of money spent by an individual on his or her own self. Personal spending covers shopping expenditure, car payables, as well as medical bills.

name: perturbatrix
subject: woman
definition: A woman who breaks the peace.

name: pertinent
subject: applicable relevant evidence
definition: Applicable; relevant Evidence is called “pertinent” when it is directed to the issue or matters in dispute, aud legitimately tends to prove the allegations of the party offering it; otherwise it is called “impertinent.” A pertinent hypothesis is one which, if sustained, would logically influence the issue. Whitaker v. State, 106 Ala. 30, 17 South. 456.

name: pertinent
subject: allegation
definition: Applicable; relevant Evidence is called “pertinent” when it is directed to the issue or matters in dispute, aud legitimately tends to prove the allegations of the party offering it; otherwise it is called “impertinent.” A pertinent hypothesis is one which, if sustained, would logically influence the issue. Whitaker v. State, 106 Ala. 30, 17 South. 456.

name: pertinent
subject: pertinent hypothesis
definition: Applicable; relevant Evidence is called “pertinent” when it is directed to the issue or matters in dispute, aud legitimately tends to prove the allegations of the party offering it; otherwise it is called “impertinent.” A pertinent hypothesis is one which, if sustained, would logically influence the issue. Whitaker v. State, 106 Ala. 30, 17 South. 456.

name: petty cash account
subject: account
definition: An account kept to manage the money that will be used for miscellaneous purchases. Petty cash accounts are maintained to keep a proper check on the finances that have been utilized.

name: pettifogger
subject: shyster
definition: A lawyer who is em- ployed in a small or mean business, or who carries on a disreputable business by unprincipled or dishonorable means.     “We think that the term ‘pettifogging shyster” needed no definition by witnesses before the jury. This combination of epithets, every lawyer and citizen knows, belongs to none but unscrupulous practitioners who disgrace their profession by doing mean work, and resort to sharp practice to do it” Bailey v. Kalamazoo Pub. Co., 40 Mich. 250.

name: petroleum products
subject: example
definition: Products that are obtained by processing natural gas and crude oil. Examples include liquefied petroleum gas, fuel oils, automotive gasolines, etc.

name: petrodollars
subject: cash flow
definition: Cash flow paid to oil producing nations. It is rerouted to the western banking system.

name: petrochemical
subject: example
definition: A chemical produced from either the cracking or any type of processing of petroleum oil, or natural gas/ methane. Examples include benzene, ethane, ethylene, etc.

name: phillips curve
subject: phillips curve
definition: The Phillips curve is a graphic depiction of the inversely proportional relationship that exists between the levels of unemployment, and the wages of a person. The main idea of the Phillips curve is for the government to maintain a balance between the two.

name: phillips curve
subject: government
definition: The Phillips curve is a graphic depiction of the inversely proportional relationship that exists between the levels of unemployment, and the wages of a person. The main idea of the Phillips curve is for the government to maintain a balance between the two.

name: philadelphia federal index
subject: index
definition: An index used to estimate the growth in any business, which is usually determined by analyzing several surveys conducted by participants on a voluntary basis. It is also known as the Business Outlook Survey.

name: phased retirement
subject: person
definition: A retirement procedure in which older working employees are gradually led to retirement. The process is such that the working hours are reduced gradually over a period of time, until finally a person is supposed to retire.

name: phase
subject: example
definition: A particular stage of any event, or phenomena. Examples include ‘a phase of my life?’ In Chemistry, it means matter’s physical state. In Physics, the term is used to determine the oscillatory motion of a wave.

name: physical completion
subject: phase
definition: A phase of any project where it has begun to function, but has not yet brought about any return.

name: physical characteristics
subject: personal characteristics
definition: The physical features of a person or something. Personal characteristics might include weight, volume, shape, color, etc.

name: physical and chemical treatment
subject: physical process
definition: A method that is used in large scale water treatment plants. The physical process includes filtration and air stripping, while chemical cleaning includes coagulation, ozonization and the induction of chlorine.

name: physical and chemical treatment
subject: chemical cleaning
definition: A method that is used in large scale water treatment plants. The physical process includes filtration and air stripping, while chemical cleaning includes coagulation, ozonization and the induction of chlorine.

name: physical and chemical treatment
subject: chemical cleaning
definition: A method that is used in large scale water treatment plants. The physical process includes filtration and air stripping, while chemical cleaning includes coagulation, ozonization and the induction of chlorine.

name: photovoltic cell
subject: photovoltaic cell
definition: A photovoltaic cell is a cell that has the ability to convert natural, or synthetic light in to electricity. It is commonly referred to as a solar cell.

name: pia fraus
subject: fraud subterfuge
definition: Lat. A pious fraud; a subterfuge or evasion considered morally justifiable on account of the ends sought to be promoted. Particularly applied to an evasion or disregard of the laws in the interests of religion or religious institutions, such as circumventing the statutes of mortmain.

name: pia fraus
subject: evasion
definition: Lat. A pious fraud; a subterfuge or evasion considered morally justifiable on account of the ends sought to be promoted. Particularly applied to an evasion or disregard of the laws in the interests of religion or religious institutions, such as circumventing the statutes of mortmain.

name: phytotoxic
subject: substance
definition: Any substance which can prove to be toxic for plantation is ‘phytotoxic’.

name: physician-patient privilege
subject: detail
definition: right to keep aspects of a person’s accident or illness secret before a trial commences. Sometimes this right can be waived and details need to be given to the opposing attorney.

name: physician partnerships
subject: term
definition: the term that is applied when a group of physicians agree to practice together and share responsibilities for outcomes.

name: physician partnerships
subject: term
definition: the term that is applied when a group of physicians agree to practice together and share responsibilities for outcomes.

name: piggyback
subject: company
definition: When a couple of companies take upon a business loan, it is known as ‘piggyback’. Similarly, if a company releases its stocks to the public, an investor can choose to unload his/ her stock as per their will.

name: pig iron
subject: 92 perecent iron
definition: Metal that has not been properly processed, is in a half- finished state, and has been brought out from the blast furnace. Pig iron contains 92 perecent iron, has significantly high amounts of carbon, up to 3.5 percent as well as a balance of manganese, silicone and various other impurities.

name: piercing the corporate veil
subject: shareholder
definition: When shareholders must pay losses from their personal assets. Refer to limited liability.

name: piece part
subject: example
definition: A single component that can be used after being assembled, or being disassembled too. Examples include transistor, relay, etc.

name: piece goods
subject: example
definition: Items that are sold as units with a set of specified dimensions. Examples of piece goods include sized bed sheets, carpets, table cloths, etc.

name: pickpocket
subject: thief
definition: A thief who secretly steals money or other property from the person of another.

name: pickpocket
subject: thief
definition: A thief who secretly steals money or other property from the person of another.

name: pilferer
subject: one
definition: One who steals petty things.

name: pilfer
subject: charge
definition: To pilfer, in the plain and popular sense, means to steal. To charge another with pilfering is to charge him with stealing, and is slander. Becket v. Sterrett, 4 Blackf. (Ind.) 499.

name: pila
subject: cause
definition: In old English law. That side of coined money which was called “pile,” be cause It was the side on which there was an impression of a church built on piles. Fleta. lib. 1, c. 39

name: piggybacking
subject: illegal piggybacking
definition: A practice that is considered highly unethican and in some cases illegal, piggybacking is a strategy by which a broker will immediately carry out a trade in his/ her personal account, after doing the same for a client. It is illegal in case the broker believes the client is acting upon information provided by insiders.

name: piggybacking
subject: which broker
definition: A practice that is considered highly unethican and in some cases illegal, piggybacking is a strategy by which a broker will immediately carry out a trade in his/ her personal account, after doing the same for a client. It is illegal in case the broker believes the client is acting upon information provided by insiders.

name: piggyback promotion
subject: firm
definition: A simple method of promotion in which a firm would begin selling another firm’s product as a ‘bundle offer’. The other product is one that does not compete with the firm’s original product.

name: piggyback promotion
subject: other product
definition: A simple method of promotion in which a firm would begin selling another firm’s product as a ‘bundle offer’. The other product is one that does not compete with the firm’s original product.

name: pip
subject: foreign exchange
definition: The foreign exchange quotes fifth decimal point.

name: pink slip party
subject: party
definition: A party of different persons who are expecting to have their jobs terminated. The main purpose of a pink slip party is to provide people with a network to gain other jobs.

name: pink slip party
subject: main purpose
definition: A party of different persons who are expecting to have their jobs terminated. The main purpose of a pink slip party is to provide people with a network to gain other jobs.

name: pincerna
subject: office
definition: In old English law. Butler ; the king’s butler, whose office it was to select out of the cargo of every vessel laden with wine, one cask at the prow and another at the stern, for the king’s use. Fleta, lib. – c. 22.

name: piratical
subject: act
definition: “Where the act uses the word ‘piratical,’ it does so in a general sense; importing that the aggression is unauthorized by the law of nations, hostile in its character, wanton and criminal in its commission, and utterly without any sanction from any public authority or sovereign power. In short, it means that the act belongs to the class of offenses which pirates are in the habit of perpetrating, whether they do it for purposes of plunder, or for purposes of hatred, revenge, or wanton abuse of power.” U. S. v. The Malek Adhel, 2 How. 232, 11 L. Ed. 239.

name: placeman
subject: one
definition: One who exercises a public employment, or fills a public statiou.

name: placed business
subject: insurer
definition: An insurance policy completed. The insurer has received their premium.

name: planned investment
subject: unplanned investments
definition: An investment made by a firm in order to gain capital goods, or stock. The distinctive factor from unplanned investments is that planned investments are used to speed up the movement of cash, while unplanned investments tie down the cash in the system.

name: plain old telephone service (pots)
subject: standard landline
definition: The standard landline used to provide telephone services. Makes use of a twisted pair copper wire. Common otions include outgoing calls, incoming calls, call waiting, call forwarding, IDSN, caller ID and the like.

name: planning permission
subject: approval
definition: Approval required from a local body whicih gives allowance over the initiation of a developmental project.

name: planning
subject: proper plan
definition: A function of management in which a proper plan is created to balance the needs and demands with the resources that arecurrently available. In planning, the goals are identified, then a plan is created to achieve those goals, then the means are arranged for the achievement of those goals and finally, the plan is implemented.

name: planning
subject: proper plan
definition: A function of management in which a proper plan is created to balance the needs and demands with the resources that arecurrently available. In planning, the goals are identified, then a plan is created to achieve those goals, then the means are arranged for the achievement of those goals and finally, the plan is implemented.

name: platinum
subject: platinum
definition: Platinum is a metal that is highly precious, since it has the longest life on shelf and is also the strongest. It is the most expensive metal in the world.

name: plea peremptory
subject: plea
definition: a plea made on the merits of an issue between 2 parties.

name: plea in discharge
subject: plea plaintiff
definition: a plea where a plaintiff has the right to sue but where the defendant has already fulfilled all of his obligations to a plaintiff.

name: plebeyos
subject: common
definition: In Spanish law. Commons: those who exercise any trade, or who cultivate the soil. White, New Recop. b. 1, tit. 5, c. 3.

name: pleader
subject: person business
definition: A person whose business it is to draw pleadings. Formerly, when pleading at common law was a highly technical and difficult art, there was a class of men known as “special pleaders not at the bar,” who held a position intermediate between counsel and attorneys. The class is now almost extinct, find the term “pleaders” Is generally applied, in England, to junior members of the common-law bar. Sweet.

name: pleader
subject: art
definition: A person whose business it is to draw pleadings. Formerly, when pleading at common law was a highly technical and difficult art, there was a class of men known as “special pleaders not at the bar,” who held a position intermediate between counsel and attorneys. The class is now almost extinct, find the term “pleaders” Is generally applied, in England, to junior members of the common-law bar. Sweet.

name: pledgor
subject: party
definition: The party delivering goods in pledge; the party pledging. Story, Bailm.

name: plug and play (pnp)
subject: plug and play
definition: Plug and Play is a term used for a feature in personal computers, which allows them to recognize any device that has been ‘plugged in’ to a computer. Examples include monitors, keyboards, mouses, printers, etc. The computer can read and configure the new device almost immediately, and totally on its own, allowing for maximum convenience.

name: plug and play (pnp)
subject: example
definition: Plug and Play is a term used for a feature in personal computers, which allows them to recognize any device that has been ‘plugged in’ to a computer. Examples include monitors, keyboards, mouses, printers, etc. The computer can read and configure the new device almost immediately, and totally on its own, allowing for maximum convenience.

name: pluvious insurance
subject: pluvious insurance
definition: An alternative term used for rain insurance. Pluvious insurance covers losses that might be incurred due to the interruption of an event on account of rain.

name: plurality voting
subject: voting
definition: The standard voting system, currently employed in most countries of the world. In plurality voting, each person votes for a candidate, and the candidate who has the most votes after the voting wins the election.

name: plurality of trust
subject: situation person
definition: A situation where a person makes more than one trust in a single document but the same person is trustee to them all.

name: plurality of trust
subject: same person
definition: A situation where a person makes more than one trust in a single document but the same person is trustee to them all.

name: point of diminishing returns
subject: point
definition: A point at which th e number of input at a marginal product is at its peak. After this point, it begins to reduce.

name: point barrier option
subject: time
definition: A barrier option whose barrier kicks in at only one time. This time is usually maturity. AKA european barrier option. Refer to partial barrier option.

name: podium
subject: person
definition: A slightly higher platform than the standard ground, from where people can see the person who is giving the speech.

name: police officer
subject: person
definition: a person who is an officer of the law enforcement team employed by the county, town, municipality or state.

name: police
subject: police
definition: Police is the function of that branch of the administrative machinery of government which is charged with the preservation of public order and tranquillity, the promotion of the public health, safety, and morals, and the prevention, detection, and punishment of crimes. See State v. Hine, 59 Conn. 50, 21 Atl. 1024. 10 L. It. A. S3; Monet v. Jones. 10 Smedes & M. (Miss.) 247: People v. Squire, 107 N. Y. 593, 14 N. E. S20, 1 Am. St. Rep. 893; Logan v. State, 5 Tex. App. 314. The police of a state, in a comprehensive sense, embraces its whole system of internal regulation, by which the state seeks not only to preserve the public order and to prevent offenses against the state, but also to establish for the intercourse of citizen with citizen those rules of good manners and good neighborhood which are calculated to prevent a conflict of rights, aud to insure to each the uninterrupted enjoyment of his own, so far as is reasonably consistent with a like enjoyment of rights by others. Cooley. Const. Lim. *572. It is defined by Jeremy Bentham in his works; “Police is in general a system of precaution, either for the prevention of crime or of calamities. Its business may be distributed into eight distinct branches: (1) Police for the prevention of offenses ; (2) Police for the prevention of calamities; (3) Police for the prevention of epidemic diseases; (4) Police of charity; (5) Police of interior communications; (6) Police of public amusements; (7) Police for recent intelligence; (8) Police for registration.” Canal Com’rs v. Willamette Transp. Co., G Or. 222.

name: poison put
subject: investor
definition: An option that allows investors to redeem their bonds if a trigger event occurs. The sudden redemption reduces cash value and makes the stock less attractive to the buyer.

name: point to point (ptp) circuit
subject: ptp circuit
definition: A connection made with telephone lines with only two ending points. A PTP circuit creates a direct link between two defined locations. It is primarily set for one customer, and a fixed monthly cost is incurred.

name: point reserved
subject: term
definition: term applied when a difficult point of law is presented and the judge wants time to weigh and consider the matter.

name: point reserved
subject: judge
definition: term applied when a difficult point of law is presented and the judge wants time to weigh and consider the matter.

name: policy of insurance
subject: loss
definition: A mercantile instrument in writing, by which one party, in consideration of a premium, engages to indemnify another against a contingent loss, by making him a payment in compensation, whenever the event shall happen by which the loss is to accrue. 2 Steph. Comm. 172.     The written instrument in which a contract of insurance is set forth is called a “policy of insurance.” Civ. Code Cal.

name: political asylum
subject: country
definition: the term used when a country accepts a foreigner on grounds he may be persecuted if he returns to his own country for his political rebellion.

name: policy summary
subject: summary
definition: A shortened version/ summary of any life insurance policy. A summary gives information regarding the coverage limitations, conditions as well as the total premiums that will be charged. The policy summary might be given out to a policy holder, on virtually every transaction.

name: polymer
subject: compound
definition: A compound with a significantly large molecular weight, meaning it has a lot of simpler molecules of a simlar type. Examples of polymers include a lot of different common plastics.

name: polymer
subject: example
definition: A compound with a significantly large molecular weight, meaning it has a lot of simpler molecules of a simlar type. Examples of polymers include a lot of different common plastics.

name: pooled investment vehicle (piv)
subject: organization
definition: An organization, for instance a mutual fund which adds up the capital from several investors, and then deploys it throuhg a proper strategy.

name: ponendum sigillum ad excep- tionem
subject: justice
definition: A writ by which justices were required to put their seals to exceptions exhibited by a defendant against a plaintiff’s evidence, verdict, or other proceedings, before them, according to the statute Westm. 2, (13 Edw. I. St 1, c. 31.)

name: population
subject: population ’
definition: All of the individuals of, units or samples that make up a constitution, usually for study purposes. For instance, the ‘population’ of a country is xxxx numbers.

name: pope nicholas* taxation
subject: first fruits
definition: The first fruits (priinitial or annates) were the first year’s profits of all the spiritual prefer- ments in the kingdom, according to a rate made by Walter, bishop of Norwich, in the time of Pope Iunocent II., and afterwards advanced in value in the time of Pope Nich- olas IV. This last valuation was begun A. D. 1288, and finished 1292, and is still pre- served in the exchequer. The taxes were regulated by it till the survey made in the twenty-sixth year of Henry VIII. 2 Steph. Comm. 507.

name: pop-up retail
subject: retail methods
definition: A method by which entrepreneurs establish retail outlets on a temporary basis. Commonly, pop up retail methods are used to set up temporary outlets in untested markets by large corporations. This helps them in saving money before setting up a permanent retail outlet.

name: poor debtor
subject: oath
definition: an oath that is sworn by the debtor that he has no funds or property he can pay his debt with.

name: portable document file (pdf)
subject: pdf document
definition: A PDF document is a file format that has been created by Adobe Systems, Inc., to be used with the Adobe Reader. It is commonly used to prevent copyright claims and allows the user to incorporate images, hyperlinks as well as a range of other features. A lot of PDF readers are currently available for free.

name: portability
subject: primary programming language
definition: The degree to which any software program can be executed on different software or hardware platforms. Generally, software that has been written with Java as the primary programming language has the ability to be portable. Or, portability can also mean to transfer an interest, right or benefit from one situation to another.

name: port of origin
subject: place
definition: A place from where a consignment has begun its carriage by sea.

name: port of discharge
subject: port ship
definition: A port where a ship or vessel will unload all its shipments, from where they will be dispatched to their consignees. Ultimately known as the port of unloading.

name: port of discharge
subject: vessel
definition: A port where a ship or vessel will unload all its shipments, from where they will be dispatched to their consignees. Ultimately known as the port of unloading.

name: port of call
subject: port
definition: A port that is listed upon the schedule of a ship, where it is supposed to drop anchor and remain for a fixed time period.

name: portfolio pumping
subject: manager
definition: When managers buy extra stock to boost prices higher. This is done at the quarter and end of the financial year. Refer to window dressing.

name: portfolio criteria
subject: criterion
definition: A criterion used to measure the developmental efforts of a firm for its products.

name: portfolio
subject: asset
definition: Assets managed together to reduce risks and improve investment opportunities. Refer to diversification, risk, and theory.

name: portfolio
subject: asset
definition: Assets managed together to reduce risks and improve investment opportunities. Refer to diversification, risk, and theory.

name: positioning statement
subject: firm
definition: An express statement which is generally written in order to give a clear outline of the goals that are to be achieved through a positioning strategy. The statement defines how a firm would describe its business and how it wants to set itself apart, as well as how the customers will gain profits through those features.

name: positioning
subject: company
definition: A strategy commonly adopted for marketing purposes, in which a brand tries to occupy a distinguished position as compared to other brands, in the customer’s thoughts. Companies adopt a variety of different techniques in order to achieve that image in the customer’s minds.

name: portionist
subject: one
definition: One who receives a portion; the allottee of a portion. One of two or more Incumbents of the same ecclesiastical benefice.

name: portioner
subject: minister
definition: In old English law. A minister who serves a benefice, together with others; so called because lie has only a portion of the tithes or profits of the living; also an allowance which a vicar commonly haa out of a rectory or impropriation. Cowell.     In Scotch law. The proprietor of a small feu or portion of land. Bell.

name: portioner
subject: lie
definition: In old English law. A minister who serves a benefice, together with others; so called because lie has only a portion of the tithes or profits of the living; also an allowance which a vicar commonly haa out of a rectory or impropriation. Cowell.     In Scotch law. The proprietor of a small feu or portion of land. Bell.

name: positive working capital
subject: companies assets
definition: When a companies assets exceed its liabilities. There is plenty of liquidity to cover obligatins. Refer to negative working capital.

name: positive sum game
subject: nobody
definition: A term from the decision theory, where nobody is a winner at somebody else’s expense, while the sum of all winnings as well as the incurred losses is a positive figure.

name: positive sum game
subject: sum
definition: A term from the decision theory, where nobody is a winner at somebody else’s expense, while the sum of all winnings as well as the incurred losses is a positive figure.

name: positive sum game
subject: incurred losses
definition: A term from the decision theory, where nobody is a winner at somebody else’s expense, while the sum of all winnings as well as the incurred losses is a positive figure.

name: positive pay
subject: fund
definition: A service initiated by banks, generaly to distinguish between checks that are fraudulent as wel las those who present them. Before the funds are issued, any mismatches are informed to the issuer of the check.

name: positive externality
subject: third party
definition: When a third party realizes a benefit, gained with no direct involvement and primarily through the transactions of another party, it is known as positive externality.

name: positive convexity
subject: asset
definition: When an asset has higher gains than losses. An example of these are long options and bonds. Refer to negative convexity, nonlinear instrument, and positive gamma.

name: positive carry
subject: asset
definition: When an asset earns more than it costs to maintain it. Refer to negative carry.

name: possessor bona fide
subject: person
definition: the person who occupies property with the conviction that he is the rightful owner.

name: possessor
subject: one
definition: One who possesses; one who has possession.

name: possession vaut titre
subject: in english law
definition: Fr. In English law, as in most systems of jurisprudence, the fact of possession raises a prima facie title or a presumption of the right of property in the thing possessed. In other words, the possession is as good as the title (about.) Brown.

name: possession vaut titre
subject: in english law
definition: Fr. In English law, as in most systems of jurisprudence, the fact of possession raises a prima facie title or a presumption of the right of property in the thing possessed. In other words, the possession is as good as the title (about.) Brown.

name: possession vacant
subject: term
definition: The term given to property that has been abandoned and vacated by a person who had possession of it.

name: possession natural
subject: term
definition: a term that is used when a person physically occupies a property without having the title to it.

name: possession hostile
subject: term possession
definition: the term fro the possession of property by a person who denies anyone else’s rights or claims to it.

name: possession hostile
subject: term possession
definition: the term fro the possession of property by a person who denies anyone else’s rights or claims to it.

name: possession actual
subject: term
definition: a term that is used for the situation where a person occupies the property that he possess.

subject: merchant
definition: When goods are weighed or measured, and the merchant has got an account thereof at the custom-house, and finds his entry already made too small, he must make a post or additional entry for the surplusage, in the same manner as the first was done. As a merchant is always in time, prior to the clearing of the vessel, to make his post, he should take care not to
