definition: The selling that is restricted to customers who meet a certain buying size or who reach a minimum ability to buy a product.

name: self-evaluation
subject: what area
definition: Taking a look at one’s development and progress to determine if a situation has improved and what area may need improvement.

name: self-employed
subject: person
definition: A person who obtains their own work and where the rules of employment do not apply. They may employ other people to get work completed.

name: self-employed
subject: person
definition: A person who obtains their own work and where the rules of employment do not apply. They may employ other people to get work completed.

name: self-employed
subject: other people
definition: A person who obtains their own work and where the rules of employment do not apply. They may employ other people to get work completed.

name: self motivation
subject: ability
definition: The ability to do what has to be done without any outside influence from situations or people.

name: self-liquidating
subject: repayment
definition: An expense or obligation that is able to make repayments to fulfill that obligation. A hire purchase for example.

name: self-interest
subject: self interest
definition: Too much self interest will diminish the benefits of a large group. The focus on activities and actions that are for the benefit of the individual.

name: self-help project
subject: scheme
definition: A scheme that is sponsored by the government where members of the community are encouraged to improve themselves through the means of creating self employment, food growing or providing themselves with shelter.

name: sell short
subject: strategy
definition: A strategy in trading where an investor will borrow shares from a security or futures contract and will offer them for sale to other investors. The investor believes the price will lower and will then return the shares to the lender. If the price rises the investor will make a loss.

name: sellingaway
subject: broker
definition: When brokers sell products from another firm illegaly. The client will not have any recourse against the originating company.

name: selling terms
subject: day seller
definition: A period of time, normally 30 days, a seller gives the buyer to pay for goods and services that are provided on credit.

name: selling short
subject: term person
definition: a term where a person sells stocks that are not really owned by the seller where the seller hopes to cover the sale by buying it later at a lower price.

name: selling concession
subject: syndicate members
definition: When syndicate members get a discount on new issues. This is half the underwriting spread.

name: selling concept
subject: company
definition: A marketing idea that says a company needs to push sales in order for customers to buy a product. The selling company needs to be an aggressive force.

name: selling concept
subject: customer
definition: A marketing idea that says a company needs to push sales in order for customers to buy a product. The selling company needs to be an aggressive force.

name: seller’s market
subject: situation sellers
definition: A situation where sellers can dictate the price due to demand being higher than the supply. A hard market and the opposite of a buyers’ market.

name: seller’s lien
subject: legal right seller
definition: The legal right a seller has to retain the title and possession of goods that are sold until the full price is paid.

name: seminar
subject: formal presentation
definition: A formal presentation by experts where the attendees are encouraged to ask questions and discuss the matter to hand.

name: sentences to run concurrently
subject: person
definition: a term for sentences that run at the same time as other sentences and often occur when has a person has committed a number of wrongs.

name: sensitivity chart
subject: tornado diagram
definition: Called a tornado diagram it is a graph that plots results of various assumptions on a final outcome in a sensitvity analysis test.

name: separate account
subject: pension plan sponsor
definition: The relationship where a single pension plan sponsor retains an investment manager under a stated policy for investment that is exclusive to the sponsor.

name: separate
subject: tence
definition: tence is one which puts an end to the suit, and regards the principal matter in ques- tiou. An interlocutory sentence determines only some incidental matter in the proceed- ings. Phillim. Ecc. Law, 1200.

name: separate
subject: interlocutory sentence
definition: tence is one which puts an end to the suit, and regards the principal matter in ques- tiou. An interlocutory sentence determines only some incidental matter in the proceed- ings. Phillim. Ecc. Law, 1200.

name: septum
subject: place
definition: Lat In Roman law. An inclosure; tin inclosed place where the people voted;’ otherwise called “ovile.” In old English law. An inclosure or close. Cowell.

name: sequestrari facias
subject: process
definition: In English ecclesiastical practice. A process in the ua- ture of a levari facias, commanding the bish- _op to euter into the rectory and parish fl church, and to take and sequester the same, and hold them until, of the rents, tithes, and profits thereof, and of the other ecclesiastical goods of a defendant, he have levied the plaintiffs debt. 3 Bl. Comm. 418; 2 Archb. gPr. 1284.

name: sequatur sub suo periculo
subject: writ
definition: In old English practice. A writ which issued where a sheriff had returned nihil, upon a summoneas ail warrantizandum, and after an alias and pluries had been issued. So called because tbe tenant lost his lands without any recovery in value, unless upon that writ he brought the vouchee into court. Rose. Real Act. 26S; Cowell.

name: series bond
subject: each bond
definition: A group of bonds under the same indenture that are issued by the same company. Each bond has different coupon rates and maturity dates. Refer to serial bond.

name: series bond
subject: each bond
definition: A group of bonds under the same indenture that are issued by the same company. Each bond has different coupon rates and maturity dates. Refer to serial bond.

name: serial shipping container code (sscc)
subject: identification code
definition: An identification code of 18 characters used for mainly non-standard mix containers.it has a 2 character application identifier followed by 1 digit packaging type, country code , 6 digit manufacturer ID, 9 digit shipping container number and a 1 digit check number.

name: serial ata
subject: bus
definition: An internal or external bus designed so computers can send information back and forth to and from each other.

name: serial ata
subject: computer
definition: An internal or external bus designed so computers can send information back and forth to and from each other.

name: sergeant at arms
subject: name
definition: the name that is given to a person who is appointed by a body like the House of Representatives, the Senate or other organisation to keep order at meetings.

name: servi
subject: slaves persons
definition: Lat In old European law. Slaves; persons over whom their masters had absolute dominion.  In old English law. Bondmen; servile teuants. Cowell.

name: servant
subject: control
definition: A servant is one who is employed to render personal services to his employer, otherwise than in the pursuit of an independent calling, and who in such service remains entirely under the control and direction of the latter, who is called his master. Civ. Code Cal.

name: servant
subject: direction
definition: A servant is one who is employed to render personal services to his employer, otherwise than in the pursuit of an independent calling, and who in such service remains entirely under the control and direction of the latter, who is called his master. Civ. Code Cal.

name: service lease
subject: lease
definition: A lease of equipment where the lessee needs to maintain and to service the asset that is leased.

name: servient
subject: servient estate
definition: Serving; subject to a service or servitude. A servient estate is one which is burdened with a servitude.

name: services marketing mix
subject: selection
definition: The selection of services that are offere to a customer who then chooses the one they want.

name: set of exchange
subject: several parts
definition: In mercantile law. Foreign bills are usually drawn in duplicate or triplicate, the several parts being called respectively “first of exchange,” “second of exchange,” etc., and these parts together constitute a “set of exchange.” Any one of them being paid, the others become void.

name: set down
subject: set
definition: To set down a cause for trial or hearing at a given term is to enter its title in the calendar, list, or docket of calises which are to be brought on at that term.

name: set down
subject: hearing
definition: To set down a cause for trial or hearing at a given term is to enter its title in the calendar, list, or docket of calises which are to be brought on at that term.

name: set
subject: lease
definition: This word appears to be nearly synonymous with “lease.” A lease of mines is frequently termed a “mining set” Brown.

name: set
subject: lease
definition: This word appears to be nearly synonymous with “lease.” A lease of mines is frequently termed a “mining set” Brown.

name: settlement out of court
subject: agreement
definition: an agreement of opposing parties to settle a matter outside of a court before the controversy has reached court.

name: settlement out of court
subject: controversy
definition: an agreement of opposing parties to settle a matter outside of a court before the controversy has reached court.

name: settlement option
subject: contract
definition: A contract in a financial market where the seller can deliver a finacial instrument within a set period of time, usually 5 to 60 days, after the trading date.

name: several counts
subject: plaintiff
definition: Where a plaintiff has several distinct causes of action, he is allowed to pursue them cumulatively in the same action, subject to certain rules which the law pre- scribos. Wharton.

name: severable contract
subject: failure
definition: A contract made up of several parts where you can comply with parts seperately from one another. The failure to comply with one part will not terminate the contract.

name: setup
subject: change
definition: 1. Called a change over where a new piece is made ready to start being made. 2. Arrangement of seating. 3. A fully assembled item that is supplied ready to be used.

name: sham plea
subject: each owner
definition: as pasture for the cattle of all the owners, and in some cases for the cattle of other persons as well; each owner is called a “severalty owner,” and his rights of pasture are called “severalty rights,” as opposed to the rights of persons not owners. Cooke, Incl. Acts, 47, 103u.

name: sham plea
subject: his rights
definition: as pasture for the cattle of all the owners, and in some cases for the cattle of other persons as well; each owner is called a “severalty owner,” and his rights of pasture are called “severalty rights,” as opposed to the rights of persons not owners. Cooke, Incl. Acts, 47, 103u.

name: sham plea
subject: his rights
definition: as pasture for the cattle of all the owners, and in some cases for the cattle of other persons as well; each owner is called a “severalty owner,” and his rights of pasture are called “severalty rights,” as opposed to the rights of persons not owners. Cooke, Incl. Acts, 47, 103u.

name: shareholder agreement
subject: bankrupt resigns
definition: The contract between a firm and the share holders  which outlines how internal affairs of the firm are managed, how any disputes are resolved and what happens when a share holder is bankrupt, resigns, is discharged, retires or is incapacitated.

name: shared savings
subject: type
definition: A type of sales contract where a vendor will install a pice of equipment at the premises of the customer free of charge but then use any money realised from the installation to pay for the item.

name: share repurchase
subject: company
definition: A company will buy its own shares in order to boost the market for them by reducing the quantity of available shares.

name: share for share offer
subject: bid
definition: A bid for tak over where one firm offers the other shares that are equal to the bid for take over. If it is accepted the firms will merge to be one firm.

name: sharp
subject: sharp clause
definition: A “sharp” clause in a mortgage or other security (or the whole iustrument described as “sharp”) is one which empowers the creditor to take prompt and summary action upon default in payment or breach of other conditions.

name: sheep-walk
subject: right
definition: A right of sheep-walk is the same thing as a fold-course, (g. v.) Elton, Commons, 44.

name: sheep-silver
subject: an- tenants
definition: A service turned into money, which was paid in respect that an- ciently the tenants used to wash the lord’s sheep. Wharton.

name: shibosai
subject: foreign company
definition: A foreign company using the yen to make a transaction in Japan. Refer to daimyo, geisha, samurai, and shogun.

name: shibosai
subject: foreign company
definition: A foreign company using the yen to make a transaction in Japan. Refer to daimyo, geisha, samurai, and shogun.

name: shipping time
subject: time
definition: The time it takes a shipped order to reach its destination. Combined with order time it is the elapsed time between the requisition and avauilability.

name: shipper
subject: owner
definition: 1. The owner of goods who intrusts them on board a vessel for delivery abroad, by charter-party or otherwise.  2. Also, a Dutch word, signifying the master of a ship. It is mentioned in some of the statutes; is now generally called “skipper.” Tomlins.

name: shipment contract
subject: contract
definition: A contract for sale where the seller takes the risk of loss until the goods arrive at its destination. See destination contract.

name: shock loss
subject: insurance firm
definition: When an insurance firm suffers a loss that causes financial distress because the clients loss is so severe. Protection can be provided using reinsurance mechanisms and diversification. Refer to clash loss.

name: short form audit report
subject: following
definition: A standard US 2 paragraph report where the opening paragraph outlines what the auditor has completed and the following paragraph shows the findings from the audit.

name: shopping cart
subject: representation
definition: The representation on a web site of a shopping cart used in a supermarket that all items bought are stored in until it is time to enter the check out area.

name: short squeeze
subject: group
definition: When a group or institution buy a portion of an asset to cause their prices to go up. This way the short position has to cover it. Refer to bear trap.

name: short squeeze
subject: institution
definition: When a group or institution buy a portion of an asset to cause their prices to go up. This way the short position has to cover it. Refer to bear trap.

name: short squeeze
subject: short position
definition: When a group or institution buy a portion of an asset to cause their prices to go up. This way the short position has to cover it. Refer to bear trap.

name: show-up
subject: name
definition: the name for a one-on-one meeting between a suspect and a witness in a line up where the witness is shown a group of people and asked to select the suspect.

name: show cause
subject: one
definition: To show cause against a rule nisi, an order, decree, execution, etc., is to appear as directed, and present to the court such reasons and considerations as one has to offer why it should not be confirmed, take effect, be executed, or as the case may be.

name: show
subject: show
definition: Although the words “show” and “indicate” are sometimes interchangeable in popular use, they are not always so. To “show” is to make apparent or clear by evi- dence; to prove; while an “indication” may be merely a symptom; that which points to or gives direction to the mind. Coyle v. Com., 104 Pa. 133.

name: show
subject: indication
definition: Although the words “show” and “indicate” are sometimes interchangeable in popular use, they are not always so. To “show” is to make apparent or clear by evi- dence; to prove; while an “indication” may be merely a symptom; that which points to or gives direction to the mind. Coyle v. Com., 104 Pa. 133.

name: si actio
subject: conclusion
definition: Lat. The conclusion of a plea to an action when the defendant demands judgment, if the plaintiff ought to have his action, etc. Obsolete.  Si alicujus rei societas sit et finis ne- gotio impositus est, finitur societas. If there is a partnership in any matter, and the business is ended, the partnership ceases. Griswold v. Waddington, 16 Johns. (N. Y.) 438, 489.  Si aliquid ex solemnibus deficiat, cum cequitas poscit, subveniendnm est. If any one of certain required forms be wanting. where equity requires, it will be aided. 1 Kent, Comm. 157. The want of some of a neutral vessel’s papers Is strong presumptive evidence against the ship’s neutrality, yet the want of any one of them is not absolutely conclusive. Id.

name: shyster
subject: unscrupulous practitioner
definition: A “pettifogging shyster” is an unscrupulous practitioner who disgraces his profession by doing mean work, and resorts to sharp practice to do it. Bailey v. Kalamazoo Pub. Co., 40 Mich. 251. See, also, Gribble v. Pioneer Press Co., 34 Minn. 342, 25 N. W. 710.  Si a jure discedas, vagus eris, et erunt omnia omnibus incerta. If you depart from the law, you will go astray, and all things will be uncertain to everybody. Co. Litt. 2276.

name: side eines
subject: if claim
definition: In mining law, the side lines of a mining claim are those which measure the extent of the claim on each side of the middle of the vein at the surface. They are not necessarily the side lines as laid down on the ground or on a map or plat; for if the claim, in its longer dimension, crosses the vein, instead of following it, the platted side lines will be treated in law as the end lines, and vice .versa, bee Argentine Min. Co. v. Terrible Min. Co., 122 U. S. 47S, 7 Sup. Ct. 135G. 30 L. Ed. 1140; Del Monte Min. Co. v. Last Chance Mil). Co., 171 U. S. 55, 18 Sup. Ct. 895, 43 L. Ed. 72.

name: sicut me deus adjuvet
subject: lat
definition: Lat So help me God. Fleta, 1. 1, c. 18,

name: signature
subject: seal
definition: In ecclesiastical law. The name of a sort of rescript, without seal, containing the supplication, the signature of the pope or his delegate, and the grant of a pardon. In contracts. The act of writing one’s name upon a deed, note, contract, or other instrument, either to identify or authenticate it, or to give it validity as one’s own act. The name so written is also called a “signature.”

name: signatory
subject: person
definition: A person who places their signature on an agrrement that causes them to be bound by the terms of it.

name: sign-manual
subject: signature
definition: In English law. The signature or subscription of the king is termed his “sign-manual.” There is this difference between what the sovereign does under the sign manual and what he or she does under the great seal, viz., that the former is done as a personal act of the sovereign; the latter as an act of state. Brown.

name: sign-manual
subject: subscription
definition: In English law. The signature or subscription of the king is termed his “sign-manual.” There is this difference between what the sovereign does under the sign manual and what he or she does under the great seal, viz., that the former is done as a personal act of the sovereign; the latter as an act of state. Brown.

name: sign
subject: give
definition: To affix one’s name to a writing or instrument, for the purpose of authenti- cating it, or to give it effect as one’s act  To “sign” is merely to write one’s name on paper, or declare assent or attestation by some sign or mark, and does not, like “subscribe,” require that one should write at the bottom of the instrument signed. See Sheehan v. Ivear- nev, 82 Miss. 6S8. 21 South. 41. 35 L. R. A. 102; Robins v. Coryell, 27 Barb. (N. Y.) 5G0; James v. Patten, 6 N. Y. 9, 55 Am. Dec. 370.

name: silicon valley
subject: hub
definition: A geographical area of California that is considered the hub of technology of the US that comprises computer companies and manufacturers of computer chips.

name: silicon valley
subject: hub
definition: A geographical area of California that is considered the hub of technology of the US that comprises computer companies and manufacturers of computer chips.

name: silentiarius
subject: one
definition: In English law. One of the privy council; also an usher, who sees good rule and silence kept in court. Wharton.

name: silentiarius
subject: one
definition: In English law. One of the privy council; also an usher, who sees good rule and silence kept in court. Wharton.

name: silence estoppel by
subject: term
definition: a term for the situation where a person is obliged to speak on another person’s behalf but does not end up speaking. The silence is dishonest and damaging.

name: significavtt
subject: word
definition: In ecclesiastical law. When this word is used alone, it means the SIGNING JUDGMENT 1089

name: significant influence
subject: influence
definition: The influence that is exerted  by one firm over another where the first firm owns between 20 and 50 % share in the other firm.

name: simple breakeven
subject: number
definition: The number of years it takes premiums to cover the initial premuim on a conversion bond. Refer to adjusted and equivalent breakeven.

name: simplex
subject: bishop certificate
definition: bishop’s certificate to the court of chancery in order to obtain the writ of excommunica- tion ; but, where the words “icrit of sitjnifi- cavit” are used, the meaning is the same as “icrit de excommunicato capiendo.” Shelf. Mar. & Div. 502. Obsolete.

name: simplex
subject: words icrit
definition: bishop’s certificate to the court of chancery in order to obtain the writ of excommunica- tion ; but, where the words “icrit of sitjnifi- cavit” are used, the meaning is the same as “icrit de excommunicato capiendo.” Shelf. Mar. & Div. 502. Obsolete.

name: single bond
subject: heir executor
definition: A deed whereby the obligor obliges himself, his heirs, executors, and administrators, to pay a certain sum of money to the obligee at a day named, without terms of defeasance.

name: single bond
subject: administrator
definition: A deed whereby the obligor obliges himself, his heirs, executors, and administrators, to pay a certain sum of money to the obligee at a day named, without terms of defeasance.

name: sinecure
subject: has vicar
definition: In ecclesiastical law. When a rector of a parish neither resides nor perforins duty at his benefice, but has a vicar under him endowed and charged with the cure thereof, this is termed a “sinecure.” Brown.  An ecclesiastical benefice without cure of souls.  In popular usage, the term denotes an office which yields a revenue to the incumbent, but makes little or no demand upon his time or attention.

name: simultaneous death act
subject: law
definition: a law that governs a situation in an accident where 2 people die at the same time who have willed their estates to each other.

name: single stock futures (ssf)
subject: contract
definition: A contract for futures where the underlying asset is one security rather than an index or basket of one hundred. See One Chicago LLC.

name: single point of failure
subject: point
definition: A point or part of a system where there is no backup in case of failure. The whole system will become disabled.

name: single point of failure
subject: part
definition: A point or part of a system where there is no backup in case of failure. The whole system will become disabled.

name: sister
subject: woman
definition: A woman who has the same father and mother with another, or has one of them only. The word is the correlative of “brother.”

name: sister
subject: woman
definition: A woman who has the same father and mother with another, or has one of them only. The word is the correlative of “brother.”

name: situational leadership
subject: leadership model
definition: A leadership model designed by Ken Blanchard and Paul Hersey where effective leadership needs flexibility in style that is dependent on the situation at hand.

name: six-day license
subject: liquor license
definition: In English law. A liquor license, containing a condition that the premises in respect of which the license is granted shall be closed during the whole of Sunday, granted under section 49 of the licensing act 1872 (35 & 36 Vict c. 94.)

name: sliding commission
subject: compensation
definition: A compensation for sales personnel where they are paid different percentages of commission at different volumes of sales.

name: sleeping beauty
subject: firm
definition: A firm that is failing that becomes a prime takeover possibility.

name: slay
subject: word
definition: This word, in an indictment, adds nothing to the force and effect of the word “kill,” when used with reference to the taking of human life. It is particularly applicable to the taking of human life in battle; and, when it is not used in this sense, it is synonymous with “kill.” State v. Thomas, 32 La. Ann. 351.

name: slavery
subject: one man
definition: The condition of a slave; that civil relation in which one man has absolute power over the life, fortune, and liberty of another.

name: slave
subject: person
definition: A person who is wholly subject to the will of another; one who has no freedom of action, but whose person and services are wholly under the control of another. Webster. One who Is under the power of a master, and who belongs to him ; so that the master may sell and dispose of his person, of his industry, and of his labor, without his being able to do anything, have anything, or acquire anything, but what must belong to his master. Civ. Code La. art. 35.

name: slumlord
subject: name
definition: the name of a person who owns a dilapidate building where poor people are forced to live.

name: slowdown strike
subject: employee
definition: An industrial action wherfe employees slow down their working practices and reduce output but do not go on stike.

name: slowdown
subject: employee
definition: where employees will intentionally slow down working instead of calling a strike.

name: slotting fee
subject: sum
definition: A sum paid to by the vendor to a retail chain for a place on its shelves, room in its wharehouse, puting the product on the store inventory and programming scanners to read the bar codes.

name: small tithes
subject: tithe
definition: All personal aud mixed tithes, aud also hops, llax, saffrons, po- tatoes, aud sometimes, by custom, wood. Otherwise called “privy tithes.” 2 Steph. Comm. 720.

name: soc, sok, or soka
subject: jurisdiction power
definition: In Saxon law. Jurisdiction ; a power or privilege to administer justice and execute the laws; also a shire, circuit, or territory. Cowell.

name: soc, sok, or soka
subject: privilege
definition: In Saxon law. Jurisdiction ; a power or privilege to administer justice and execute the laws; also a shire, circuit, or territory. Cowell.

name: social darwinism
subject: strong
definition: A theory that is used to explain success of social groups over other social groups. Only the strongest will survive, Cahrles Darwin and Origin of Species.

name: social darwinism
subject: strong
definition: A theory that is used to explain success of social groups over other social groups. Only the strongest will survive, Cahrles Darwin and Origin of Species.

name: social network
subject: people family
definition: The people, family and frinds that form a system that is interconnected where alliances will be formed, information swapped and strings pulled.

name: social network
subject: frind
definition: The people, family and frinds that form a system that is interconnected where alliances will be formed, information swapped and strings pulled.

name: social loafing
subject: free ride
definition: The actions of members of a group who don’t work as hard they would if working by themselves. The “free ride effect”-assuming someone else will do the work and the “Sucker effect”- members of a group reduce their efforts in a direct response to the free riders.

name: social loafing
subject: free ride
definition: The actions of members of a group who don’t work as hard they would if working by themselves. The “free ride effect”-assuming someone else will do the work and the “Sucker effect”- members of a group reduce their efforts in a direct response to the free riders.

name: social loafing
subject: free ride
definition: The actions of members of a group who don’t work as hard they would if working by themselves. The “free ride effect”-assuming someone else will do the work and the “Sucker effect”- members of a group reduce their efforts in a direct response to the free riders.

name: social impact system
subject: company
definition: A document highlighting how a company from the service industry is making a difference by dveloping new technologies and new products.

name: socially conscious mutual fund
subject: mutual fund
definition: A mutual fund that has excluded investing in companies whose business practices are thought to be ethically or morally troubling.

name: soft asset
subject: hard asset
definition: An asset such a human resources, brans name and knowledge that is not shown on a financial statement. A hard asset is cash, land or equipment.

name: soft asset
subject: hard asset
definition: An asset such a human resources, brans name and knowledge that is not shown on a financial statement. A hard asset is cash, land or equipment.

name: software
subject: computer
definition: The information, in the form of computer programs that make a computer carry out certain functions.

name: soft selling
subject: differ
definition: A philosophy used to sell goods and services by first finding the cistomers needs and wants. Differs from a hard sell using psychological pressure for a fast sale.

name: sokemanries
subject: land
definition: Lands and tenements which were not held by knight-service, nor by grand serjeanty, nor by petit, but by simple services; being, as it were, lands en- franchised by the king or his predecessors from their ancient demesne. Their tenants were solcemans. Wharton.

name: sokemanries
subject: tenement
definition: Lands and tenements which were not held by knight-service, nor by grand serjeanty, nor by petit, but by simple services; being, as it were, lands en- franchised by the king or his predecessors from their ancient demesne. Their tenants were solcemans. Wharton.

name: sokemanries
subject: tenant
definition: Lands and tenements which were not held by knight-service, nor by grand serjeanty, nor by petit, but by simple services; being, as it were, lands en- franchised by the king or his predecessors from their ancient demesne. Their tenants were solcemans. Wharton.

name: software tester
subject: run test
definition: A technician who runs tests on software programs and other applications before they reach market to be sure of quality and function.

name: solenoid
subject: electro
definition: Used to relay energy from one device to another that is an electro mechanical piece.It is a coil that can produce an electr-magnetic field.

name: sole proprietorship
subject: form
definition: The simple and oldest form of ownership where one person runs the buainess and accepts all of the risks.

name: sompnour
subject: oflicer
definition: In ecclesiastical law, an oflicer of the ecclesiastical courts whose duty was to serve citations or process.

name: somnambulism
subject: condition
definition: Sleep-walking. Whether this condition is anything more than a co- operation of the voluntary muscles with the thoughts which occupy the mind during sleep is not settled by physiologists. Wharton.

name: sound bite
subject: block
definition: A block of audio that is 10 to 30 seconds long that is the basic element of TV or radio broadcast.

name: sororicide
subject: killing
definition: The killing or murder of a sister; one who murders his sister. This is uot a technical term of the law.

name: sororicide
subject: murder
definition: The killing or murder of a sister; one who murders his sister. This is uot a technical term of the law.

name: sorner
subject: person
definition: In Scotch law. A person who takes meat and drink from others by force or menaces, without paying for it Bell. SOROR 1098 SOVEREIGN

name: sources of the law
subject: law
definition: The origins from which particular positive laws derive their authority and coercive force. Such are constitutions, treaties, statutes, usages, and customs. In another sense, the authoritative or reliable works, records, documents, edicts, etc. to which we are to look for an understanding of what constitutes the law. Such, for example, with reference to the Boman law, are the compilations of Justinian and the treatise of Gains; and such, with reference to the common law, are especially the an- cient reports and the works of such writers as Bracton, Littleton, Coke, “Fleta,” and others.

name: sources of the law
subject: law
definition: The origins from which particular positive laws derive their authority and coercive force. Such are constitutions, treaties, statutes, usages, and customs. In another sense, the authoritative or reliable works, records, documents, edicts, etc. to which we are to look for an understanding of what constitutes the law. Such, for example, with reference to the Boman law, are the compilations of Justinian and the treatise of Gains; and such, with reference to the common law, are especially the an- cient reports and the works of such writers as Bracton, Littleton, Coke, “Fleta,” and others.

name: source determination
subject: tracking process
definition: The process used to find the cause of a problem or an issue that has arisen. A back tracking process to locate the cause.

name: source attractiveness
subject: item
definition: The way that an item is considered to have a greater attraction than a similar item due to where it came from.

name: speaking with prosecutor
subject: method
definition: A method of compounding an offense, allowed in the English practice, where the court permits a defendant convicted of a misdemeanor to speak with the prosecutor before judgment is pronounced; if the prosecutor declares himself satisfied, the court may In- flict a trivial punishment. 4 Steph. Comm. 261.

name: speaking with prosecutor
subject: satisfied court
definition: A method of compounding an offense, allowed in the English practice, where the court permits a defendant convicted of a misdemeanor to speak with the prosecutor before judgment is pronounced; if the prosecutor declares himself satisfied, the court may In- flict a trivial punishment. 4 Steph. Comm. 261.

name: span of control
subject: manager
definition: The number or persons that a manager has control over that varies with the type of work involved.

name: spam
subject: mass mailing
definition: A mass mailing via the interenet where a message is sent to everyone whose email address is known of. It does not ask permission.

name: special assessment bond
subject: investor
definition: A municipal bond that is issued in order to provide funding for a special dvelopment. Investors get interest from a tax levied on the projects beneficiaries.

name: special election
subject: election
definition: An election for a particular emergency; out of the regularcourse; as one held to fill a vacancy arising by death of the incumbent of the office.Electiones fiant rite et libere sine in- terruptione aliqua. Elections should be made indue form, and freely, without any interruption. 2 Inst. 109.

name: specialpurpose entity (spe)
subject: company
definition: A company added to prevent bankruptcy by arranging securitization for the sponsor. This company must become a charitable trust that is owned by a third party. The company and sponsor share equity. AKA special purpose vehicle and variable interest entity.

name: specific performance
subject: mandatory party
definition: The court order that is mandatory where a party must fulfills its contractual obligations according to the exact terms of the contract.

name: spes recuperandi
subject: hope
definition: Lat. The hope of recovery or recapture; the chance of retaking property captured at sea, which prevents the captors from acquiring complete ownership of the property until they have definitely precluded it by effectual measures. 1 Kent, Comm. 101.

name: sperate
subject: debt
definition: That of which there is hope. Thus a debt which one may hope to recover may be called “sperate,” in opposition to “desperate.” See 1 Chit. Pr. 520.

name: sponsor
subject: surety
definition: A surety; one who makes a promise or gives security for another, partic- ularly a godfather in baptism.  In the civil law. One who intervenes for another voluntarily and without being re- quested.

name: spot date
subject: term
definition: A term in foreign exchange markets where the date is 2 business days away from today where currency needs to be sold and must be delivered.

name: spurious
subject: spurious bank - bill
definition: Not proceeding from the true source; not genuine; counterfeited. “A spurious bank-bill may be a legitimate impression from the genuine plate, but it must have the signatures of persons not the officers of the bank whence it purports to have issued, or else the names of fictitious persons. A spurious bill, also, may be an illegitimate impression from a genuine plate, or an impression from a counterfeit plate, but it must have such signatures or names as we have just indicated. A bill, therefore, may be both counterfeit and forged, or both counterfeit and spurious, but it cannot be both forged and spurious.” Kirby v. State, 1 Ohio St. 187.

name: spreadlock
subject: guarantees price
definition: A contract granting the issuer of a bond a fixed spread for a short time before the trade is complete. This guarantees the price will be a reference not a spread. Refer to drop lock and rate lock.

name: stabilia
subject: man
definition: A writ called by that name, founded on a custom in Normandy, that where a man in power claimed lands in the possession of an inferior, he petitioned the prince that it might be put into his hands till the right was decided, whereupon he had this writ Wharton.  Stabit praesnmptio donee probetnr in contrariuin. A presumption will stand good till the contrary is proved. Hob. 297; Broom, Max. 949.

name: stabilia
subject: writ
definition: A writ called by that name, founded on a custom in Normandy, that where a man in power claimed lands in the possession of an inferior, he petitioned the prince that it might be put into his hands till the right was decided, whereupon he had this writ Wharton.  Stabit praesnmptio donee probetnr in contrariuin. A presumption will stand good till the contrary is proved. Hob. 297; Broom, Max. 949.

name: squitas est correctio legis generaliter latse, qua parte deficit
subject: equity
definition: Equity is the correction of that wherein the law, by reason of its generality, is deficient Plowd. 375.

name: squeeze
subject: investor
definition: When investors sell commodities that suddenly increase in price leading to distorted prices. Refer to short squeeze.

name: stakeholder
subject: group organization
definition: Group, organization or person who has a stake  that can be affected by the organizations objectives, policies and actions. See corporate governance.

name: stakeholder
subject: person
definition: Group, organization or person who has a stake  that can be affected by the organizations objectives, policies and actions. See corporate governance.

name: standard hours allowed
subject: length
definition: The length of time it takes in order to produce a quality service or product.

name: standard hours
subject: number
definition: The number of hours it takes a skilled worker to complete a job under conditions that are considered normal.

name: standard hours
subject: number
definition: The number of hours it takes a skilled worker to complete a job under conditions that are considered normal.

name: standby loan
subject: mechanism
definition: Mechanism of contingent capital where the lender gives a commitment to advance money on demand or at a future date.

name: standards bodies
subject: organization
definition: Organization in a public or private sector, national or international that proposes, monitors, develops voluntary standards. For example ISO, ANSI.

name: staphylococcus
subject: genus
definition: Genus of a gram-positive, grape shaped bacteria not forming spores causing food poisoning and infections that lead to meningitis, pneumonia etc.

name: state insurance fund
subject: fund
definition: a fund that has been created and managed by the state so it can pay worker’s compensation benefits and awards.

name: state insurance fund
subject: fund
definition: a fund that has been created and managed by the state so it can pay worker’s compensation benefits and awards.

name: state comptroller
subject: supervising officer
definition: A supervising officer of revenue in a state government, whose principal duty is the final auditing and settling of all claims against the state. State v. Doron, 5 Nev. 413.

name: state comptroller
subject: supervising officer
definition: A supervising officer of revenue in a state government, whose principal duty is the final auditing and settling of all claims against the state. State v. Doron, 5 Nev. 413.

name: static decision
subject: decision
definition: A decision that is implemented and whose outcome is controlled b y the person making the decision.

name: statement of realization and liquidation
subject: document
definition: Document highlighting number of shares held by a firm and the n umber it would need to issue to generate income in time of a crisis financially.

name: statistical methods
subject: formula concept technique
definition: Mathematical formulas, concepts, techniques and concepts used to analyze statistics of random data.

name: statistical methods
subject: concept
definition: Mathematical formulas, concepts, techniques and concepts used to analyze statistics of random data.

name: statistical law
subject: scientific law
definition: Scientific law explaining a phenomenon in probability of occurrence of relationships underlying it.

name: statistical analysis
subject: underlying patterns
definition: Collecting, examining, summarizing, manipulating and interpreting quantitative data to see any underlying patterns, causes trends or relationships.

name: statistical analysis
subject: underlying patterns
definition: Collecting, examining, summarizing, manipulating and interpreting quantitative data to see any underlying patterns, causes trends or relationships.

name: stating part of a bill
subject: plaintiff
definition: That part of a bill in chancery in which the plaintiff states the facts of his case; it is distin- guished from the charging part of the bill and from the prayer.

name: status
subject: status
definition: The status of a person is his legal position or condition. Thus, when we say that the status of a woman after a decree nisi for the dissolution of her marriage with her husband has been made, but before it has been made absolute, is that of a married woman, we mean that she has the same legal rights, liabilities, and disabilities as an ordinary married woman. The term is chiefly applied to persons under disability, or per- sons who have some peculiar condition which prevents the general law from applying to them in the same way as it does to ordinary persons. Sweet. See Barney v. Tourtellotte, 138 Mass. 108; De la Montanya v. De la Montanya, 112 Cal. 115. 44 Pac. 345, 32 L. R. A. 82, 53 Am. St. Rep. 105; Dunham v. Dunham, 57 111. App. 407.  There are certain rights and duties, with cer- tain capacities and incapacities to take rights and incur duties, by which persons, as subjects of law, are variously determined to certain classes. The rights, duties, capacities, or incapacities which determine a given person to any of these classes, constitute a condition or status with which the person is invested. Aust. Jur.

name: status
subject: status
definition: The status of a person is his legal position or condition. Thus, when we say that the status of a woman after a decree nisi for the dissolution of her marriage with her husband has been made, but before it has been made absolute, is that of a married woman, we mean that she has the same legal rights, liabilities, and disabilities as an ordinary married woman. The term is chiefly applied to persons under disability, or per- sons who have some peculiar condition which prevents the general law from applying to them in the same way as it does to ordinary persons. Sweet. See Barney v. Tourtellotte, 138 Mass. 108; De la Montanya v. De la Montanya, 112 Cal. 115. 44 Pac. 345, 32 L. R. A. 82, 53 Am. St. Rep. 105; Dunham v. Dunham, 57 111. App. 407.  There are certain rights and duties, with cer- tain capacities and incapacities to take rights and incur duties, by which persons, as subjects of law, are variously determined to certain classes. The rights, duties, capacities, or incapacities which determine a given person to any of these classes, constitute a condition or status with which the person is invested. Aust. Jur.

name: statute of repose
subject: statute of limitations
definition: Statute of limitations applying the  number of years a party has after the contract is over to act.

name: statutory bond
subject: public interest
definition: A government requirement that contractors, businesses, and fiduciaries whose work affects public  interest maintain a security bond to ensure sufficient fortification in case the contract individual breaks contract.

name: statutory sick pay
subject: incapacitated
definition: A scheme of compensation where an employee who is medically incapacitated will receive a guaranteed minimum income for a set period.

name: statutory reserve
subject: reserve insurers
definition: A reserve insurers maintain to cover loss. It protects the company from going into insolvency.

name: statutory investment
subject: that body
definition: That a body with fiduciary responsibilities is allowed by law to make.

name: steep
subject: factor
definition: Factors making up the external environment of the organization such as economic, social, technological, political and ecological that affect decision making.

name: steelbotfr goods
subject: tenant
definition: In Scotch law. Corns, cattle, straw, and implements of hus- bandry delivered by a landlord to his tenant, by which the tenant is enabled to stock and labor the farm; in consideration of which he becomes bound to return articles equal in quantity and quality, at the expiry of tlie lease. Bell.

name: stealth
subject: stealth
definition: Theft is so called by some ancient writers. “Stealth is the wrongful taking of goods without pretense of title.” Finch, Law, b. 3, c. 17.

name: stay of action
subject: matter
definition: a term used when a case is postponed, usually until a matter pending is taken care of.

name: stepmother
subject: term
definition: the term that is given to the wife of a husband who already had children.

name: stepfather
subject: term
definition: the term that is given to a husband of a mother who already had children.

name: step-father
subject: man
definition: The man who marries a widow, she having a child by her former marriage, is step-father to such child.

name: steward
subject: word
definition: This word signifies a man appointed in the place or stead of another, and generally denotes a principal ofiicer within his jurisdiction. Brown.

name: stet bill a
subject: tlie question
definition: If the plaintiff in a plalut in the mayor’s court of London has attached property belonging to the defendant and obtained execution against the garnishee, the defendant, if he wishes to contest the plaintiff’s claim, and obtain restoration of his property, must issue a scire facias ad dis- probandum debitum; if tlie only question to be tried is the plaintiff’s debt, the plaintiff in appearing to the scire facias prays stct billa “that his bill original.” i. e., his original plaint, “may stand, and that the defendant may plead thereto.” The action then proceeds in the usual way as if the proceedings in attachment (which are founded on a fictitious default of the defendant in appearing to the plaint) had not taken place. Brand, F. Attaehin. 115; Sweet. STET PROCESSUS. Stet processus is an entry on the roll in the nature of a judg STEVEDORE 1110

name: stipital
subject: stipital distribution
definition: Relating to stirpes, roots, or stocks. “Stipital distribution” of property is distribution per stirpes; that is, by right of representation.

name: stipend
subject: salary
definition: A salary; settled pay. Man- gam v. Brooklyn, 98 N. Y. 597, 50 Am. Bep. 705.  In English and Scotch law. A provision made for the support of the clergy.

name: stimuli
subject: singular term
definition: Occurrences in the environment of an organism that effects its behavior. Singular term is stimulus.

name: stillborn
subject: stillborn child
definition: A stillborn child is one born dead or in such an early stage of pregnancy as to be incapable of living, though not actually dead at the time of birth. Children born within the first six months after conception are considered by the civil law as incapable of living, and therefore, though  they are apparently born alive, if they do not in fact survive so long as to rebut this presumption of law, they cannot inherit, so as to transmit the property to others. Marsel- lis v. Thalhimer, 2 Paige (N. Y.) 41, 21 Am. Dec. 66.

name: stock appreciation right
subject: privilege
definition: A privilege that is granted to holders of stock options who will receive cash or extra stock when the company’s stock appreciates in value.

name: stock register
subject: information
definition: The information relating to the shares of company issued stock.

name: stock purchase agreement
subject: stock purchase agreement
definition: A stock purchase agreement is a legally binding document between a shareholder and a company. This document contains information dealing with the amount of stock being purchased, how much the stock costs and how the payment will be made.

name: stock power
subject: document
definition: US document used when selling security or pledging it for collateral.

name: stock policy
subject: management
definition: Management’s written instructions about levels and locations of inventory that must be held.

name: stop limit order
subject: buying
definition: The buying or selling of securities once it reaches the stop level as opposed to the traditional stop order when securities are bought or sold at the market price.

name: stop limit order
subject: selling
definition: The buying or selling of securities once it reaches the stop level as opposed to the traditional stop order when securities are bought or sold at the market price.

name: stocks
subject: machine
definition: A machine consisting of two pieces of timber, arranged to be fastened to- gether, and holding fast the legs of a person placed in it. This was an ancieut method of punishment

name: stockless purchase
subject: arrangement supplier
definition: Arrangement where the supplier holds items ordered in its own warehouse to release them when required by a customer.

name: store
subject: storing
definition: Storing Is the keeping merchandise for safe custody, to be delivered in tlie same condition as when received, where tbe safe-keeping is the principal object of deposit and not the consumption or sale. O’Niel v. Buffalo F. Ins. Co., 3 N. Y. 122; Il.vnds v. Schenectady County Mut Ins. Co., 10 Barb. (N. Y.) 119.

name: straight commission plan
subject: method
definition: Method of compensating a sales person where no salary is paid only a percentage of sales. See straight salary plan.

name: stouthrieff’
subject: word
definition: In Scotch law. Formerly this word included every species of theft accompanied with violence to the person. but of late years it has become the rox siqnata for forcible and masterful depredation within or near the dwelling-house; while robbery has beeu more particularly applied to STOWAGE 1113

name: story stock
subject: stock
definition: any stock associated with a news item whose price is expected to move either up or down.

name: strap
subject: firm
definition: When a firm is long on one put and two call options with equal strike prices creating a spread to make use of market volatility to secure unlimited profit potential with minimal risk. Refer to strip.

name: street broker
subject: market broker
definition: A market broker who operates over the counter and not a broker from the stock exchange.

name: street broker
subject: market broker
definition: A market broker who operates over the counter and not a broker from the stock exchange.

name: stream
subject: word
definition: A current of water; a body of liowiug water. The word, in its ordinary sense, includes rivers. But Callis detines a stream “a current of waters ruuuiiig over the level at random, and not kept in with bauks or walls.” Call. Sew. 183,J 133. See Muuson v. Iluugerford, ii Barb. (X. Y.) 270; Freuch v. Carhart, 1 X. Y. 107; Miller v. Black Bock Springs Imp. Co., 99 Va. 747, 40 8. E. 27, 80 Am. St. ltep. 924; Armtield v. State, 27 lud. App. 488, 01 X. E. 093; Trustees of Schools v. Schroll, 120 111. 509, 12 N. E. 243, 00 Am. Kep. 575.

name: strike benefits
subject: union
definition: Union offered compensation to workers on strike.

name: stretchwrap
subject: shrink wrap
definition: Shrink-wrap is similar, a plastic film tightly wrapped around goods or packages. Not heat shrunk but tightly stretched.

name: strip development
subject: commercial development
definition: Commercial development where each establishment has road access and parking area  access. Also known as a strip mall.

name: strip development
subject: commercial development
definition: Commercial development where each establishment has road access and parking area  access. Also known as a strip mall.

name: strip development
subject: each establishment
definition: Commercial development where each establishment has road access and parking area  access. Also known as a strip mall.

name: strip development
subject: each establishment
definition: Commercial development where each establishment has road access and parking area  access. Also known as a strip mall.

name: subcontracting
subject: practice
definition: Practice in business where the main contractor hires more workers to help with the job.

name: subaltern
subject: oflicer
definition: An inferior or subordinate oflicer. An oflicer who exercises his authority under the superintendence and control of a superior.

name: submortgage
subject: person
definition: When a person who holds a mortgage as security for a loan which he has made, procures a loan to himself from a third person, and pledges his mortgage as security, he effects what is called a “submortgage.”

name: submortgage
subject: security effects
definition: When a person who holds a mortgage as security for a loan which he has made, procures a loan to himself from a third person, and pledges his mortgage as security, he effects what is called a “submortgage.”

name: subjective probability
subject: personal belief
definition: The numeric measure of probability reflecting the degree to which a personal belief indicates the likelihood of it occurring.

name: subpoena
subject: process
definition: The process by which the attendance of a witness is required is called a “subpoena.” It is a writ or order directed to a person, and requiring his altendance at a particular time and place to testify as a witness. It may also require him to bring with him any books, documents, or other tilings under his control which ho is bound by law to produce in evidence. Code Civ. Proc. Cal.

name: subscribing witness
subject: subscribing witnes
definition: He who witnesses or attests the signature of a party to an instrument, and in testimony thereof subscribes his own name to the document.  A subscribing witness is one who sees a writing executed, or hears it acknowledged, and at the request of the party thereupon signs his name as a witness. Code Civ. Proc. Cal.

name: subscriber
subject: one
definition: One who writes his name under a written instrument; one who affixes his signature to any document, whether for the purpose of authenticating or attesting it, of adopting its terms as his own expressions. or of binding himself by an engage- ment which it contains.

name: subscriber
subject: one
definition: One who writes his name under a written instrument; one who affixes his signature to any document, whether for the purpose of authenticating or attesting it, of adopting its terms as his own expressions. or of binding himself by an engage- ment which it contains.

name: subscbiption
subject: subscription
definition: The act of writing oue’s name under a written instrument; the affixing one’s signature to any document, whether for the puriiose of authenticating or attesting it, of adopting its terms as one’s own expressions, or of binding one’s self by an engagement which it contains.  Subscription is the act of the hand, while attestation is tlie act of the senses. To sub- scribe a paper published as a will is only to write on the same paper the name of the witness ; to attest a will is to know that it was published as such, and to certify the facts re-‘ quired to constitute an actual and legal publication. In re Downie’s Will, 42 Wis. 06, 76. i  A written contract by which one engages to contribute a sum of money for a desig- nated purpose, either gratuitously, as in the case of subscribing to a charity, or in consideration of an equivalent to be rendered, as a subscription to a periodical, a forthcoming book, a series of entertainments, or the like.

name: subscbiption
subject: attestation
definition: The act of writing oue’s name under a written instrument; the affixing one’s signature to any document, whether for the puriiose of authenticating or attesting it, of adopting its terms as one’s own expressions, or of binding one’s self by an engagement which it contains.  Subscription is the act of the hand, while attestation is tlie act of the senses. To sub- scribe a paper published as a will is only to write on the same paper the name of the witness ; to attest a will is to know that it was published as such, and to certify the facts re-‘ quired to constitute an actual and legal publication. In re Downie’s Will, 42 Wis. 06, 76. i  A written contract by which one engages to contribute a sum of money for a desig- nated purpose, either gratuitously, as in the case of subscribing to a charity, or in consideration of an equivalent to be rendered, as a subscription to a periodical, a forthcoming book, a series of entertainments, or the like.

name: subrogation clause
subject: provision
definition: Provision in liability and property insurance policies where the insurance firm acquires rights upon claim of a loss payment.

name: subscription warrant
subject: shareholder
definition: When shareholders can buy addon stock at lower than market price. They are usually given this ability based on the percent they have invested already. Refer to rights issue.

name: substantive coercion risk
subject: stock holders
definition: Probability that the stock holders of a company  mistakenly accept an offer that is under priced for stock as they don’t believe assertion of management of a higher intrinsic value.

name: substance over form
subject: method auditors
definition: Method auditors try to use in deterring costs that are based which liabilities and  assets are used instead of the way they are categorized.

name: substitutes
subject: person
definition: In Scotch law. The person first called or nominated in a tailzie (eutailment of an estate upon a number of heirs in succession) is called the “institute” or “heir-institute;” the rest are called “substitutes.”

name: substitutes
subject: person
definition: In Scotch law. The person first called or nominated in a tailzie (eutailment of an estate upon a number of heirs in succession) is called the “institute” or “heir-institute;” the rest are called “substitutes.”

name: substituted service
subject: service of process
definition: In English practice. Service of process made uuder authorization of the court upon some other person, when the person who should be served cannot be found or cannot be reached.  In American law. Service of process upon a defendant in any manner, authorized by statute, other than personal service within the jurisdiction; as by publication, by mailing a copy to his last known address, or by personal service in another state.

name: subvention income
subject: profit organization
definition: Amount of revenue that a not foot profit organization needs to keep to pay operating expenses.

name: suffragan
subject: bishop
definition: Bishops who in former times were appointed to supply the place of others during their absence on embassies or other business were so termed. They were consecrated as other bishops were, and were anciently called “chorepixctipi.” or “bishops of the county,” in contradistinction to the regular bishops of the city or see. The practice of creating suffragan bishops, after having long been discontinued, was recently revived; and such bishops are now permanently “assistant” to the bishops. Brown.  A suffragan is a titular bishop ordained to aid and assist the bishop of the diocese in his spiritual function ; or one wiio supplieth the place instead of the bishop, by whose suffrage ecclesiastical causes or matters committed to him are to lie adjudged, acted on, or determined. Some writers call these suffragans by the name of “subsidiary bishops.” Tomlins.

name: sucken, suchen
subject: whole lands
definition: In Scotch law. The whole lands astricted to a mill; that is, the lands of which the tenants are obliged to send their grain to that mill. Bell.

name: suicide
subject: act
definition: Suicide is the willful and voluntary act of a person who understands the physical nature of the act, and intends by it to accomplish the result of self-destruction. Nimick v. Mutual Life Ins. Co., 10 Am. Law Reg. (N. S.) 101, Fed. Cas. No. 10,266.  Suicide is the deliberate termination of one’s existence, while in the possession and enjoyment of his mental faculties. Self-killing by an insane person is not suicide. See Insurance Co. v. Moore, 34 Mich. 41; Weber v. Supreme Tent 172 N. Y. 490. 65 N. E 258, 92 Am. St. Rep. 753; Clift v. Schwabe. 3 C. B. 458; Knights Templars, etc., Indemnity Co. v. Jarman, 187 U. S. 197, 23 Sup. Ct. 108, 47 L. Ed. 139; Breasted v. Farmers’ L. & T. Co., 8 N. Y. 299, 59 Am. Dec. 482; Daniels v. Railroad Co.. 183 Mass. 393, 67 N. a 424, 62 L R. A. 751.

name: summary account
subject: ledger account balance
definition: Ledger account where the balance represents total of all account balances.

name: summary of significant accounting policies (ssap)
subject: organization disclosure
definition: An organization’s disclosure of accounting policies required by GAAP that must identify (1) accounting principles followed, (2) methods of principle application, (3) how methods affect financial position and (4) appropriateness of principles of accounting.

name: summing up,
subject: counsel
definition: on the trial of an action by a jury, is a recapitulation of the evidence adduced, in order to draw the attention of the jury to the salient points. The counsel for each party has the right of summing up his evidence, if he has adduced any, and the judge finally sums up the whole in his charge to the jury. Smith, Act. 157. And see State v. Ezzard, 40 S. C. 312, 18 S. E. 1025.

name: summing up,
subject: counsel
definition: on the trial of an action by a jury, is a recapitulation of the evidence adduced, in order to draw the attention of the jury to the salient points. The counsel for each party has the right of summing up his evidence, if he has adduced any, and the judge finally sums up the whole in his charge to the jury. Smith, Act. 157. And see State v. Ezzard, 40 S. C. 312, 18 S. E. 1025.

name: summary process
subject: process
definition: a process that is immediate amend takes place without any delay.

name: summary proceeding
subject: proceeding
definition: A proceeding in court where there is no jury present and a summary judgment is handed down.

name: summary possession action
subject: landlord property owner
definition: The legal action where the landlord, property owner or tenant takes possession of the rental property when they were wrongfully kept out.

name: summary possession action
subject: tenant
definition: The legal action where the landlord, property owner or tenant takes possession of the rental property when they were wrongfully kept out.

name: summary offense
subject: violation
definition: A violation of law that is considered to be minor where there is no trial or indictment.

name: summary offense
subject: violation
definition: A violation of law that is considered to be minor where there is no trial or indictment.

name: sunset industry
subject: industry
definition: An older and still important industry slowly losing investor favor due to falling capacity for generating employment and profits.

name: sunrise industry
subject: emerging industry
definition: An emerging industry gaining favor with investors and is expected to push further growth economically.

name: sundry debtors
subject: customer
definition: Infrequent or miscellaneous customers not assigned an individual ledger but grouped together.

name: sundry creditors
subject: supplier
definition: Infrequent or miscellaneous supplier not assigned an individual ledger but are grouped together.

name: superare rationes
subject: one expenses
definition: In old Scotch law. To have a balance of account due to one; to have one’s expenses exceed the receipts.

name: super-jurare
subject: term
definition: Over-swearing. A term anciently used when a criminal endeavored to excuse himself by his own oath or the oath of one or two witnesses, and the crime objected against him was so plain and notorious that he was convicted on the oaths of many more witnesses. Wharton.

name: super-jurare
subject: term
definition: Over-swearing. A term anciently used when a criminal endeavored to excuse himself by his own oath or the oath of one or two witnesses, and the crime objected against him was so plain and notorious that he was convicted on the oaths of many more witnesses. Wharton.

name: supersede
subject: court
definition: To annul; to stay; to suspend. Thus, it is said that the proceedings of outlawry may be superseded by the entry of appearance before the return of the exigent, or that the court would supersede a fiat in bankruptcy, if found to have been Improperly issued. Brown.

name: superintendent of insurance
subject: similar term
definition: Title given to the head of the insurance department. Similar term is commissioner.

name: supplemental
subject: something
definition: Something added to supply defects in the thing to which it is added, or in aid of which it is made.

name: supplement, letters of
subject: process
definition: In Scotch practice. A process by which a party not residing within the jurisdiction of an in- ferior court may be cited to appear before It Rell.

name: supervisory board
subject: internal committee
definition: When an internal committee nominates a board to decide how a management board behaves. It is the first part of the dual board system.

name: supply schedule
subject: company
definition: The method showing the differing amounts of products that a company needs to supply that is based on different pricing points.

name: supplies goods
subject: good
definition: Goods that are used to support manufacture but don’t become part of the product such as cleaning solutions, lubricants or drill bits.

name: supplies
subject: supply
definition: In English law. The “supplies” in parliamentary proceedings signify the sums of money which are annually voted by the house of commons for the maintenance of tlie crown and the various public services. Jacob; Brown.

name: support infrastructure
subject: supply
definition: The supplies and services needed to keep the day-to-day operations of an organization going.

name: support infrastructure
subject: service
definition: The supplies and services needed to keep the day-to-day operations of an organization going.

name: suppressed inflation
subject: government price control
definition: Government price controls used to disguise inflation on a temporary basis.

name: supportability
subject: characteristic
definition: The degree by which characteristics of design of a support or stand by system meet the needs of operation of the organization.

name: support level
subject: chart
definition: A chart showing the level a security or index can withstand market pressure. If it repeatedly breaches this adjustments will be made. Refer to resistance level.

name: surety bond
subject: insurer
definition: When an insurer agrees to finish a project even if the original party defaults. The three players are the principal performing the act, the surety who takes the place of a principal if default occurs, and the obligee who is owed the performance. Refer to

name: surety bond
subject: act surety
definition: When an insurer agrees to finish a project even if the original party defaults. The three players are the principal performing the act, the surety who takes the place of a principal if default occurs, and the obligee who is owed the performance. Refer to

name: surety
subject: surety
definition: A surety is one who at the request of another, and for the purpose or se- curing to him a benefit, becomes responsible for the performance by the latter of some act in favor of a third person, or hypothecates property as security therefor. Civ. Code Cal.

name: surgical operation consent for
subject: consent
definition: the consent that needs to be performed before a person can undergo an operation.

name: surgi-center
subject: facility outpatients
definition: The facility where outpatients receive surgical services.

name: surplus reinsurance
subject: automatic type
definition: An automatic type of reinsurance where the ceding company sends to the insurer a fraction of each risk exceeding their retention limit.

name: sus per coee
subject: word
definition: An abbreviation of “suspcndatur per collum,” let him he hanged by the neck. Words formerly used in England in signing judgment against a prisoner who was to be executed; being written by the judge in the margin of the sheriff’s cal- endar or list opposite the prisoner’s name. 4 Bl. Comm. 403.

name: survivorship annuity
subject: life insurance annuity beneficiary
definition: Life insurance annuity where the beneficiary is paid a sum monthly during their life or on the death of the insured.

name: surrogate parent
subject: term
definition: the term applied to a parent who is not a natural parent of the child but assumes the role of.

name: sutler
subject: person
definition: A person who, as a business, follows an army and sells provisions and liquor to the troops.

name: sworn clerks in chancery
subject: certain officers
definition: Certain officers in the English court of chancery, whose duties were to keep the records, make copies of pleadings, etc. Their offices were abolished by St. 5 & 6 Vict c. 103.

name: sworn
subject: term
definition: a term that describes having taken an oath, verifying something and attesting it to be true.

name: switched bill of lading (b/l)
subject: carrier
definition: Carrier substituted B/L for the original B/L with the terms of an L/C.

name: sympathy strike
subject: taking
definition: The taking of industrial action where employees of another firm or department will stop work to show solidarity with the striking workers.

name: symmetrical digital subscriber line (sdsl)
subject: line dsl
definition: A single line digital subscriber line, DSL, offering 2.3 Mbps of bandwidth in both directions over phone lines to a length of 10,000 feet with no repeaters. Also called High Speed digital subscriber line version 2, HDSL2.

name: symbolic logic
subject: mathematical disciplines
definition: Mathematical disciplines used to reduce rules of formal logic to those of algebra. Called mathematical logic.

name: synod
subject: synod
definition: A meeting or assembly of ecclesiastical persons concerning religion; being the same thing, in Greek, as convocation in Latin. There are four kinds: (1) A general or universal synod or council, where bishops of all nations meet; (2) a national synod of the clergy of one nation only; (3) a provincial synod, where ecclesiastical persous of a province only assemble, being now what is called the “convocation;” (4) a diocesan syn- od, of those of one diocese. See Com. v. Green. 4 Whart. (Pa.) 560; Groesbeeck v. Dunscomb, 41 How. Prac. (N. Y.) 344.  A synod in Scotland is composed of three or more presbyteries. Wharton.

name: synod
subject: council bishops
definition: A meeting or assembly of ecclesiastical persons concerning religion; being the same thing, in Greek, as convocation in Latin. There are four kinds: (1) A general or universal synod or council, where bishops of all nations meet; (2) a national synod of the clergy of one nation only; (3) a provincial synod, where ecclesiastical persous of a province only assemble, being now what is called the “convocation;” (4) a diocesan syn- od, of those of one diocese. See Com. v. Green. 4 Whart. (Pa.) 560; Groesbeeck v. Dunscomb, 41 How. Prac. (N. Y.) 344.  A synod in Scotland is composed of three or more presbyteries. Wharton.

name: syndicate
subject: group
definition: A university committee. A combination of persons or firms united for the purpose of enterprises too large for individuals to undertake; or a group of financiers who buy up the shares of a company in order to sell them at a profit by creating a scarcity. Mozley & Whitley.

name: synthetic lease
subject: agreement entity
definition: Agreement where an entity creates a company to take out a loan in order to buy property. The entity leases the property so that rent equals the interest of the loan. Principle is paid at maturity.

name: synthetic lease
subject: agreement entity
definition: Agreement where an entity creates a company to take out a loan in order to buy property. The entity leases the property so that rent equals the interest of the loan. Principle is paid at maturity.
