definition: Agreement where an entity creates a company to take out a loan in order to buy property. The entity leases the property so that rent equals the interest of the loan. Principle is paid at maturity.

name: synthetic lease
subject: that rent
definition: Agreement where an entity creates a company to take out a loan in order to buy property. The entity leases the property so that rent equals the interest of the loan. Principle is paid at maturity.

name: synthetic catastrophe bond
subject: issuer
definition: When a catastrophe bond allows the issuer to start bond transactions to protect from risk.

name: system engineering
subject: effort
definition: Efforts to (1)translate operational needs into system performance, (2) incorporate physical and functional needs in order to get an optimal design and (3) integration of all factors in order to meet performance, cost and schedule objectives.

name: system effectiveness
subject: extent
definition: Extent that a system is expected to achieve objectives within its environment.

name: system effectiveness
subject: that system
definition: Extent that a system is expected to achieve objectives within its environment.

name: system dependability
subject: probability
definition: The probability of a system or a computer will perform all puff its operations in its intended environment without any degradation that is significant.

name: system administrator (sys admin)
subject: issue login name
definition: Person responsible for maintaining and running networked computers and the network. Will install hardware, software; issues login names; maintain security; fix bugs and monitors the network.

name: system administrator (sys admin)
subject: issue login name
definition: Person responsible for maintaining and running networked computers and the network. Will install hardware, software; issues login names; maintain security; fix bugs and monitors the network.

name: systematic investment plan
subject: investor
definition: Setting up regular deposits of funds into set investments allowing an investor to buy shares at different prices and averaging the whole cost over time.

name: system access
subject: access
definition: Authority or ability to interact with a computer system that results in flow of information; way to input or output data from a sauce of information. Access implies authorization.

name: swing loan
subject: loan
definition: A loan of a short term allowing the home owner to purchase a new home before he has sold the first home. Also known as a bridging loan or gap loan.

name: surrogate
subject: n contract
definition: N contract is taken unawares, by which sudden confusion or perplexity is created, which renders it proper that a court of equity should relieve the party so surprised. 2 Brown, Ch. 150. Anything which happens without the agen- Q cy or fault of the party affected by it, tend- ing to disturb and confuse the judgment, or to mislead him, and of which the opposite party takes an undue advantage, is in equity a surprise, and one species of fraud for which P relief is granted. Code Ga. 1SS2,

name: surface water
subject: water
definition: Water that is naturally open to the atmosphere, lakes estuaries, reservoirs, seas etc.

name: summonitio
subject: party
definition: L. Lat In old English practice. A summoning or summons; a writ by which a party was summoned to appear in court of which there were various kinds. Spelman.  Summonitiones aut citationes null

name: summonitio
subject: court
definition: L. Lat In old English practice. A summoning or summons; a writ by which a party was summoned to appear in court of which there were various kinds. Spelman.  Summonitiones aut citationes null

name: suitors’ deposit account
subject: suitor
definition: Formerly suitors in the English court of chancery derived no income from their cash paid iuto court, unless it was invested at their request and risk. Now, however, it is provided by the court of chancery (funds) act, 1872, that all money paid iuto court, and not required by the suitor to be invested, shall be placed on deposit and shall bear interest at two per cent, per annum for the benefit of the suitor entitled to it. Sweet

name: suitors’ deposit account
subject: money
definition: Formerly suitors in the English court of chancery derived no income from their cash paid iuto court, unless it was invested at their request and risk. Now, however, it is provided by the court of chancery (funds) act, 1872, that all money paid iuto court, and not required by the suitor to be invested, shall be placed on deposit and shall bear interest at two per cent, per annum for the benefit of the suitor entitled to it. Sweet

name: suggestio falsi
subject: suggestion
definition: Lat. Suggestion or representation of that which is false; false representation. To recite in a deed that a will was duly executed, when it was not, is suggestio falsi; and to conceal from the heir that the will was not duly executed is suppressio veri. 1 P. Wins. 240.

name: suggestio falsi
subject: representation
definition: Lat. Suggestion or representation of that which is false; false representation. To recite in a deed that a will was duly executed, when it was not, is suggestio falsi; and to conceal from the heir that the will was not duly executed is suppressio veri. 1 P. Wins. 240.

name: successor
subject: one
definition: One who succeeds to the rights or the place of another: particularly, the person or persons who constitute a corporation after the death or removal of those who preceded them as corporators. One who has been appointed or elected to hold an office after the term of the present Incumbent.

name: substitute defendant
subject: name
definition: the name that is given to a person who replaces the defendant in a suit.

name: subscription policy
subject: each
definition: A policy that is shared by two or more usurers in order that they each assume a part of the risk.

name: subscription agreement
subject: agreement
definition: When the manager, issuer, and syndicate agree to sell at a lower price. The agreement outlines the details of this decision. Refer to syndicate agreement.

name: subject
subject: which affirmation
definition: In logic. That concerning which the affirmation in a proposition is made; the first word in a proposition. An individual matter considered as the object of legislation. The constitutions of several of the states require that every act of the legislature shall relate to but one subject, which shall be expressed in the title of the statute. See Ex parte Thomas, 113 Ala. 1, 21 South. 369; In re Mayer, 50 N. Y. 504; State v. County Treasurer, 4 S. C. 528; John- sou v. Harrison, 47 Minn. 577, 50 N. W. 923, 28 Am. St. Rep. 382. In constitutional law. One that owes allegiance to a sovereign and is governed by his laws. The natives of Great Britain are subjects of the British government. Men in free governments are subjects as well as citizens; as citizens they enjoy rights and franchises; as subjects they are bound to obey the laws. Webster. The term is little used, in this sense, in countries enjoying a republican form of government See The Pizarro, 2 Wheat. 245, 4 L. Ed. 226; U. S. v. Wong Kim Ark, 109 U. S. G49, 18 Sup. Ct. 456, 42 L. Ed. 890. In Scotch law. The thing which is the object of an agreement SUBJECTION 1116 SUBROGATION

name: sturgeon
subject: royal lish
definition: A royal lish which, when either thrown ashore or caught near the coast, is the property of the sovereign. 2 Steph. Comm. 19n, 540.

name: straw bail nominal or worthless bail
subject: practice
definition: Irresponsible persons, or men of no property, who make a practice of going bail for any one who will pay them a fee therefor.

name: strategic objective
subject: organization
definition: An objective broadly defined that the organization needs to achieve to make its strategy a success.

name: stockholder
subject: person
definition: A person who owns shares of stock in a corporation or joint- stock company. See Mills v. Stewart, 41 N. Y. 3S0; Boss v. Knapp, etc., Co., 77 111. App. 424; Corwith v. Culver, 09 111. 502; Ilirsli- feld v. Bopp, 145 N. Y. 84, 39 N. E. 817; State v. Ilood, 15 Bich. Law (S. C.) 1S6.  The owners of shares in a corporation which has a capital stock are called “stock- holders.” If a corporation has no capital stock, the corporators and their successors are called “members.” Civ. Code Dak.

name: stickler
subject: inferior officer
definition: (1) An inferior officer who cuts wood within the royal parks of Clarendon. Cowell. (2) An arbitrator. (3) An obstinate contender about anything.

name: statutory voting
subject: each common stock
definition: When each common stock is assigned one shareholder vote holding equal weight to director nominees. Refer to cumulative voting.

name: statistical power
subject: percentage
definition: Percentage or number indicating the probability that a study will obtain a significant statistical effect.

name: statistical power
subject: number
definition: Percentage or number indicating the probability that a study will obtain a significant statistical effect.

name: statistical power
subject: study
definition: Percentage or number indicating the probability that a study will obtain a significant statistical effect.

name: state of the case
subject: plaintiff
definition: A narrative of the facts upon which the plaintiff relies, sub- stituted for a more formal declaration, in suits in the inferior courts. The phrase is used in New Jersey.

name: starr, or starra
subject: room
definition: The old term for contract or obligation among the Jews, being a corruption from the Hebrew word “shctar,” a covenant. By an ordinance of Richard I., no starr was allowed to be valid, unless deposited in one of certain repositories established by law, the most considerable of which was in the king’s exchequer at Westminster ; and Blackstone conjectures that the room in which these chests were kept was thence called the “starr-ehamber.” 4 Bl. Comm. 200, 207, note a.  Stat pro ratione voluntas. The will stands in place of a reason. Sears v. Shafer, 1 Barb. (N. Y.) 40S, 411; Farmers’ Loan & Trust Co. v. Hunt, 16 Barb. (N. Y.) 514, 525.  Stat pro ratione voluntas populi. The will of the people stands in place of a reason. People v. Draper, 25 Barb. (N. Y.) 344, 376.

name: stamped security
subject: security
definition: A security that has had a feature altered and officially stamped to show it is an official change.

name: stachia
subject: woman
definition: woman leaving her husband of her own accord, and committing adultery, lose her dow- er, unless taken back by her husband of his own accord.

name: spread loss
subject: account
definition: Finite reinsurance where premium is paid to an experience account every year for the contracts duration. The account generates a rate that covers loss. If anything is left at maturation it is paid out.

name: spread
subject: factor
definition: A strategy whereby several financial factors combine to expose or protect the price of a commodity. Refer to bull spread, bear spread, effective spread, quoted spread, and realized spread.

name: splitting fees
subject: 2 or more attorneys
definition: a term where 2 or more attorneys will divide the fees.

name: split-off
subject: part
definition: When part of a firm is sold off, stock converts to shares in the new company.

name: specific excess reinsurance
subject: reinsurance contract
definition: A reinsurance contract used to cover excess loss that a primary carrier will not cover.

name: specific commodity rate
subject: example
definition: A rate applied to a specific class of commodity or single commodity. An example is flowers.

name: sowming and rowming
subject: which number
definition: In Scotch law. Terms used to express the form by which the number of cattle brought upon a common by those having a servitude of pasturage may be justly proportioned to the rights of the different persons possessed of the servitude. Bell.

name: solutione feodi militis par- liamenti, or feodi burgensis parliamenti
subject: writ knight
definition: Old writs whereby knights of the shire and burgesses might have recovered their wages or allowance if it had been refused. 35 Hen. VIII. c. 11.

name: solutione feodi militis par- liamenti, or feodi burgensis parliamenti
subject: writ knight
definition: Old writs whereby knights of the shire and burgesses might have recovered their wages or allowance if it had been refused. 35 Hen. VIII. c. 11.

name: sold note
subject: note
definition: A note given by a broker, who has effected a sale of merchandise, to the buyer, stating the fact of sale, quantity, price, etc. Story, Ag.

name: sold note
subject: note
definition: A note given by a broker, who has effected a sale of merchandise, to the buyer, stating the fact of sale, quantity, price, etc. Story, Ag.

name: socionomic
subject: that mood
definition: A science of social prediction suggesting that the mood of society drives the political and financial behaviour of that society.

name: social security number (ssn)
subject: government
definition: A government assigned number for people in the US under the Social Security System. Non US citizens can apply if they are temporary workers in the USA. Each number will be unique.

name: social security card
subject: card wioth person
definition: A small card wioth a persons own unique 9 digit number that was assigned by the Social Security Administration in the USA to every resident and temporary overseas worker.

name: socager
subject: socagium idem
definition: A tenant by socage.  Socagium idem est qnod servitum so- cae; et soca, idem est quod caruca. Co. Litt 80. Socage is the same as service of the soc; and soc is the same thing as a plow. SOCER 1094 SODOMY

name: socager
subject: socagium idem
definition: A tenant by socage.  Socagium idem est qnod servitum so- cae; et soca, idem est quod caruca. Co. Litt 80. Socage is the same as service of the soc; and soc is the same thing as a plow. SOCER 1094 SODOMY

name: socage
subject: socage tenure
definition: Socage tenure, in Engluud, is the holdiug of certain lauds in consideration of certain inferior services of husbandry to be performed by the teuant to the lord ol the tee. “Socage,” in its most general aud extensive signilicatiou, seems to deuole a tenure by any certain aud determinate service. And iu this sense it is by the ancient writers constantly put in opposition to tenure by chivalry or knight-service, where the render was precarious and uncertain. Socage is of two sorts,

name: small business administration (sba)
subject: group
definition: A group providing help to small businesses in the USA, from loan programs, coun seling, deuactional opportunities to contract negotiation.

name: situs
subject: place thing
definition: Lat. Site; position; location; the place where a thing is, considered, for example, with reference to jurisdiction over it or the right or power to tax it See Boyd v. Selma, 90 Ala. 144, 11 South. 393, 16 L. R. A. 729; Bullock v. Guilford, 59 Vt 516. 9 Atl. 360; Feuton v. Edwards, 126 Cal. 43, 58 Pac. 320, 46 L. R. A. 832, 77 Am. St Bep. 141.  Sive tota res evincatur, sive pars, habet regressnm emptor in venditorem. The purchaser who has been evicted in whole or in part has an action against the vendor. Dig. 21, 2, 1; Broom, Max. 768.

name: sitdown strike
subject: action
definition: Action that is taken by employees on strike where they stay at the place of work so non-striking employees can’t do their jobs as replacements.

name: sitdown strike
subject: employee
definition: Action that is taken by employees on strike where they stay at the place of work so non-striking employees can’t do their jobs as replacements.

name: single demise
subject: declaration
definition: A declaration in ejectment might containeither one demise or several. When it contained only one, it was called a “declarationwith a single demise.”

name: single demise
subject: declaration
definition: A declaration in ejectment might containeither one demise or several. When it contained only one, it was called a “declarationwith a single demise.”

name: single demise
subject: one
definition: A declaration in ejectment might containeither one demise or several. When it contained only one, it was called a “declarationwith a single demise.”

name: simulation method
subject: way company
definition: The way a company predicts investment behavior. This is done by running a trial and analyzing the records that result from it.

name: sicav
subject: investor number
definition: A European investment fund where investor numbers determines the amount of capital in a fund.

name: shunto
subject: practice
definition: A practice in Japan in bargaining for an annual wage where smaller firms follow patterns of wages of the larger firms.

name: short-term trend
subject: trader
definition: Any movement in the price an asset shows over a short period of time such as hours or days. Day traders try to profit from these trands.

name: short supply
subject: situtaion
definition: A situtaion that arised in a market where demand has exceeded expectations and stock that is able to be supplied.

name: short supply
subject: situtaion
definition: A situtaion that arised in a market where demand has exceeded expectations and stock that is able to be supplied.

name: shop steward
subject: officer
definition: The selected or appointed officer from the union who will represent his fellow workers in management discussions.

name: shareholder of record
subject: body name
definition: Also known as owner of record or stock holder of record. The body whose name is found to be registered in a share holder’s register.

name: septuagesima
subject: sun- day
definition: In ecclesiastical law. The third Sunday before Quadragesima Sun- day, being about the seventieth day before Easter.

name: semayne’s case
subject: man house
definition: This case decided, in 1604, that “every man’s house [meaning his dwelling-house only] is his castle,” and that an officer executing civil process may not break open outer doors in general, but only inner doors, but that (after request made) he may break open even outer doors to find goods of another wrongfully in the house. Brown. It is reported in 5 Coke, 91.

name: semayne’s case
subject: that officer
definition: This case decided, in 1604, that “every man’s house [meaning his dwelling-house only] is his castle,” and that an officer executing civil process may not break open outer doors in general, but only inner doors, but that (after request made) he may break open even outer doors to find goods of another wrongfully in the house. Brown. It is reported in 5 Coke, 91.

name: seller financing
subject: method
definition: A method used to generate sales where a seller gives the buyer the goods but retains the title to them until they are paid for with any interest that has accumulated. Paid off in regular payments.

name: seller
subject: one
definition: One who sells anything; the party who transfers property in the contract of sale. The correlative is “buyer,” or “purchaser.” Though these terms are not inapplicable to the persons concerned in a transfer of real estate, it Is more customary to use “veudor” and “vendee” in that case.

name: seller
subject: one
definition: One who sells anything; the party who transfers property in the contract of sale. The correlative is “buyer,” or “purchaser.” Though these terms are not inapplicable to the persons concerned in a transfer of real estate, it Is more customary to use “veudor” and “vendee” in that case.

name: seller
subject: correlative
definition: One who sells anything; the party who transfers property in the contract of sale. The correlative is “buyer,” or “purchaser.” Though these terms are not inapplicable to the persons concerned in a transfer of real estate, it Is more customary to use “veudor” and “vendee” in that case.

name: seller
subject: correlative
definition: One who sells anything; the party who transfers property in the contract of sale. The correlative is “buyer,” or “purchaser.” Though these terms are not inapplicable to the persons concerned in a transfer of real estate, it Is more customary to use “veudor” and “vendee” in that case.

name: section 125 plan
subject: plan
definition: A plan of flexible benefit that is named a section of the IRS tax code that allows an employees contribution to be matched dollar for dollar with pre-tax dollars.

name: section
subject: subdivision
definition: In text-books, codes, statutes, and other juridical writings, the smallest distinct and numbered subdivisions are commonly called “sections,” sometimes “arti- cles,” and occasionally “paragraphs.”

name: section
subject: subdivision
definition: In text-books, codes, statutes, and other juridical writings, the smallest distinct and numbered subdivisions are commonly called “sections,” sometimes “arti- cles,” and occasionally “paragraphs.”

name: sectatores
subject: suitor
definition: Suitors of court who, among the Saxons, gave their judgment or verdict in civil suits upon the matter of fact and law. 1 Reeve, Eng. Law, 22.

name: sectatores
subject: suitor
definition: Suitors of court who, among the Saxons, gave their judgment or verdict in civil suits upon the matter of fact and law. 1 Reeve, Eng. Law, 22.

name: seat (exchange seat)
subject: member
definition: A term referring to membership in a futures or stock exchange. Ownership is represented by a member having interest in the decisions governing a stocks operating profits.

name: sea waybill
subject: receipt
definition: A receipt for cargo ythat has been taken on board a vessel. It is not a document of title or a bill of lading.

name: scroop’s inn
subject: law society
definition: An obsolete law society, also called “Serjeants’ Place,” opposite to St. Andrew’s Church, Holborn, London.

name: scroop’s inn
subject: law society
definition: An obsolete law society, also called “Serjeants’ Place,” opposite to St. Andrew’s Church, Holborn, London.

name: scroll
subject: mark
definition: A mark intended to supply the place of a seal, made with a pen or other instrument of writing.  A paper or parchment containing some writing, and rolled up so as to conceal it

name: scrivener
subject: one occupation
definition: A writer; scribe; conveyancer. One whose occupation is to draw contracts, write deeds and mortgages, and prepare other species of written instruments.  Also an agent to whom property is intrusted by others for the purpose of lending it out at an interest payable to his principal, and for a commission or bonus for himself, whereby he gains his livelihood.

name: scrivener
subject: one occupation
definition: A writer; scribe; conveyancer. One whose occupation is to draw contracts, write deeds and mortgages, and prepare other species of written instruments.  Also an agent to whom property is intrusted by others for the purpose of lending it out at an interest payable to his principal, and for a commission or bonus for himself, whereby he gains his livelihood.

name: transferable
subject: word
definition: A term used In a quasi legal sense, to indicate that the character of assignability or negotiability attaches to the particular instrument, or that it may pass from hand to hand, carrying all rights of the original holder. The words “not transferable” are sometimes printed upon a ticket, receipt, or bill of lading, to show that the same will not be good in the hands of any person other than the one to whom first issued.

name: satisfied term
subject: term
definition: A term of years in land is thus called when the purpose for which it was created has been satisfied or executed before the expiration of the set period.

name: sanction
subject: say
definition: In the original sense of the word, a “sanction” is a penalty or punishment provided as a means of enforcing obedience to a law. In jurisprudence, a law is said to have a sanction when there is a state which will intervene if it is disobeyed or disregarded. Therefore international law has no legal sanction. Sweet In a more general sense, a “sanction” has been defined as a conditional evil annexed to a law to produce obedience to that law; and, in a still wider sense, a “sanction” means simply an authorization of anything. Occasionally, “sanction” Is used (e. g., in Roman law) to denote a statute, the part (peual clause) being used to denote the whole. Brown. The vindicatory part of a law, or that part which ordains or denounces a penalty for its violation. 1 Bl. Comm. 56.

name: sales forecast
subject: know
definition: The projected sales that are the result of the study of historical sales data, market trend analysis ans estimates of sales persons. Known as a sales budget, it is the basis of a business plan.

name: sales agency
subject: agent
definition: An agent will have a contract to sell om goods and services that are provided by a company. The agent will usually get a commission that is a percentage of the sales.

name: lammas day
subject: 1st
definition: The 1st of August It is one of the Scotch quarter days, aud is what is called a “conventional term.”

name: lake
subject: large body
definition: A large body of water, contained iu a depression of the earth’s surface, and supplied from the drainage of a more or less extended area. Webster. See Jones v. Lee, 77 Mich. 35, 43 N. W. 855; Ne-pee-nauk Club v. Wilson, 96 Wis. 290, 71 N. W. 601.     The fact that there is a current from a higher to a lower level does not make that a river which would otherwise be a lake; and the fact that a river swells out into broad, pond-like sheets, with a current, does not make that a lake which would otherwise be a river. State v. Gilmanton, 14 N. H. 477.

name: maiden assize
subject: no person
definition: In English law. Originally an assize at which no person was condemned to die. Now it is a session of a criminal court at which there are no prison- ers to be tried.

name: national institute for occupational safety and health (niosh)
subject: department
definition: US Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) established this specific public health service organization. This organization recommends occupational exposure limits for various substances, and does testing for the certification of respiratory protective devices and air sampling detector tubes.

name: national institute for occupational safety and health (niosh)
subject: organization
definition: US Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) established this specific public health service organization. This organization recommends occupational exposure limits for various substances, and does testing for the certification of respiratory protective devices and air sampling detector tubes.

name: national customs brokers and freight forwarders association
subject: company
definition: An international trade advocacy organization for companies to educate their members especially regarding legislative and regulatory issues. A large lobbyist group in the nation’s capitol. Members include freight forwarders, customs brokers, and other cargo agents, and their employees.

name: obloquy
subject: expose
definition: To expose one to “obloquy” Is to expose him to censure and reproach, as the latter terms are synonymous with “obloquy.” Bettuer v. Holt, 70 Cal. 275, 11 Pac. 710.

name: paper asset
subject: paper asset
definition: A paper asset is one that is recognized on the balance sheet, but it is of no use to the company, nor can it be sold for financial gain.

name: panel
subject: venire facias
definition: The roll or slip of parchment returned by the sheriff in obedience to a venire facias, containing the names of the persons whom he has summoned to attend the court as jurymen. Beasley v. People, 89 HI. 571; People v. Coyodo, 40 Cal. 592.     The panel is a list of jurors returned by a sheriff, to serve at a particular court or for the trial of a particular action. Pen. Code Cal.

name: pandemic
subject: pandemic
definition: A pandemic can be a disease, or a medical condition that has spread over a significantly large area. An example can be HIV.

name: pandemic
subject: pandemic
definition: A pandemic can be a disease, or a medical condition that has spread over a significantly large area. An example can be HIV.

name: panacea
subject: panacea
definition: A mythological term that is supposed to be the remedy of all illnesses and diseases. Similarly, panacea is also used to provide a symbol for something that can solve all of a person’s problems.

name: qualitative factor
subject: element
definition: These factors are used to highlight a company’s performance. These elements include items such as margins of profit, the style of management and product turn over rates.

name: qualitative data
subject: datum
definition: Data that is used to describe a product but not define its characteristics. Non- measurable data that does not include any weight or dimensions. It is information that has been collected about the reputataion of a product and how it is then perceived by the public.

name: qualitative
subject: reputation
definition: This describes a property that is associated with a certain item or product. It will describe the reputation, feel, smell, taste, image of a certain product. It can aslo be used to describe a persons leadership skills .

name: qualifying ratios
subject: individual
definition: The steps that are taken in order to determine if an individual meets the requirements of a lending institution for a loan. It also assesses their ability to pay of the loan in the future. The ratios exist between the money the person has to repay to the financial insititution compared with the  money they are able to earn.

name: qualifying child
subject: person
definition: A person under the age of 19 years who satisfies four requirements to qualify. They must live with the person claiming a tax benefit, be a child of them, a foster child or be a sibling of the person.

name: qualifying
subject: buyer
definition: A process that is used to ascertain if a buyer shows the right characteristics that will enables to act as a prospective buyer. These qualities include having the ability to purchase and the right to purchase.

name: qualified savings bond
subject: interest
definition: Any interest paid on this bond is not subject to tax if it is used for the purpose of a college education. It is a US EE bond purchased after 1989 by a person who has reached at least the age of 24 years.

name: qualified savings bond
subject: ee bond
definition: Any interest paid on this bond is not subject to tax if it is used for the purpose of a college education. It is a US EE bond purchased after 1989 by a person who has reached at least the age of 24 years.

name: sale and leaseback
subject: company
definition: When a company purchases an asset agreeing to lease the asset back to the seller so the seller appears more liquid.

name: sale and buyback
subject: financing
definition: Financing that is off the balance sheet where the owner sells an asset or property to an investor and he then buys the item back over a long term mortgage. See Sale and lease back.

name: sale and buyback
subject: financing
definition: Financing that is off the balance sheet where the owner sells an asset or property to an investor and he then buys the item back over a long term mortgage. See Sale and lease back.

name: talio
subject: estate
definition: the word “general,” in such case, implying that there is no other restriction upon the descent of the estate than that it must go in the male line. So an estate in tail female general is an estate in tail female. The word “general,” in the phrase, expresses a purely negative idea, and may denote the absence of any restriction, or the absence of some given restriction which is tacitly understood. Mozley & Whitley.

name: taking inventory
subject: process
definition: The process used to record how many of each ND every item is on hand.

name: tam quam
subject: venire
definition: A phrase used as the name of a writ of error from inferior courts, when the error is supposed to be as well in giving the judgment as in awarding execution upon It. (Tarn in redditione judicii, quam in ad- judicatione executionis.)  A venire tarn quam was one by which a jury was summoned, as well to try an issue as to inquire of the damages on a default. 2 Tidd, Pr. 722, 895.

name: target audience
subject: identified group
definition: The identified group of people who will be the recipients of an advertising campaign. See target population.

name: tare
subject: which seller
definition: A deficiency in the weight or quantity of merchandise by reason of the weight of tlie box, cask, bag, or other receptacle which contains it and is weighed with it. Also an allowance or abatement of a certain weight or quantity which the seller makes to the buyer, on account of the weight of such box, cask, etc. Napier v. Barney, 5 Blatchf. 101, 17 Fed. Cas. 1149. SeeTBET.

name: targeted jobs credit
subject: tax credit
definition: IRS tax credit used to encourage employers to hire people at high unemployment times.

name: target start date
subject: date
definition: The calendar date when a goal or project is to be started. The date is initially an estimate that adjusts as the day nears for the launch of the new endeavor.

name: tax
subject: sense tax
definition: In a general sense, a tax is any contribution imposed by government upon individuals, for the use and service of the state, whether under the name of toll, tribute, tallage, gabel, impost, duty, custom, excise, subsidy, aid, supply, or other name. Story, Const.Taylor v. Boyd, G3 Tex. 533; Morgan’s Co. v. State Board of Health, 118 U. S. 455, 6 Sup. Ct 1114, 30 L. Ed. 237; Dranga v. Rowe, 127 Cal. 500, 50 Pac. 944; McClelland v. State, 138 Ind 321, 37 N. E. 1089; Hanson v. Vernon, 27 Iowa. 2S. 1 Am. Rep. 215; Bonaparte v. State, 03 Md. 405; Pittsburgh, etc.. R. Co. v. State, 49 Ohio St. 189. 30 N. E. 435, 10 I,. I!. A. 380; Illinois Cont. It. Co. v. Decatur. 147 U. S. 190, 13 Sup. Ct. 293, 37 L. Ed. 132.

name: taverner
subject: seller
definition: In old English law. A seller of wine : one who kept a house or shop for the sale of wiue.

name: taverner
subject: seller
definition: In old English law. A seller of wine : one who kept a house or shop for the sale of wiue.

name: tavern-keeper
subject: one
definition: One who keeps a tavern. One who keeps an Inn; an innkeeper.

name: tavern-keeper
subject: one
definition: One who keeps a tavern. One who keeps an Inn; an innkeeper.

name: tax carryback
subject: tax benefits
definition: Tax benefits occured when losses are applied to tax liability for up to three years back. Refer to tax carry forward and tax umbrella.

name: tax holiday
subject: period government
definition: A short period when a government will remove taxes from some items  to encourage the purchase of these items. An example would be a tax free period before school goes back after the break.

name: tax holiday
subject: example
definition: A short period when a government will remove taxes from some items  to encourage the purchase of these items. An example would be a tax free period before school goes back after the break.

name: tax holiday
subject: example
definition: A short period when a government will remove taxes from some items  to encourage the purchase of these items. An example would be a tax free period before school goes back after the break.

name: tax foreclosure
subject: government
definition: Where a government will enforce a lien on property to pay taxes owed.

name: tax participation clause
subject: provision lessee
definition: Lease agreement provision where the lessee has to pay all or part of property taxes.

name: tax treaty
subject: agreement
definition: Agreement between governments in order to prevent tax evasion and double taxation by a resident of one state who earns income in another state.

name: taxable
subject: taxation
definition: Subject to taxation; liable to be assessed, along with others, for a share in a tax. Persons subject to taxation are sometimes called “taxables;” so property which may be assessed for taxation is said to be taxable. Applied to costs in an action, the word means proper to be taxed or charged up; le- gally chargeable or assessable.

name: taxable
subject: taxation
definition: Subject to taxation; liable to be assessed, along with others, for a share in a tax. Persons subject to taxation are sometimes called “taxables;” so property which may be assessed for taxation is said to be taxable. Applied to costs in an action, the word means proper to be taxed or charged up; le- gally chargeable or assessable.

name: tax, n
subject: con-
definition: Taxes are a ratable portion of the produce of the property and labor of the individual citizens, taken by the nation, in the exercise of its sovereign rights, for the support of government, for tlie administration of the laws, and as the means for con- tinuing in operation the various legitimate functions of tlie state. Black, Tax Titles,

name: tax-exempt security
subject: investment investor
definition: Investment where the investor does not pay tax on any earned profit. See double exemption.

name: taylor wage system
subject: compensation
definition: Compensation for work completed where the price paid per piece increases with the number produced. See Taylors.

name: taxation
subject: lr.it
definition: lr.it by certain persons termed “commissioners of sewers,” is not a parliamentary tax; whereas the income tax, which is directly imposed, and the amount also fixed, by act of parliament, is a parliamentary tax. Brown.

name: team stages
subject: team building
definition: Team building has 4 stages; Forming; Flailing; Norming; Performing.

name: technical inefficiency
subject: situation firm
definition: Situation where a firm can produce  more items from its input. See technical efficiency.

name: technical efficiency
subject: situation firm
definition: Situation where a firm cannot produce any more items from its input. See technical inefficiency.

name: technical architecture
subject: computer system
definition: Layer of architecture of a computer system defining parameters, interfaces and protocols  that are used by product and system architecture.

name: technical architecture
subject: computer system
definition: Layer of architecture of a computer system defining parameters, interfaces and protocols  that are used by product and system architecture.

name: technology assessment
subject: product
definition: Estimation of the effect a new product and process has on a firm’s operations, other firm, society and environment.

name: technology assessment
subject: product
definition: Estimation of the effect a new product and process has on a firm’s operations, other firm, society and environment.

name: technology assessment
subject: process
definition: Estimation of the effect a new product and process has on a firm’s operations, other firm, society and environment.

name: technology assessment
subject: process
definition: Estimation of the effect a new product and process has on a firm’s operations, other firm, society and environment.

name: telephone banking
subject: banking service
definition: Banking service offered via the telephone where bills are paid, funds transferred etc.

name: temporary
subject: temporary alimony
definition: That which is to last for a limited time only, as distinguished from that which is perpetual, or indefinite, in its duration. Thus, temporary alimony is granted for the support of the wife pending the action for divorce. Dayton v. Drake, 04 Iowa, 714, 21 N. W. 158. A temporary injunction restrains action or any change in the situation of affairs until a hearing on TEMPORE 1141

name: temporalities
subject: tliey
definition: In English law. The lay fees of bishops, with which their churches are endowed or permitted to be endowed by the liberality of the sovereign, and in virtue of which tliey become barons and lords of parliament Spelman. In a wider sense, the money revenues of a church, derived from pew rents, subscriptions, donations, collections, cemetery charges, and other sources. See Rarabasz v. Kalnit, SO Md. 23, 37 Atl. 720.

name: temporalities
subject: tliey
definition: In English law. The lay fees of bishops, with which their churches are endowed or permitted to be endowed by the liberality of the sovereign, and in virtue of which tliey become barons and lords of parliament Spelman. In a wider sense, the money revenues of a church, derived from pew rents, subscriptions, donations, collections, cemetery charges, and other sources. See Rarabasz v. Kalnit, SO Md. 23, 37 Atl. 720.

name: temporary investments
subject: business owner
definition: Transaction of a business owner making a loan to another person.

name: temporary investments
subject: business owner
definition: Transaction of a business owner making a loan to another person.

name: temporary injunction
subject: court
definition: The name for a preliminary restraining order stopping a person from carrying out an action until the court has made a decision.

name: tenant in fee simple
subject: person
definition: a person who possesses land or buildings for his life and for the life of his heirs.

name: tenant in fee simple
subject: person
definition: a person who possesses land or buildings for his life and for the life of his heirs.

name: tenant in dower
subject: term
definition: the term that is given to a widow who holds property by a virtue of the right of a wife to her husband’s property. See dower rights.

name: tenant at will
subject: name
definition: the name of the person who had a lease on a property and it has expired but he is still able to live there with the owner’s consent.

name: tender of amends
subject: offer
definition: an offer by a person who has committed wrong to right that wrong by paying a sum of money to the person he has wronged.

name: tenant’s fixtures
subject: phrase
definition: This phrase signifies things which are fixed to the freehold of the demised premises, but which the tenant may detach and take away, provided he does so in season. Wall v. Hinds, 4 Gray (Mass.) 256, 270. 64 Am. Dec. 64.

name: tenore indictamenti mitten-  do
subject: tlie record
definition: A writ whereby tlie record of an indictment, and the process thereupon, was called out of another court Into the queen’s bench. Reg. Orig. 69.

name: tenmentale
subject: number
definition: The number of ten men, which number, in the time of the Saxons, was called a “decennary;” and ten decennaries made what was called a “hundred.” Also a duty or tribute paid to the crown, consisting of two shillings for each plow- land. Enc. Loud.

name: tenmentale
subject: which number
definition: The number of ten men, which number, in the time of the Saxons, was called a “decennary;” and ten decennaries made what was called a “hundred.” Also a duty or tribute paid to the crown, consisting of two shillings for each plow- land. Enc. Loud.

name: tenmentale
subject: ten decennaries
definition: The number of ten men, which number, in the time of the Saxons, was called a “decennary;” and ten decennaries made what was called a “hundred.” Also a duty or tribute paid to the crown, consisting of two shillings for each plow- land. Enc. Loud.

name: tenentibus in assisa non on-  erandis
subject: writ
definition: A writ that formerly lay for hiiu to whom a disseisor had alienated the land whereof he disseised another, that he should not be molested in assize for damages, if the disseisor had wherewith to satisfy them. Reg. Orig. 214.

name: tenure
subject: tenure
definition: The mode or system of holding lauds or tenements in subordination to some superior, which, in the feudal ages, was the leading characteristic of real property.  Tenure is the direct result of feudalism, which separated the dominium directum, (the dominion of the soil,) which is placed mediately or immediately iu the crown, from the dominion utile, (the possessory title.) the right to the use and profits in tbe soil, designated by the term “seisin,” which is the highest interest a subject can acquire. Wharton.  Wharton gives the following list of tenures which were ultimately developed:

name: termination of trust
subject: trust
definition: Automatically terminated trust when it is fulfilled item purpose or of purpose becomes illegal, impractical, impossible or against public policy.

name: termination date
subject: 1.date employee
definition: 1.Date an employee will lose their job.2. Date of termination of something. Also known as expiration date.

name: terminating building societies
subject: society
definition: Societies, in England, where the members commence their monthly contributions on a particular day, and continue to pay them until the realization of shares to a given amount for each member, by the advance of the capital of the society to such members as required it, and the payment of interest as well as principal by them, so as to insure such realization within a given peri- od of years. They have been almost superseded by permanent building societies. Wharton.

name: territorial, territoriality
subject: territorial law
definition: These terms are used to signify connection with, or limitation with reference to, a par- ticular country or territory. Thus, “territorial law” is the correct expression for the law of a particular country or state, aituough “municipal law” is more common. “Territorial waters” are that part of the sea adjacent to the coast of a given country which is by international law deemed to be within the sovereignty of that country, so that its courts have jurisdiction over offenses committed on those waters, even by a persen on board a foreign ship. Sweet.

name: territorial property
subject: name
definition: the name given to the land and water that has a state has a jurisdiction over.

name: territorial property
subject: state
definition: the name given to the land and water that has a state has a jurisdiction over.

name: terris bonis et catallis re- habendis post purgationem
subject: clerk
definition: A writ for a clerk to recover his lands, goods, and chattels, formerly seized, after he had cleared himself of the felony of which he was accused, and delivered to his ordinary to be purged. Reg. Orig.

name: terris bonis et catallis re- habendis post purgationem
subject: clerk
definition: A writ for a clerk to recover his lands, goods, and chattels, formerly seized, after he had cleared himself of the felony of which he was accused, and delivered to his ordinary to be purged. Reg. Orig.

name: test fidelity
subject: close match
definition: Extent of a test duplicating conditions or performance of a task. Close match equals high fidelity.

name: testamentary guardian
subject: child
definition: the name of a guardian in a parent’s will who will look after a child’s inheritance and other matters until the child reaches age.

name: testimony  n  0  q  r
subject: second writ
definition: writ and the sheriff’s answer to the same, may be directed to the sheriff of some other county wherein the defendant is supposed to be, or to have goods, commanding him to execute the writ as it may require; and this second writ is called a “testatum” writ, from the words with which it concludes, viz.: “Whereupon, on behalf of the said plaintiff, it is testified in our said court that the said defendant is [or has goods, etc.] within your bailiwick.”  Ia conveyancing. That part of a deed which commences with the words, “This in- denture witnesseth.”

name: testimony  n  0  q  r
subject: second writ
definition: writ and the sheriff’s answer to the same, may be directed to the sheriff of some other county wherein the defendant is supposed to be, or to have goods, commanding him to execute the writ as it may require; and this second writ is called a “testatum” writ, from the words with which it concludes, viz.: “Whereupon, on behalf of the said plaintiff, it is testified in our said court that the said defendant is [or has goods, etc.] within your bailiwick.”  Ia conveyancing. That part of a deed which commences with the words, “This in- denture witnesseth.”

name: thanage of the king
subject: certain part
definition: A certain part of the king’s land or property, of which the ruler or governor was called “thane.” Cowell.

name: thanage of the king
subject: which ruler
definition: A certain part of the king’s land or property, of which the ruler or governor was called “thane.” Cowell.

name: thanage of the king
subject: governor
definition: A certain part of the king’s land or property, of which the ruler or governor was called “thane.” Cowell.

name: testis
subject: witness
definition: Lat. A witness; one who gives evidence in court, or who witnesses a docu- ment.  Testis de visu praeponderat aliis. 4 Inst. 279. An eye-witness is preferred to others.  Testis Inpanaris sufficit ad factum in lnpanari. Moore, 817. A lewd person is a sufficient witness to an act committed in a brothel.  Testis nemo in sna causa esse potest. No one can be a witness in his own cause.  Testis oculatus unns plus valet quam auriti decern. 4 Inst. 279. One eye-witness is worth more than ten ear-witnesses.

name: testis
subject: one
definition: Lat. A witness; one who gives evidence in court, or who witnesses a docu- ment.  Testis de visu praeponderat aliis. 4 Inst. 279. An eye-witness is preferred to others.  Testis Inpanaris sufficit ad factum in lnpanari. Moore, 817. A lewd person is a sufficient witness to an act committed in a brothel.  Testis nemo in sna causa esse potest. No one can be a witness in his own cause.  Testis oculatus unns plus valet quam auriti decern. 4 Inst. 279. One eye-witness is worth more than ten ear-witnesses.

name: testimony positive
subject: event
definition: direct evidence that an event has taken place or that an event has not taken place.

name: testimony positive
subject: that event
definition: direct evidence that an event has taken place or that an event has not taken place.

name: theft
subject: testimony
definition: evidence. Testimony is the evidence given by witnesses. Evidence is whatever may be given to the jury as tending to prove a case. It includes the testimony of witnesses, documents, admissions of parties, etc. Mann v. Higgins, 83 Cal. 66, 23 Pac. 206; Carroll v. Bancker, 43 La. Ann. 1078, 10 South. 102; Columbia Nat. Bank v. German Nat. Bank, 56 Neb. 803, 77 N. W. 346; Harris v. Tom- linson, 130 Ind. 426, 30 N. E. 214. See EVI- DENCE.

name: theory x and theory y
subject: responsibility
definition: 2 sets of assumptions by managers about employees and which can be self-fulfilling prophecies. Theory X assumes that (1) people won’t like work and will avoid if possible and (2) they need to be coerced , threatened or controlled to keep working, (3) no or little ambition, avoid responsibility, choose security above other things. Theory Y (1) Mental and physical effort is natural and people will be satisfied, (2) use own control and motivation to reach goals, (3) seek or learn to accept responsibility and (4) full potential is not used.

name: theory of the third best
subject: concept
definition: Concept of Economics where policy makers from governments will get better results if they favour general open policies and markets over specific ones.

name: theory of constraints (toc)
subject: method
definition: Methods and concepts used to achieve the most efficient material flow through a ‘continuous process improvement’, CPI.

name: theory of constraints (toc)
subject: concept
definition: Methods and concepts used to achieve the most efficient material flow through a ‘continuous process improvement’, CPI.

name: third party action
subject: situation defendant
definition: the situation where the defendant brings into the case a third person as he believes the person is involved with him in the law suit.

name: third-night-awn-hinde
subject: edward confessor
definition: By the laws of St. Edward the Confessor, if any man lay a third night in an inn, he was called a “third-night-awn-hinde,” and his host was answerable for him if he committed any offense. The first night, forman-night, or uncouth, (unknown,) he was reckoned a stranger; the second night, twa-niglit, a guest; and the third night, an awu-hinde, a domestic. Bract. 1. 3.

name: third party practice
subject: defendant
definition: a practice that will allow a defendant to bring a third party into a case.

name: third party logistics (3pl)
subject: arrangements firm
definition: Arrangements where a firm will outsource logistical operations to one or more specialist firms. See fourth party logistics.

name: third party letter of credit (l/c)
subject: agreement
definition: Agreement of 3 parties where first party establishes an L/C to favour the second party for a transaction performed by the third party

name: thoroughfare
subject: no exit
definition: The term means, according to its derivation, a street or passage through which one can fare, (travel;) that is, a street or highway affording an unobstructed exit at each end into another street or public passage. If the passage is closed at one end, admitting no exit there, it is called a “cul de sac.” See Cemetery Ass’n v. Meninger, 14 Kan. 315; Mankato v. Warren, 20 Minn. 150 (Gil. 128); Wiggins v. Tallmadge, 11 Barb. (N. Y.) 462.

name: thistle-take
subject: thistle
definition: It was a custom within the mauor of Halton, in Chester, that if, in driving beasts over a common, the driver permitted them to graze or take but a thistle, he should pay a halfpenny a-piece to the lord of the fee. And at Fiskerton, in Nott- inghamshire. by ancient custom, if a native or a cottager killed a swine above a year old, he paid to the lord a penny, which purchase of leave to kill a hog was also called “tliistle-take.” Cowell.

name: thistle-take
subject: thistle
definition: It was a custom within the mauor of Halton, in Chester, that if, in driving beasts over a common, the driver permitted them to graze or take but a thistle, he should pay a halfpenny a-piece to the lord of the fee. And at Fiskerton, in Nott- inghamshire. by ancient custom, if a native or a cottager killed a swine above a year old, he paid to the lord a penny, which purchase of leave to kill a hog was also called “tliistle-take.” Cowell.

name: this day six months
subject: which house
definition: Fixing “this day six months,” or “three months,” for the next stage of a bill, is one of the modes in which the house of lords and the house of commons reject bills of which they disapprove. A bill rejected in this manner cannot be reintroduced in the same session. Wharton.

name: threshold
subject: 1.boundary
definition: 1.Boundary if passed has different state of affairs existing. 2. Maximum or minimum value serving as a benchmark to compare and guide any breach that can cause a review of a situation or redesigning the system.

name: thzlohmamnus
subject: toll man
definition: The toll-man or officer who receives toll. Cowell.

name: thzlohmamnus
subject: officer
definition: The toll-man or officer who receives toll. Cowell.

name: thuringian code
subject: one
definition: One of the “barbarian codes,” as they are termed; supposed by Montesquieu to have been given by Theod- oric, king of Austrasia, to the Thuringians, who were his subjects. Esprit des Lois, lib 28, c. 1.

name: tie in sale
subject: buyer
definition: Arrangement of marketing where the supplier of a goods or service in demand sells it on a basis that the buyer will also buy another goods or service.

name: tie in sale
subject: buyer
definition: Arrangement of marketing where the supplier of a goods or service in demand sells it on a basis that the buyer will also buy another goods or service.

name: tide provision
subject: director
definition: When directors evaluate their poison pill defences every three years.

name: tigni immittendi
subject: wall
definition: Lat In the Civil law. The name of a servitude which is the right of inserting a beam or timber from the wall of one house into that of a neighboring house, in order that it may rest on the latter, and that the wall of the latter may bear this weight Wharton. See Dig. 8, 2, 36.

name: time is the essence of contracts
subject: other party
definition: a term where one party to a contract needs to carry out his obligation in a set period of time so the other party can carry out their obligations of the contract.

name: time immemorial
subject: period
definition: Period way back in time where there is no recollection or record to prove a custom, right or claim. In UK a statute of the year 1275 saying that time before King Richard I reign or 1189 was declared to be time immemorial.  Also known as time out of mind.

name: time immemorial
subject: period
definition: Period way back in time where there is no recollection or record to prove a custom, right or claim. In UK a statute of the year 1275 saying that time before King Richard I reign or 1189 was declared to be time immemorial.  Also known as time out of mind.

name: time series analysis (tsa)
subject: best estimate
definition: Technique of trend extrapolation based on an assumption that ‘ the best estimate for tomorrow is the continuation of yesterday’s trend’.

name: tinkermen
subject: fisherman
definition: Fishermen who destroyed the young fry ou the river Thames by nets and unlawful engines. Cowell.

name: title defect
subject: legal circumstance
definition: Legal circumstance hindering title verification and true owners identity.

name: title defect
subject: legal circumstance
definition: Legal circumstance hindering title verification and true owners identity.

name: title company
subject: business
definition: Business who determines the title to a property is clear and can provide insurance for the title.

name: tithing-man
subject: till
definition: In Saxon law. Tills was the name of the head or chief of a decennary. In modern English law, he is the same as an under-coustable or peace-of- ficer.  In modern law. A constable. “After the Introduction of justices of the peace, the offices of constable and tilliing-man became so similar that we now regard them as pre- cisely the same.” Willc. Const. Introd  In New England. A parish officer annually elected to preserve good order in the church during divine service, and to make complaint of any disorderly conduct. Web- ster.

name: tithing
subject: ten freeholders
definition: One of the civil divisions of England, being a portion of that greater di- vision called a “hundred.” It was so called because ten freeholders with their families composed one. It Is said that they were all knit together in one society, and bound to the king for the peaceable behavior of each other. In each of these societies there was one chief or principal person, who, from his office, was called “teothing-man,” now “titli- ing-man.” Brown.

name: tither
subject: one
definition: One who gathers tithes.

name: titulars of erection
subject: person
definition: Persons who in Scotland, after the Reformation, obtained grants from the crown of the monasteries and priories then erected into temporal lordships. Thus the titles formerly held by the religious houses, as well as the property of the lands, were conferred on these grantees, who were also called “lords of erection” and “titulars of the teinds.” Bell.

name: title jurisdiction
subject: term
definition: the term applied when the title to a mortgaged property is kept by the mortgagee until the owner has paid off the mortgage in full.

name: title jurisdiction
subject: owner
definition: the term applied when the title to a mortgaged property is kept by the mortgagee until the owner has paid off the mortgage in full.

name: tobin’s ‘q’ theory
subject: theory
definition: Theory in Economics of behaviour of an investment where ‘Q’ is the ratio of market value to replacement cost of share capital.

name: tobin
definition: A ratio expressing the earnings needed. If below a 1 it needs more cash flow if above a 1 it is doing well on its return rate.

name: tonnage-rent
subject: rent
definition: When the rent reserved by a mining lease or the like consists of a royalty on every ton of minerals gotten in the mine, it is often called a “tonnage- rent.” There is generally a dead rent in addition. Sweet.

name: tonnage
subject: tonnage
definition: The capacity of a vessel for carrying freight or other loads, calculated iu tous. But the way of estimating the tonnage varies iu different countries. Iu England, tonnage denotes the actual weight in tous which the vessel can safely carry; in America, her carrying capacity estimated from the cubic dimensions of the hold. See ltoberts v. Opdyke, 40 N. Y. 259.  The “tonnage” of a vessel is her capacity to carry cargo, and a charter of “the whole tonnage” of a ship transfers to the charterer only the space necessary for that purpose. Thwing v. Insurance Co.. 103 Mass. 405, 4 Am. Rep. 507.  The tonnage of a vessel is her internal cubical capacity, in tons. Inman S. S. Co. v. Tinker, 94 U. S. 238, 24 L. Ed. 118.

name: tolsey
subject: place merchants
definition: The same as “tollbooth.” Also a place where merchants meet; a local tri- bunal for small civil causes held at the Guildhall, Bristol.

name: top level domain name
subject: no country
definition: Unique internet address with designation showing country of origin determined by ISO 3155. If no country listed it is a US name.

name: tort property
subject: term
definition: the term that is used when one person interferes with a person who is enjoying his own property

name: torrens system
subject: system
definition: System of land registration where the government keeps all title and land records. Developed by Sir Robert Torrens in 19th century Australia that has been adopted by other countries.

name: total debt to inventory
subject: firm
definition: Ratio indicating if a firm has too much debt that is tied up with its inventory.

name: total count test
subject: maximum
definition: Total number of microbes in one millilitre of milk. Maximum is 20,000.

name: total reserves
subject: bank credit union building society
definition: Total of all deposits that a bank, credit union, building society is allowed to take in account as part of legal requirements for a reserve.

name: toxic dose
subject: quantity substance
definition: Quantity where a substance will produce a harmful effect. See toxic concentration.

name: toxic concentration
subject: gas
definition: Quantity where water soluble, gas or liquid will produce a harmful effect on a test species over a time limit. See toxic dose.

name: toxic concentration
subject: liquid
definition: Quantity where water soluble, gas or liquid will produce a harmful effect on a test species over a time limit. See toxic dose.

name: toxin
subject: sense term
definition: In its widest sense, this term may denote auy poison or toxicant; but as used in pathology and medical jurisprudence it signifies, in general, any diffusible alka- loidal substance (as, the ptomaines, abrin, brucin, or serpent venoms), and in particular the poisonous products of pathogenic (disease- producing) bacteria.

name: toxin
subject: sense term
definition: In its widest sense, this term may denote auy poison or toxicant; but as used in pathology and medical jurisprudence it signifies, in general, any diffusible alka- loidal substance (as, the ptomaines, abrin, brucin, or serpent venoms), and in particular the poisonous products of pathogenic (disease- producing) bacteria.

name: trade date
subject: transaction
definition: Date that a transaction takes place or an order is executed.

name: trade date
subject: transaction
definition: Date that a transaction takes place or an order is executed.

name: trade allowance
subject: producer
definition: Producer offered discount to marketers as a short term incentive to promote the firm’s products.

name: trade allowance
subject: producer
definition: Producer offered discount to marketers as a short term incentive to promote the firm’s products.

name: trade act of 1974
subject: congress
definition: US congress passed legislation allowing the fast tracking of presidential authority to negotiate in international agreements for trade and to reduce disputes of trade.

name: trade reference
subject: detail
definition: Contact and name details of businesses a firm does business with regularly that is used to verify the firm’s worthiness of credit.

name: trade finance
subject: process
definition: Credit that is supplied to manufacture, process, distribute goods and services.

name: trade finance
subject: process
definition: Credit that is supplied to manufacture, process, distribute goods and services.

name: trade fair
subject: trade event
definition: Large trade event where many manufacturers from an industry will showcase their products to wholesalers, distributors, retailers and end users.

name: trade-name
subject: trade - name
definition: A trade-name Is a name which by user and reputation has acquired the property of indicating that a certain trade or occupation is carried on by a particular person. The name may be that of a person, place, or thing, or it may be what Is called a “fancy name,” (i. e., a name having no sense as applied to the particular trade,) or word invented for the occasion, and having no sense at all. Seb. Trade-Marks, 37. Sweet.

name: trading floor
subject: area transaction
definition: Area where transaction of commodities, options and futures takes place.

name: traditional economy
subject: economy
definition: Economy using various means of social support.

name: traditional contracting
subject: common method
definition: Common method of contracting where the client chooses service providers for design of work and asks for bids on construction work.

name: traditional balance sheet
subject: balance sheet
definition: Balance sheet considering only tangible assets and not any intangible assets.

name: traditional balance sheet
subject: balance sheet
definition: Balance sheet considering only tangible assets and not any intangible assets.

name: traditio
subject: which owner
definition: Lat In the civil law. Delivery ; transfer of possession; a derivative mode of acquiring, by which the owner of a corporeal thing, having the right and the will of aliening it, transfers it for a lawful consideration to the receiver. Heinecc. Elem. lib. 2, tit. 1,

name: training needs analysis
subject: assessment
definition: Assessment of requirements of training a target group in terms of number of trainees; professional and educational background; level of competence; desired level of skills that will have ben acquired at the end of training.

name: training evaluation
subject: program
definition: Stage in  training cycle where the collection of data is done to see if the program is achieving its goals.

name: training concept
subject: summary
definition: Summary of a program or training course highlighting key features and benchmarks that learning performance is measured against.

name: transfer agent
subject: person bank
definition: Person, bank or trust company entrusted to issue, redeem and register securities.

name: transfer agent
subject: person bank
definition: Person, bank or trust company entrusted to issue, redeem and register securities.

name: transfer agent
subject: trust company
definition: Person, bank or trust company entrusted to issue, redeem and register securities.

name: transfer agent
subject: trust company
definition: Person, bank or trust company entrusted to issue, redeem and register securities.

name: transexual
subject: person
definition: a person who chnages his sex with an operation.

name: transferred intent
subject: principle
definition: a principle that states a person is guilty of a crime if he has injured or attacked a person he hasn’t meant to harm.

name: transferred intent
subject: person
definition: a principle that states a person is guilty of a crime if he has injured or attacked a person he hasn’t meant to harm.

name: transfer restriction
subject: clause
definition: Clause in shareholder agreement restricting freedom of the shareholder to sell shares.

name: transient
subject: transient person
definition: In poor-laws. A “transient person” is not exactly a person on a journey from one known place to another, but rather a wanderer ever on the tramp. Middlebury v. Waltham, 6 Vt. 203; Londonderry v. Landgrove, 66 Vt. 264, 29 Atl. 256.  In Spanish law. A “transient foreigner” is one who visits the country, without the TRANSIRE 1168 TRAUMA intention of remaining. Yates v. lams, 10 Tex. 170.

name: transient
subject: transient person
definition: In poor-laws. A “transient person” is not exactly a person on a journey from one known place to another, but rather a wanderer ever on the tramp. Middlebury v. Waltham, 6 Vt. 203; Londonderry v. Landgrove, 66 Vt. 264, 29 Atl. 256.  In Spanish law. A “transient foreigner” is one who visits the country, without the TRANSIRE 1168 TRAUMA intention of remaining. Yates v. lams, 10 Tex. 170.

name: transvestite
subject: term
definition: the term given to the person who wears the clothes and poses as a person of the opposite sex.

name: transumpts
subject: law action
definition: In Scotch law, an action of transumpt is an action competent to any one having a partial interest in a writing, or immediate use for it, to support his title or defenses in other actions. It is directed against the custodier of the writing, calling upon him to exhibit it, in order that a transumpt, i. e., a copy, may be judicially made and delivered to the pursuer. Bell.

name: traverse jury
subject: grand jury
definition: This term applies to the trial jury that is not the grand jury who offers an indictment but doesn’t try the case.

name: traverse
subject: defendant
definition: In the language of pleading, a traverse signifies a denial. Thus, where a defendant denies any material allegation of fact in the plaintiff’s declaration, he is said to traverse it. and the plea itself is thence frequently termed a “traverse.” Brown. In criminal practice. To put off or delay the trial of an indictment till a succeeding term. More properly, to deny or take Issue upon an indictment. 4 Bl. Comm. 351.

name: traverse
subject: defendant
definition: In the language of pleading, a traverse signifies a denial. Thus, where a defendant denies any material allegation of fact in the plaintiff’s declaration, he is said to traverse it. and the plea itself is thence frequently termed a “traverse.” Brown. In criminal practice. To put off or delay the trial of an indictment till a succeeding term. More properly, to deny or take Issue upon an indictment. 4 Bl. Comm. 351.

name: travel advisory
subject: government
definition: Government issued warning not to travel to certain destinations due to civil unrest or danger to travellers.

name: treasury
subject: store
definition: A place or building in which stores of wealth are reposited; particularly, a place where the public revenues are deposited and kept, and where money is dis- bursed to defray the expenses of government Webster.  That department of government which is charged with the receipt, custody, and dis- bursement (pursuant to appropriations) of the public revenues or funds.

name: treasurer’s remembrancer
subject: charge
definition: In English law. He whose charge was to put the lord treasurer and the rest of the judges of the exchequer in remembrance of such things as were called on and dealt in for the sovereign’s behoof. There is still one in Scotland. Wharton.

name: treasure-trove
subject: money
definition: Literally, treasure found. Money or coin, gold, silver, plate or bullion found hidden iu the earth or other private place, the owner thereof being un- known. 1 Bl. Comm. 205. Called in Latin “thesaurus inventus;” and in Saxon “fyn- deringa.” See Huthmacher v Harris, 38 Pa. 490, SO Am. Dec. 502; Livermore v. White, 74 Me. 450, 43 Am. Rep. 000; Soveru v. Yoran, 10 Or. 209, 20 Pac. 100, 8 Am. St Rep. 293.

name: treasure-trove
subject: money
definition: Literally, treasure found. Money or coin, gold, silver, plate or bullion found hidden iu the earth or other private place, the owner thereof being un- known. 1 Bl. Comm. 205. Yoran, 10 Or. 209, 20 Pac. 100, 8 Am. St Rep. 293.

Yoran, 10 Or. 209, 20 Pac. 100, 8 Am. St Rep. 293.

name: treasure-trove
subject: bullion
definition: Literally, treasure found. Money or coin, gold, silver, plate or bullion found hidden iu the earth or other private place, the owner thereof being un- known. 1 Bl. Comm. 205. Called in Latin “thesaurus inventus;” and in Saxon “fyn- deringa.” See Huthmacher v Harris, 38 Pa. 490, SO Am. Dec. 502; Livermore v. White, 74 Me. 450, 43 Am. Rep. 000; Soveru v.
